STBLKeyStringList.Text: {0.SimFirstName} has become a Ghost temporarily. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can enjoy all the perks of this new found form while they last, including Ghost Mastery! Ghost Mastery progression will be kept whenever {0.SimFirstName} becomes a ghost again.\n\nBeware that repeated Out of Body Experiences can lead to unseemly side effects—like actually dying.
Unless you calm that crow down right now by showing them some affection, odds are very good you'll meet a bad end if you provoke them again. Don't mess with the Crow Collective.
You are subscribed to Crow Facts. To continue this subscription, continue to send your Grim(tm) Standard Ascendant Crow on Reconnaissance missions.

We regret to inform that Smeagie yet again managed to get his head stuck in a trash bin while on patrol in Ward Park. Unfortunately, while we were able to provide immediate assistance in the matter the scene was spotted by one Dirk Dreamer who has shared an image of it to Simstagram. The image has gone viral.

Our crow comrades tell stories of a victory in their ongoing skirmishes with Mayor Whiskers. Approximately fourteen acorns gathered from Copperdale have been dropped upon the head of Whiskers at various points during the past week. His top hat has been dented. We repeat: his top hat has been dented.

The mallards of San Sequoia are abuzz: Whiteclaw, the famous albino alligator, has announced a permanent truce between all manner of fowl and himself. This likely bodes ill for the perch population. But this is not our concern, is it?
We bring dire news to you from Brindleton Bay. Mayor Whiskers and his army of clawed minions continue to menace the winged inhabitants of Whiskerman's Wharf. We must bide our time.

Word has spread through the Collective about a highly dangerous "Doodlepip" on the loose. Some argue this "Doodlepip" never existed to begin with, while others argue that line of thinking is exactly what "Doodlepip" would want you to believe. One thing is certain: we have our top birds on the case. Top. Birds.
The Free-Roaming Chicken Commune of Windenburg report that our dear friend Emily has been ill-tempered of late. Something in the water, we suppose - quite literally!
(From Socializing with a Sim from a Past Life)
(From Recognizing a Sim from a Past Life)
(From Socializing with a Sim from a Past Life)
(From Hearing about a Friend's Deathly Dream)
Sorry for your loss. On the Phone, {0.SimFirstName} can select Business and take Family Leave for a Bereavement day off.
This bed will never quite be the same, since a Sim has passed away while sleeping in it. Perhaps a bit of their spirit still haunts the bed...
Congratulations on receiving your Forensic Safety Certification!
Congratulations on achieving full certification in the Mortuary field!

Reaping is harder than it looks!

Successful Reapings depend the on Prep Work completed at the office prior to going out on assignment. Prep work includes interactions such as Practice Reaping, Researching Assignment, and Performing Scythe Maintenance.

The chosen Reap Style for Collecting a Soul also contributes to a successful Reap. Choosing a more difficult or lazy Reaping Style, like Collect Soul Flamboyantly, Collect Soul Like Grim, or Collect Soul Lazily, may result in a higher chance of failure. Choosing a safer Reaping Style, such as Collect Soul and Collect Soul Carefully, have higher chance of success.

As they say, If at first you don't succeed try, try and try again!
Grim greatly approves such a stylish reaping action!
{0.SimFirstName}'s investigation is going poorly, steering {0.SimPronounObjective} further away from the truth.
Grim doesn't appreciate the question. {0.SimFirstName} is flustered and further away from the answer as ever.
{0.SimFirstName} is making small steps towards the cause of death.
Grim gives excellent advice. {0.SimFirstName} is closing in on the cause of death!
Great forensics! {0.SimFirstName} has investigated the Sim and surrounding evidence thoroughly. Determine Cause of Death is now available for {0.SimPronounObjective} to confidently prescribe.

Sometimes Reapers have to deal with the emotional side of death. You have been tasked to handle an Emotional Reaping, which comes with the heavy burden of a loved one's cries to Revive the deceased. You will need to Listen to Plea before deciding to claim this Soul. Choose wisely.
A very skilled and respectful reaping that was a joy to behold!
Amateur hacking on display. Very poor.
For this period, Grim feels that an Above-Target rating is warranted.
For this period, Grim feels that performance is lacking with a Below-Target rating.
Congratulations on submitting your Reaping Self-Assessment. Grim will evaluate and provide measured feedback in due course.
Felt good about the level of service, despite the circumstances.
What an amateur send-off. Would give 0 star if possible.
Congratulations on achieving your weekly Souls Quota! What an accomplishment! A Reward may be collected from Grim's Box-O-Fun(eral) located in front of his desk.

There's an afterlife emergency! The Netherworld Portal has malfunctioned, causing things from the other side to spill over into this world. Grim really needs your help to get things back in order, hazard pay not included!
Unfortunately the weekly Souls Quota was not met. Better luck next time!
(From Failing to Meet the Soul Quota)
You have one day remaining to reach your Soul Quota before Grim reviews the reaping reports. Happy Reaping!
{0.SimFirstName} has given {1.SimFirstName} a Deathly Gift of:\n\n{2.String}
Someone is ALWAYS watching you <font color='#000000'>♥</font>
Can it be from a ghost? Grim? An Angling Ace with an impressive overstock problem? Who knows!
A gift with no sender? Hmmm that's unusual...

{0.SimFirstName} has earned extra Satisfaction Points for completing a level of an aspiration. With the knowledge that death is a certainty comes a heightened sense of urgency—it's best for {0.SimPronounObjective} to achieve what {0.SimPronounSubjective} can, while still around to enjoy the rewards of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} hard work.
{0.SimFirstName} spots a beam of light illuminating a hidden corridor.
Grim grants {1.SimFirstName} a reprieve from death and takes their prize of a Death Frog from {0.SimFirstName}.
{0.SimFirstName} was able to find a frog in the fountain! Unfortunately, it wasn't the Elusive Death Frog. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can continue the search after some time has passed.

{0.SimFirstName} found a rare Death Frog and has won the contest! Here are some Simoleons for your efforts. We also hear it's particularly phantasmal when cooked in the Boiling Death Frog Hot Pot recipe. In a good way, of course.

Festival Details: Every Mon, Wed, Fri 6PM to 11PM or every Tues and Thurs 10AM to 4PM by the central area next to Club Eternity in Mourningvale.\n\nFeeling overwhelmed or in need of support? The Afterlife Anonymous is your go-to sanctuary! Gather with fellow ghosts and sympathetic Sims for a support session. Share your experiences at the podium, enjoy comforting potluck dishes, and find solace in heartfelt conversations. Whether you’re a ghost or a grieving Sim, it’s the perfect place to find support and camaraderie!

Looks like you've already gotten this Moon's Whisper, Kiddo! Here's what you will learn about if you come back on each Lunar Phase: • New Moon: Whispering Glen Crater • Waxing Crescent: The Baleful Bog • First Quarter: Alice and her Offspring • Waxing Gibbous: Moppy the Goat • Full Moon: The Ancestor • Waning Gibbous: Specters • Third Quarter: Ravenwood • Waning Crescent: Me!

The Tree has magically taken care of all of {0.SimFirstName}'s basic needs! • Bladder: Contents evaporated. • Hunger: Belly is now full of something...kind of disturbing, but okay. • Energy: Not sure what magic is flowing in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} veins right now, but feelin' good! • Fun: If going into a tree and getting needs sorted out isn't fun, then what do kids today consider fun anymore? • Social: {0.SimFirstName}'s Internal monolog got externalized during the entire experience. • Hygiene: Bathed in sap and lookin' beautiful.

This tree was long gnarled and elderly, even before I came to find myself tied here somehow. It has a pull to it; it truly does seem like a guarding force that protects and watches over me. Sometimes, Sims will come and offer gifts to it. I've always felt as if trees could communicate with one another somehow, and after all this time...in a way, I think I can communicate with the Guardian Tree myself.

I used to understand what it meant when someone would ring the bell at that Bell Tower; surely it was used to summon the community and bring them all together to talk. But since I can't go to it, I can only imagine. When I hear it, I think of all the gatherings I've missed with my children over all these years.

Have you had a chance to find my little girl, Edith? You'll find the glowing well that she's made her home over in Crow's Crossing. I don't understand how it happened, but she has such a temper now. I promise you, she was a sweet-tempered, mild little girl before. I feel so sad that I can't travel to see her. If only I could be there to soothe her again.

Losing your loved one, even if they're still around as a Ghost Sim, can be hard no matter what. I admit that my approach has always been to just kind of act like things aren't so different after all. With a son in the equation, I guess my calculus was to just make it seem like it was a change but nothing dramatic.

After Kai died, it was hard to fully adapt and explain everything to Takama. We were able to heal a bit just by putting effort into customizing Kai's gravesite. Takama had a big part in it and we were able to put our own special touch for things that represented Kai the best. We even got to choose which urn or gravestone to use!

Kai being a Skeptical Sim probably seems absurd given, well, his circumstances. It's certainly interesting to be so sure that something doesn't exist when it's not only right in front of you, but it's literally who you are as well. We all have something we're stubborn about though, don't we?

Last time I took Takama to the Ravenwood Family Day, we went for a long walk afterward and ended up stumbling across Edith near her well. Takama was transfixed by her, but I really just wanted to get him out of there; I was pretty scared myself. That head tilt...

We moved to Whispering Glen when we wanted to have life at a slightly slower pace, and I absolutely love it here. The Final Draught is where I love to go to unwind after a long day—and I've even seen Sims hold wakes there. It's hard to miss the Ancestor cliff, though I make it a point to go out and observe it for a while anyway. I mean, you gotta go to the Moon Revelry festival sometimes, right?

I'm not sure if it's jitters since Kai passed away or if it's something else, but I have this feeling like Grim's on my tail, too. The other day I was hit by lightning and then, I was electrocuted when I turned on the TV! I was thinking about going stargazing in Whispering Glen, but I don't think that's a great plan.

The idea of Unfinished Business didn't really appeal or matter much to Kai before he died, you know. It's weird because he's so practical but also sure of what he wants that you'd think he'd have wanted to nail it down. Personally, that's not workable for me. I've wanted to make sure I get to do all the things I want to do in life while I have the chance.

After Kai died, Takama started wearing a crow outfit a lot. I remember Layne stopping by and asking what that was about and a lot of questions about how the family was handling grief. Grief definitely has a lot of permutations, doesn't it? But I think Takama wanted to feel connected to his father and that's that.

The Ancestor is probably the most beautiful part of Whispering Glen in my opinion. Scholars and scientists here claim it was an effigy of a long dead ruler, though considering how long I've been dead, even I don't know who carved it. Some local "paranormal experts" say the tears that the visage cries during the full moon can link back to the Netherworld, some just say it's flood water run off. Did you know it's the place people perform old rituals during the full moon? Ah, rituals. Just thinking about them warms my heart.

I swear, the way the Reaper Career has spread around here makes you wonder if it's actually a career choice or something a little more, well, consuming. I'll admit it, though, the whole reason I bought into it was because it meant I had a chance to look at those amazing scry bowls. Like, are those an amazing aesthetic or what?
My sister and her husband used to be dead like me; Tziporah resurrected herself with Ambrosia, and I've heard Radwan was Reborn at the Baleful Bog right here in our Mourningvale!

It's awkward being distant from a sibling you don't even dislike, but Tziporah and I just haven't gotten along for a while. I'm not sure if you realize this, but she was a ghost too for a long, long time before she decided to take ambrosia. It almost felt like a betrayal, given how long we were together. To make things worse, she wants me to take ambrosia now, too. Why? What's wrong with my life the way it is now?

Some Sims can be so cruel or uncaring. I've heard them tell stories about that poor, dear ghost by the Guardian Tree. Alice is her name, you know. She lost one of her children in an especially tragic way, but she's missing all of her children. But the way the stories spin it is all wrong! They talk about her like she's terrifying and unapproachable. I'm sure that if you just helped her by talking to her and seeing if there's anything that would help her be more at peace, they'd find a version of Alice that's rather changed from the "scary" ghost story Sims tell.

Waylon and I are "old" friends, and by old I mean we've both been dead a very, very, very long time. We're close, but I know full well that he's a little excessive. Did you know he writes the script for the "Ravenwood Welcoming Committee" and anyone on it has to read it? The guy's just a wee bit, well, insufferable.

Way back when I was still living, I wanted to know everything I could about the ghostly world. Now, of course, I'm literally a ghost so I suppose it seems as if I know all there is to know. I still really wanted to dabble in Ghost History, to feel like I'm truly the most knowledgeable ghostie I can be. Mainly because I can't stand the thought of Waylon lording that over me. Waylon! You're not in charge of everything around here! Chill out!

Oh! Have you met Lady Ravendancer yet? She's such an idol, I love her. We go way, way, way back. Modern mortals don't know much about her other than that she is a renowned spellcaster and tarot card reader. She once had a legion of followers named The Order of Lenore that has since dwindled over the years. She has ties to the Gomes family, did you know? Some of her followers still exist, I love watching them search for her tarot deck.

Ekade is pushing me to start trying to talk to other Sims about my "condition" after our crow attacked me. I've been going to Afterlife Anonymous to try and understand Ghost Sims, but I confess that I'm as confused as ever. They keep acting like I'm one of them!

I love birds, and our pet crow is practically like another child to me. I've spent years researching their history from Grim's aviary to the way their "crow collective" behaves. Unfortunately, I also pushed too hard when trying to understand what happens if you provoke them. It was a terrible mistake, and I regret it in more ways than one.

I confess, I don't like opening up a lot unless I know people well. You seem mostly harmless, but I like to make sure I know all the ins and outs of a situation or a person before I get too involved. Plus, around here you get a lot of ghost nonsense pushed on you if you talk to the wrong people. I don't believe in ghosts, really, and don't want them around even if they do exist. You saw my sign, right?

I bet you joke about it behind my back a bit, but of course I am working on settling with the reality of my situation after I was attacked by a crow. Sometimes a Sim can know the truth of a thing in their heart but it's just too shameful or difficult to show it outwardly. I'm working on it, but while some personality traits can feel really changeable, sometimes it's hard to make yourself want to change.

That Waylon Warez weirdo over by the crypts has annoyed me for years. I don't care what he's trying to foist on gullible buyers, I've got better things to do with my time. Do I seem like a guy who wants to be friends with many ghosts?

Some say people meet and be together in more than one lifetime. That feels a little overly optimistic to me, but I've heard that it does indeed exist. What I was told is that it would take a lot of work to convince your former loved one. It seems far-fetched, but as I said: I've heard about it from Sims I know!

I've been friendly with Layne for a long time. Did you know the first band he had was a cottagecore deal? You should have seen the outfits he had. "Galloping Goat Graces" was the first song he put out.

My mind must be playing tricks on me, given that these things couldn't possibly exist, but after my accident it's almost like I have new...abilities. They felt like some sort of evil manifestation; if such abilities were real, I wonder if they'd all be evil, or if some might be more benign. But how would you even get them? After all, ghosts don't exist!

I hope you don't feel like you got the rug yanked out from under you. I wouldn't have talked to you about who I am if I didn't like you and trust you. I guess I'm just a bit weirder than expected, though, right?

I was out for a stroll and caught a ghost Sim using their abilities right out in the street. It tickles me a little to see them possess musical objects, which I've also seen when invited over to spend time with a ghost. It's hard not to envy powers like those.
Do you ever hear an inner voice telling you to be mean? I mean, certainly that's something every Sim experiences, isn't it? But how often is the real question, isn't it?
I suppose you've been talking to other Sims about me, huh. I can sort of tell. People will whisper about me a lot when I'm out with Olive. If they're scandalized, too bad!

If you stop by the Baleful Bog, you can temporarily become a Ghost. I've got a pet Death Frog for a similar reason, though I confess: it makes me feel a little odd to merely pretend to be a ghost. My motto as a musician is that if you're gonna go for it, you should go all the way!
Can you believe that when Olive and I first met up—at the cemetery, naturally—she had no idea I'm a musician? It was refreshing to run into someone who doesn't know you before they know you.

I've always felt a strange pull towards death. It never felt right to admit, but what I was drawn towards wasn't just the, well, grim idea of death so much as the potency of seeing a spectrum of existence around it. There's an event, Celebration of Life, that happens in Crow's Crossing sometimes. I'll visit to get a taste of the other side of death; the moment when the living gather to bask in remembrances of you.

Have you ever dabbled in Thanatology? I find it fascinating; I suppose it just lends an even more mysterious air to me, but I can't help but find it compelling. You've heard that you can eventually make Soul Soup, yes?

I'm highly competitive, had I told you that before? The thought of a game where your very life hangs in the balance is maybe a little bit more thrilling than it should be for a guy like me. I'd heard that you could challenge Grim himself to a chess game. But, as I said, I'm competitive. I seem to have a real knack for winning, for good or ill.

I've noticed those little green fellas over by the swing sets in Crow's Crossing, and I've also noticed that a couple houses elsewhere here seem to have a lot going on. I'm dying, practically dying, to spend time in haunted places.

Radwan and I used to date way back when, you know. He's a sweet guy, but in the end we just weren't totally compatible. I think he wanted to settle down into a quiet family life. Funny how things turn out; his settled down family life involves that absolute whirlwind of a woman, Tziporah. They make a great couple, though.

My future stepfather is such a weirdo. Explain this: one day, the Sim's out by the crypt in Crow's Crossing looking at the gravesite for one of my mom's dead husbands. What is that all about? I saw him pat the headstone and smile affectionately. Creep alert!

Hey, did you know you can catch these really cool Death Frogs around Ravenwood? I have the best luck in the cemetery. I love frogs, y'know. My mom jokes about how I'm a big collector of things. You can catch me around sometimes at festivals, even. Hit me up at Ravenwood Family Day and we'll talk frog.

It probably seems weird but since there's been a lot of, uh, death in my family over time, even before I was around, I end up feeling pretty close to death. I mean, mom's career kinda adds to that. But what I mean is, I'm in those crypts a lot just wandering around and thinking. I'd say it's a great place to get away from my soon-to-be-stepdad, but I can't tell you how often I see him leaving the crypts right when I'm stopping by.

I've honestly been really lonely since my best friend Pascal moved. I mean the guy basically disappeared off the map! Deleted his Social Bunny and everything. It's how I ended up talking to Edith so much. I kept going for walks all by myself and trying to talk to her. Not like I had anyone else, you know?

Everybody seems to have theories about who my real dad is, like it's their business. The funny thing is, sometimes when I'm walking around, I'll see a weird reflection of a black cloak behind me. I feel a really strange tie to the idea of death and reaping. Wait, not creepy like that, I mean...well, just the idea of Grim is something, huh?

Zelmira got way into that tarot stuff a while back and got me all interested in the Order of Lenore stuff. You know about that, right? It was appealing to me, cuz I feel like I'm just always in some random danger that I can't predict or understand. Tarot gives me a sense of order, I think? Or it makes things feel less chaotic. Whatever, I just like it a lot. You've gotten cards and seen the tomes around Ravenwood and all that, right?

The other day, the TV was on the fritz and it electrocuted me. Out of nowhere, there's Layne just standing there saying, "Watch yourself, kid, you'll die of electrocution if you're not careful" in this dreamy voice. I wonder if all his little fans know that the eccentric musician act is absolutely not an act.

You found out the truth about Layne, right? That guy's supposed to be my new dad. Yeah right! Like I want touching father/son moments with a freak-o-rama who wants my mom to turn him into a ghost. Uh, let's not unpack anything you think you know about my mom, okay? We're not touching that.
I've been a Mortician for years! My poor—and quite dearly missed—husbands met some...unfortunate ends and I really felt a calling to the craft. You know, we're always looking for new recruits!

My philosophy when it comes to décor is that if you're not making sure your place has personality, you're not living. Or a ghost either. Not my point. But anyway, I'm sure some places have more personality than most. My house has a serious issue with flickering lights, doors slammed by someone other than Nyon, and a TV that changes to static. It's odd, almost as if I'm haunted. Though why on earth should I be? My former husbands, all absolute dears, are resting quite peacefully!

I feel so bad about Zuleika dying like that, from her own plant no less! It's not like I lost her completely, but it's not the same to hang out with a ghost. Still, we try to talk whenever she stops back by Crow's Crossing. She doesn't ask a lot of questions about my past, which is very refreshing given, well, you know.

Just before we moved to Crow's Crossing, we were warned that it's a little on the lively side. I have to say, we were not warned that a memorial cannon is occasionally fired. That might have been appreciated! I've chosen to stay away from that well not too far from us too; I've heard what sounded like a child shrieking or having some sort of tantrum last time I came close and I just thought, "You know what? I don't need a shrieking child in my life, thank you very much."
More than once, I've walked into a room to see Layne just staring at the TV. He's been transfixed by the Static TV channel. Wouldn't you think he has better things to do? He seems mesmerized by it.

Nyon's been more distant with me these days. I guess that's just what happens with a lot of teenagers, but he's also been asking a lot of questions about his dad and about my past as well. Personally, I'd rather leave the past dead and buried. Wouldn't you?

Because the cemetery isn't far from me, I visit often. I feel like I'm quite acquainted with the dead, and it's calming to see the gravesites tended to. I'll often just peer into the pond. Layne, though, he's gone straight for that pond when he's visited. He caught a frog out of it one night; peculiar little thing.

Have you seen that strange Bell Tower in Mourningvale? I'd heard once that people used to gather whenever someone rang its bell. I wonder if that's true? It makes me feel so odd whenever I walk past it.

Tziporah and I got married after she took ambrosia. She just really wasn't into being a ghost. I can't blame her—I sure don't want her to be one, either. I just wish she was a little bit less of a klutz. I feel like Grim's always just around the corner from our place.

Oh! You've heard the story about Moppy, that goat statue in Crow's Crossing, right? It's this whole local legend thing. Apparently some medieval nomads were off in search of sustenance when they ran into an odd woman who claimed she could read Tarot cards. Ravendancer, I think. The wandering souls were so enthralled by her that they felt as if they'd been enchanted. When they came across a goat, they thought it must be magical in some way and chased it instead of catching it to eat it. The goat led them to a bountiful land—this one! Over the years, the legend of Moppy—the goat who led them to good fortune—has been told over and over again.

You know Zelmira's gotten really into tarot, right? They've even started giving readings to other Sims at the Thinned Festiveil. They're an unusual Sim; really passionate about some of the darker or more Macabre aspects of life, but always fun to be around.

I've had this strange sense about myself my whole life, as if I've walked similar steps before but in a completely different existence. Like some of these experiences are ones I've had before, yes? You've heard of Deja Vu, of course. There have always been rumors about the Baleful Bog being a place of renewal, of rebirth. Imagine living another life, though. I already feel like I've lived two lives just in this body!

No one likes talking about end-of-life things, I get it. Though I like to think if we're honest about what matters to us, it helps our family more later on. That's why I always remind people that it's better to head over to the Town Hall sooner rather than later to meet up with an attorney to get your Will all sorted. It's easier than you think.

Each Sim has their own unique perspective on life and the life thereafter. Sometimes we want to be with those who reflect our beliefs back, but sometimes we also thrive in our differences while embracing our similarities. Tziporah's beliefs are somewhat different than my own, but we share so many other common values. I feel like she's a Sim I've known past my own life, if you understand what I mean.

Would you believe there are people around that still associate me with the founding of this lovely little area? Picture it: Ages ago, right here in Ravenwood, well before anything was here of course, I'm just traipsing along minding my own business when suddenly I turn around, and these filthy, hungry Sims were following me! I, of course, took pity and gave them a Tarot Reading. Eventually they got distracted by some stray goat and left me alone.

Once a week—on Wednesdays, I believe—the living and the dead gather together to celebrate the link between their worlds at the Thinned Festiveil. Of course, one must bring a gift for the tree if they attend! My relative, Zelmira, has given tarot readings there before. They certainly have a flair for it!

The interesting thing about being a ghost is that a lot of time can pass in a blink. Back when this area was named after Ravens, it made sense; my family was on the ascendance and there were ravens, not crows. Now, time has passed and I see that the crows from Grim's aviary have taken over. Perhaps a century from now, it will be back in the hands (or talons) of ravens!

Zelmira Gomes was able to summon me once they'd collected all of my special Tarot cards. What an interesting individual; of course, our family tree has intertwined roots going all the way back to Lolita Goth, so it makes sense that there some commonalities between us.

I have an absolutely scandalous secret to tell you! I'm sure you've heard of the Moon Revelry festival before, yes? It's in Whispering Glen, right near that rock they call the Ancestor. Well, apparently some Sims think it's best enjoyed au naturale on the Full Moon. Can you imagine? Personally, I'm only there to stargaze. I'd never dream of moonbathing without clothing!

Radwan is so protective of me at times. Honestly, even a little overprotective. He's behaving as if I'm just around the corner from dying again, and I know he doesn't want to lose me. It's sweet, but a little frustrating. Then again, I do seem to have absolutely rotten luck. I didn't know that provoking crows is a bad idea, so I did that recently and it almost killed me right off the bat. What kind of luck is that?

All the friction I have with Esther is so frustrating for me. I just want xer to understand why it's so important for xer to live again. Xie thinks being dead is fine, and that the abilities xie has make it even better, but I can't accept it. Because I can write, I decided that I would work towards being able to write a Book of Life. When I have one, I'll be able to convince xer to come back. I know it. Esther will understand someday.

Whispering Glen is so peaceful. There's a little telescope that looks out over the countryside that I'll walk to on clear nights to go stargazing. Radwan warns me off it, because he's paranoid I'll be hit by a meteor. But who wouldn't want to take in a view like that? Sometimes I'll just walk around by the stone ruins thinking about what I want to write about next.

Our family history has been convoluted over the years, to put it mildly. At least my grandfather had the good sense to start deciding which items should be considered Heirlooms for the family so they could be divvied up properly. My father? Not so much, and when my sister and I passed away it was a mess. Now that I have my second chance at life and all of that, I'm leaving a better example for Zelmira. I want them to feel a connection to all the things that matter to me enough to consider a part of our family story.

I'm not a direct descendent of the Goth family, but we do have a common ancestor from way back when. The Gomes family has had a long line since then. Radwan took my name to embrace that, since he was just starting on a different phase in his life and wanted to change his name altogether.

Did you know that I spearhead the Ravenwood Welcoming Committee? That's right, sometimes I sacrifice a day's worth of vital sales just to show up with Pan de Muerto and regale you with wonderful information about the community. I usually rope a few other folks into coming with me. Everyone complains about the script I wrote, but I'm a guy who feels that anything worth doing is worth doing my way.

One thing you can never, ever be without: a casket! Used, new—does it matter? Okay, it might matter. Not the point. You need a casket, and you need one now—so you'd better check out the Try Before You Die Casket Sale to get all set up.

I've seen it all over the years when it comes to death. Rabid rodents, cowplants, poison, crows—death, death, death, death, death! And so many are so, well, dramatic and unexpected. I suppose it's a blessing that I just chose to go out peacefully on my own while I was in bed. Though I'll tell you, there were times I was worried that the mold in my old flat would take me out!

When I was alive, I had so many friends. More than I do now, even. Of course, my charm has only grown over the years, but I was perfectly charming centuries ago, too. So I ask you: what sort of friends don't throw their friend one simple funeral upon death? That's right. I received no funeral. Nada! It hurts a little. You grind day after day, offering the best warez that Ravenwood has to offer, and what reward awaits you? Well, maybe someday someone will throw me a funeral. A Sim can dream.

Lady Ravendancer Goth and I go way back. Way back. Way, way back. We're super close. Sure, she rolls her eyes at me constantly, but that's because it's hard for another Sim to stand across from me without recognizing that my charisma is quite simply unmatched.

I like to think of myself as the undesignated, unasked-for guardian of the Crypt here, so trust me; I know what everyone gets up to when they're in there. That's right, that's right; when you WooHoo in there, you're shaming yourself! Oh, c'mon. I'm kidding. What, you think I've never had an amorous thought in my life?

Tarot cards are a lucky find and for sure take some exploring to collect. I hear that collecting the last card requires a brush with Death! Come find me at the Thinned Festiveil for a free reading anytime. I love having a chance to show off my Tarot deck and my tarot-reading prowess.

I think the biggest indicator that I'm Macabre is that I love, love, love rainy days but can't really stand being in the sun that much. It's not that I hate the outdoors, not at all! I just try to pay attention to the weird little things out there, and rainy days are just, well, a bit weirder to me.

I've been talking to Nyon more lately, but his soon-to-be-stepdad is a real enigma. I mean, everyone knows the rumors about Olive. You've seen the headstones, right? You know, from her other husbands? Come on, does Layne look like he's someone who misses a beat? Ew, no pun intended.

I try not to think a ton about how my parents even work, really. I mean, my mom was basically a ghost for a super, super long time. My dad's always talking about how he must have lived past lives or something, given how he's always got this Deja Vu thing going. You know how people talk about "old souls"? I think my parents are like that, though they're totally different personality-wise.

I suppose my whole morbid-fascination-with-Ghosts thing kicked off after finding out about tarot and about my distant ancestor, but I've always found ghosts really compelling. I want to know everything I possibly can. Did you know my relative, Esther, is the same way—and xie is a ghost already. I guess you can never know too much about those who have passed on, can you?

Name-dropping is so passé, I know, but I can't help myself. Imagine getting super, super into something only to find out that the Sim who does it best is literally related to you! Right, so, once I got into Tarot and found out that collecting a whole deck summons this Lady Ravendancer Goth, I was all in. Then I find out about some Sim named Lolita Goth, and I guess we're related somehow on mom's side of the family and all that. Can't even wrap my mind around it, right? I've heard so much totally weird gossip about our families from summoning her and talking to her.

A while back, I was walking around Crow's Crossing when I stumbled upon this strange book on a pedestal. I took a closer look and found my first Tarot Card! I've been working at understanding my tarot cards and have even started giving readings at the Thinned Festiveil. I have a bit of a family relation to a kinda famous local ghost who's connected to those tomes and the cards themselves. Seriously!

Not too long ago, I'm out with my mom and we run into Layne. He and mom get to talking, and she mentions this whole thing she's got about writing a Book of Life to get her sibling back. Layne gave her this weird grimace and just said, "Why would you spend your time on that?". Way out of character for him. He's usually supportive of uh, other creative people I guess, but he seemed so put off by my mom even mentioning a Book of Life.

You know I'm Olive's friend, right? She's such a fun, free spirit. I'm not surprised that Coffin guy is so into her, they're both really magnetic and neat together. Still, people stare at them a lot when they're out. Like, a lot a lot. What's that, you think?

I was totally not planning to die, especially not while tending to a beloved cowplant. But death's unexpected, and I confess that I like the unexpected and unusual. That's how I ended up being so drawn to the Reaper career. The way Sims were talking about it, it was like some once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be a part of something bigger than yourself. I wish I'd heard about it while I was still alive. But now Esther and I are both into reaping together. You should see the amazing outfits that go with it.

You've seen that absolutely gorgeous, perfect undead cowplant in Mourningvale, right? Sometimes, Sims will come by to play violin for her for some reason. I love it, though; the music is almost as enchanting as the cowplant herself. You'd think I'd be angry, since one killed me...but I could never be angry at a plant for doing what it must to survive. We all have to, yes?

My funeral was wonderful; Olive set it up for me, and Layne was the musician. But you'll never guess who stopped by to play the piano: Grim himself! Can you believe it? I swear, he seems to just pop up more than you'd expect around Olive's family.

Waylon keeps telling me to go and spend more time with Alice over by her Guardian Tree. I wish I wasn't so busy; sometimes it's hard to find time to talk to her, even when I am over in the area. I've heard that a few Sims have asked her how they could help her feel more at ease. I just sort of assume she'll be anchored to that creepy old tree forever, always sad no matter what you do. I like to think I might be wrong, though. You should tell me if I am!

I'm only starting to understand how to use my Ghost Powers since I haven't been a ghost all that long. The other day, Layne came by and was asking all these questions about how they work and what the differences are between the types of ghost powers and all that. I swear, the guy said something weird like "I can't wait" under his breath when I was telling him about Kai Aether's powers. I mean, we all die someday so I get it, but that was a little funky.

Death isn't truly the end, you know? There's no unspoken rule of life that says ghosts can't work toward their dreams! I deserve that feeling of pride and accomplishment just as much as any living Sim, especially since my Soul's Journey is still in progress. My Unfinished Business isn't going to finish itself!

{0.SimFirstName} earned some Fear Essence in the inventory for Infesting an Abandoned House! Word around Mourningvale is that Waylon Warez will purchase Essence for Simoleons by the Crypt in the Crow's Crossing neighborhood of Ravenwood.

Yeah, so, I noticed the grave for Hugh Thanasia a while before I even started seeing Olive. Did you know: more than anything, I want to be a Ghost, too! So the thought of Olive "helping" me is, well, kismet, right?\n\nCuz you see, while I didn't really lie to you about who I am... I also didn't quite tell you the truth. I was hiding the fact that I'm an Evil Sim, but now you know. It doesn't mean we're not still close friends; if anything, I feel closer to you than ever! I hope I'm not too Evil for ya, though.

Is life not feeling Grim enough for you lately? I'm here to let you know that it can always be more so—if you join the Reaper Career today! Even if Reaping isn't for you, Ravenwood also offers an alternative new career opportunity for the enterprising and eerie: an Undertaker Career. That'll really get you in touch with the world of the Living and the Dead.

Not content to be the rambunctious scamps you may be used to out of the spirit world, Ghosts around here have gotten a little more powerful. That's right; if you're a ghost, you have Abilities that can used to bend the world to your will (or at least attempt to).\n\nGhost Mastery can be found in the Simology Panel of Ghost Sims.

Interested in frogs, crows, doo-dads, rare treasure, or maybe just my sparkling company? Stop by and see me at the Crypt in the Crow's Crossing neighborhood to purchase goods. Just watch out—you may find the allure of spending Simoleons or exploring the depths of the Crypts too tantalizing to resist.

Were you aware that you can now plan grieving events? Now you know. It's pertinent because for some bizarre reason my simply massive number of friends pre-death forgot to hold a funeral for me when I passed. Not that I hold a grudge and wish them the absolute worst every day of my afterlife, no; that's not me. But if you have a heart, unlike them, you may want to try our new options for funeral events on for size.\n\nFuneral Events can be planned from the Calendar or Social section of the Phone.

If a bunch of strangers showing up at your door with food isn't festive enough for you, you can always search out the many festivals that Ravenwood has to offer! Whether you're interested in having your Tarot cards read at the Thinned Festiveil in Mourningvale, or simply basking in the moonlight at the Moon Revelry in Whispering Glen, you'll be entertained more than you'd ever expected and/or imagined. Be sure to check out Ravenwood Family Day in Crow's Crossing too.\n\nI think there are a few more that happen on a regular basis, but I can't remember the rest of my lines! Waylon is really particular about how this Welcoming Committee goes. Check out the Town Hall for more information.

If you're interested in Tarot, I've heard there's some secret group around. What was it? Oh yeah! the "Order of Lenore." I hear the Tarot Tome Shrines in each neighborhood of Ravenwood are a great place to get started. If you're having trouble finding them, the Town Hall has some more information too.
Edith Basu\nDied from drowning\nLoved yet misunderstood, with a hint of playful mischief when the moon is only partially ashine. A true moon child.

Dear future business friend, a representative of the Guild of Awesome Collections will be here at Crow's Crossing by this sign to buy your cool stuff every Monday, Thursday and Saturday during the Ravenwood Family Day. Be sure to check back on these days or keep an eye out for our signs in other neighborhoods!

Dear future business friend, a representative of the Guild of Awesome Collections will be here at Mourningvale by this sign to buy your cool stuff every Sunday and Wednesday during the Thinned Festiveil. Be sure to check back on these days or keep an eye out for our signs in other neighborhoods!

Dear future business friend, a representative of the Guild of Awesome Collections will be here at Whispering Glen by this sign to buy your cool stuff every Tuesday and Friday. Be sure to check back on these days or keep an eye out for our signs in other neighborhoods!

Festival Details: Every Tues, Thurs, Sun 11AM near the playground by the grill in Crow's Crossing.\n\nCome on down to Crow’s Crossing for a Celebration of Life that’s both heartwarming and delicious! We’ll be grilling up hotdogs and burgers to show that even while remembering loved ones, a great meal can lift spirits. Enjoy heartfelt hugs, meaningful toasts, and some of the best festival food around. It’s a wonderful way to honor the past while savoring the present!
The Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life

Festival Details: Every Mon, Wed, and Fri 11 AM at Crow's Crossing Square, near the fountain.\n\nJoin us to explore a selection of luxurious caskets, guided by a professional Funeral Director, and take advantage of exclusive discounts on your eternal resting place. Dare to test the plush interiors with a quick lie-down. Curious about a career in the death industry? Discover what it takes to become a Mortician or Funeral Director and consider stepping into this unique profession. Don’t miss your chance to plan ahead with style and grace!
Try Before You Die Casket Sale

Welcome to your afterlife {0.SimFirstName}. Although death has come early dear child, fear not! If desired, it is still possible to Age Up by traveling to Mourningvale and immersing oneself in the Baleful Bog.\nWhen the transformation is complete, you will be introduced to your Soul's Journey and may experience more of what the afterlife has to offer. You can also take a look at the Ghost Mastery panel to unlock newfound abilities.

To use this ultimate ability, {0.SimFirstName} must reach the Transcendent Wraith tier of Ghost Mastery.

(From Finding a Rare Item in the Crypt)

Whether it be a divorce, loss of a job, or losing a loved one, Grief is a normal, albeit tough, part of life that every Sim has to navigate. {0.SimFirstName} has been feeling more fired up during this difficult time. With the Anger Grief Type, {0.SimFirstName} might have some pretty epic angry outbursts, feel Angry Emotions more frequently, and unfortunately, {0.SimPronounSubjective} might lash out at others. Expect a lot more Mean Interactions and simmering tempers from {0.SimPronounObjective}. More information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Whether it be a divorce, loss of a job, or losing a loved one, Grief is a normal, albeit tough, part of life that every Sim has to navigate. Nothing to see here! Nope, {0.SimFirstName} is feeling perfectly fine. Is it the Denial Grief Type or is {0.SimFirstName} totally okay with what is going on? {0.SimPronounSubjective} might Zone Out here and there, but on the surface {0.SimFirstName} is doing just fine, and isn't the surface level what matters most? Feeling Bored Emotions more often is totally normal, right? More information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Whether it be a divorce, loss of a job, or losing a loved one, Grief is a normal, albeit tough, part of life that every Sim has to navigate. {0.SimFirstName} has been feeling pretty down during this difficult time. With the Blues Grief Type, {0.SimFirstName} might feel more inclined to Cry It Out, and feel Sad Emotions more frequently. {0.SimFirstName} will lean towards more Gloomy Interactions and might seem a bit more melancholic than usual. More information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Whether it be a divorce, loss of a job, or losing a loved one, Grief is a normal, albeit tough, part of life that every Sim has to navigate. {0.SimFirstName} feels as though it's best to project a sense of optimism, even while carrying a heavy burden. {0.SimPronounSubjective} is doing well by Holding It Together, engaging in social interactions and activities with Confident Emotions, however Sad Emotions can certainly work their way in and bubble over from time to time. More information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Grief is a process, and acceptance is part of that process. They say time heals all wounds, and like a weight lifted off {0.SimFirstName}'s shoulders, those wounds have started repairing. There might be some lingering effects for {0.SimFirstName}, maybe some latent feelings of Grief that could arise at any time, but the hardest part of the journey is now in the past.

{0.SimFirstName} is learning the hard way that denying Grief is not sustainable. Over time, the unresolved Grief begins to fester, resulting in a shift in emotion to Anger.\n\nMore information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

{0.SimFirstName} is learning the hard way that denying Grief is not sustainable. Over time, the unresolved Grief begins to fester, resulting in a shift in emotion to the Blues.\n\nMore information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Putting on a brave face is admirable, however these days {0.SimFirstName} is feeling {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} mask slip more and more, spiraling into Anger.\n\nMore information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel

Putting on a brave face is admirable, however these days {0.SimFirstName} is feeling {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} mask slip more and more, spiraling into the Blues.\n\nMore information on this Grief Type and Grief Coping can be found in the Traits Section of the Simology Panel
{0.SimFirstName} has decided against changing a Personality Trait.
Heirloom sold! Hopefully nobody gets mad about that...

{0.SimName} has gracefully moved on to the Great Beyond, leaving behind a profound sense of closure and inspiration!\n\nAll nearby Sims in the household have been granted the Perspectives on Death trait. This trait enhances their ability to navigate grief with greater emotional resilience, increasing their chances of staying confident and composed. It also provides a boost to all Soul’s Journey gains!
(From a Sim with a Burning Soul)

Welcome back! {0.SimFirstName} has been reborn with lingering ties to {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life. With the Burning Soul trait, Teen Sims and older can recover a personality trait through the Recall Past Life self-interaction and discover more through the Peer Into Soul interaction available on mirrors. Younger Sims will immediately unlock key developmental skills allowing a head start in life.\n\nWhy not reconnect with those from a past life and reignite old relationships? Though the memories may be hazy, {0.SimFirstName} will gradually reclaim them over time!

{0.SimFirstName} is now a teen Sim, and the memories from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} past life have become clearer with the Burning Soul trait. With a deeper understanding of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Rebirth, {0.SimPronounSubjective} now can regain one personality trait and certain others from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life with the Recall Past Life self-interaction and Peer Into Soul interaction available on mirrors! {0.SimFirstName} can also openly talk about {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} unique journey of Rebirth with others and reconnect with previous relationships. As an added bonus, try out the Transcendent Mess Around with living Sims—an experience unlike anything in the ordinary world!

Even as a child, {0.SimPronounSubjective} stands out—already mastering {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} developmental skills and leaping ahead of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} peers. Who knows what other forgotten strengths may still lie ahead?

{0.SimFirstName} is a reborn Sim, with hazy memories slowly coming back from the Burning Soul trait. A Sim like no other, {0.SimFirstName} has already mastered {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} developmental skills, giving {0.SimPronounObjective} a head start in life! As {0.SimPronounSubjective} grows older, strong bonds from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} past life may gradually start to resurface.

Hugh Thanasia\nm. Olive Specter\n"Oh, to have shed thy mortal coil with such reckless abandon!"
Earl E. DeMise\nJilted lover of Olive Specter\n"For what is worse than losing love but losing love at such a young age!"

Ichabod Specter\nm. Olive Specter\n"If a body meets a body bring him Pumpkin Pie."
