Beneath your tree sit gifts of family and wisdom. Honor the traditions of your inner circle and harness the knowledge around you so that you may follow the snowy footprints that came before you.\n\nCompleting a Work Task or Socializing with Family is desired.
On trust, on truth, on wisdom, intuitions. Break free from the commonplace standard traditions!\n\nSharing Ideas or Meeting Someone New is desired.
The Advocate Tarot Card was drawn.

Be Bold. You may face distraction or dueling forces, but you hold enough willpower to rein in success. Victory is within reach, you just need to "grab" it.\n\nGetting Confident or Winning a Competitive Game is desired.

Loosen your grip and be prepared to steer away from impending obstacles. You can try to fight it, or better yet, shift your focus towards easier goals.\n\nCompleting an Aspiration Goal or Using a Punching Bag is desired.
The Chariot Tarot Card was drawn.
Stability is second nature to you. You thrive at providing a sustainable future for yourself, absorbing all that the universe bestows upon you.\n\nEarnings Simoleons or Watering a Plant is desired.

Notoriety and greed have you in their Landgraaby clutches. It may be best to put aside material goods and focus on what can be salvaged. Just let the coins fall where they may.\n\nRummaging in Trash or Gaining Online Followers is desired.
The Coins Tarot Card was drawn.
Your cuppeth overflow! Your creativity is spilling out, consuming all in its path. Embrace these newfound emotions and channel them into your craft.\n\nTalking About Art or Painting is desired.
Half full of emotions but empty of the energy needed to process them, your cup needs more time to equalize. Feel your feels, you can mop up after.\n\nCrying it Out or Using a Voodoo Doll is desired.
The Cups Tarot Card was drawn.

A ladder disappears, but a wall opens up. Change does not have to be so grim. Embrace the transformation of your metamorphosis and spread your newfound wings.\n\nQuitting a Career or Breaking Up is desired.

Do not fear the reaper. Your resistance only delays the inevitable. Change is on the horizon, you need only to release your limiting thoughts and accept your next transition.\n\nDiscussing Expanding the Family or Having Deep Conversation is desired.
The Death Tarot Card was drawn.

Ye've become a mighty leader worthy of honor amid these seas. With yer wisdom gained from voyages beyond, ye be settin' course towards guidin' others through fair winds and away from carnivorous whales.\n\nMentoring or Writing Non-Fiction is desired.

Power has gone to yer head, and yer mind be as rigid as a barnacled hull. Ye might be sailin' toward a fate only Blacksail Ravenscar would fancy. But fear not, there still be time to shift the tides astern!\n\nBeing Mean or Bragging About Possessions is desired.

Strife does not keep you down. You have found comfort in the universe's little luxuries. Grateful for your abundant life, you now feel an urge to nurture others so that they too can feel nature's energy.\n\nTrying for a Baby or Fertilizing a Plant is desired.
Distrust and distaste have muddied your garden. Is it better to water the flowers of others? Or rediscover your own bloom?\n\nSpying on a Neighbor or Gussying Up is desired.
The Empress Tarot Card was drawn.
You're captivated by the curse of instant gratification. While enjoyable now, this path you're on may come back to bite.\n\nBuying an Expensive Object or Television is desired.
You must step out of the shadows! Overcome your attachments, accept your habits, and free yourself from the puppeteer pulling your strings.\n\nAdmiring Possessions or Selling Something is desired.
The Evil Tarot Card was drawn.
You're a playful soul and it's time to lean into that carefree spirit. Adventure awaits you! Do not let the dread of the fall keep you from taking a leap.\n\nHaving Fun or Missing Work is desired.

You're at a standstill and fear is keeping you locked away. It may be time to find the fun again. But be warned! Reckless behavior can yield consequences.\n\nSlacking Off at Work or Trolling the Forums is desired.
The Fool Tarot Card was drawn.

Sweep away any plans and make some room for seclusion. Take this moment to be introspective as you re-evaluate your goals. The answers you seek lay deep within your bones.\n\nTalking to Yourself or Being Alone is desired.

Dust off your social cobwebs, you've spent far too long in isolation. Don't cut yourself off from the world. Knock on that inner door and let yourself out!\n\nChatting with a Non-Household Sim or Discussing Logic is desired.

A cosmic upgrade is at present. It's time to embrace change and start fresh. You have learned from past experiences and are amidst a purging process that will leave you refreshed and renewed.\n\nCleaning or Upgrading an Object is desired.

You've been carrying self-doubt for too long. The universe is calling and it's time to pick up! Say 'Sul Sul' to the cosmic energy entering your life, removing that inner critic, and helping you achieve your full potential.\n\nGetting Focused or Working Hard is desired.
The Judgment Tarot Card was drawn.

Enter the judgment zone and prepare to accept responsibility! Where there is an effect, there is a cause. And now may be the time to cause some positive change. Seek your truth and align yourself with the greater good.\n\nExpressing Admiration or Reviving a Plant is desired.

Beware, for you may be headed down a moral path fit for the pit. While your actions feel frivolous now, your choices can only go unnoticed for so long before it's time to "pay the piper".\n\nTelling a Joke or Letting the House Get Dirty is desired.
The Justice Tarot Card was drawn.

Love is in the air! Amongst the Chalet Gardens flowers, your relationship is in full bloom. With honesty and alignment, nothing can snuff out your fiery passions.\n\nGoing on a Date or Romance is desired.

Less WooHoo and more boohoo? Disharmony has settled in and the flames of your love have dimmed. With compassion, this moment may pass, or, should you feel permanence in this rift, it may be best to move on.\n\nApologizing or Starting a New Relationship is desired.
The Lovers Tarot Card was drawn.
A quest has been bestowed! Manifest your goals and use this synergy of the elements to achieve your highest potential.\n\nIncreasing a Skill or Getting Energized is desired.

There's an imbalance in the alchemy of your manifestations. You're falling into traps of trickery and now must make a choice—turn towards good or become downright medieval.\n\nPlaying a Prank or Feeding a Cowplant is desired.
Release the memories haunting your mind and soak in the moon's magic. Allow the stars to guide you and use creative outlets to reconnect you with your purpose.\n\nCrafting or Stargazing is desired.

Free yourself from limiting beliefs like the Mooncasters before you! By trusting your canine instincts and leaving negativity behind, you embrace this liberating transformation.\n\nBeing Happy or Looking on the Brightside is desired.
The Moon Tarot Card was drawn.

The veil has thinned, giving you the opportunity to access knowledge deep within your soul. Let the High Spellcaster guide you. Trust in this divine energy to take you to new heights.\n\nSearching for Truth or Writing is desired.
Others have too much hold over you and it's blocking your intuition. You're in need of some serious "me" time to realign and open back up.\n\nReading a Book or Getting Inspired is desired.
The High Spellcaster Tarot Card was drawn.

You have endured many challenges, and now it's time to turn focus towards nourishment and renewal. Embrace nature's magic and feed your inner soul with many snacks.\n\nPlanting Something or Eating Snacks is desired.

A pigeon cannot support the weight of the world, and neither can you. Do not let overwhelming events cause you to crumble. Release your emotions and replenish your spirit.\n\nBeing Sad or Kicking Trash is desired.
The Star Tarot Card was drawn.
It's time to truly gnome yourself. Your strength, your courage. You have the ability to influence and resolve matters on your own!\n\nBeing Friendly or Repairing an Object is desired.

Life, like fruit cake, can be upsetting and your energies may be depleted. Avoid repressing these raw emotions but be wary of unleashing any harbored lightning within.\n\nMourning or Being Rude is desired.
The Strength Tarot Card was drawn.

Seasons may change, but the sun's warmth is a constant. Expel those summertime sads and spread your newfound positivity to those who may need the extra boost.\n\nComplimenting, Mentoring Homework, or Fitness is desired.
Sometimes too much optimism can lead you astray. Feelin' crummy? You may be in need of a pick-me-up!\n\nAdmiring Art or Flirting is desired.
The Sun Tarot Card was drawn.
Do not let resistance take hold! It's time to sink your teeth into personal transformation, so rest up and get ready to take on the new you!\n\nTaking a Nap or Staying Outside is desired.
Resisting the universe's pull is causing tension in your daily sway. Continued indecision will often result in some icky overflow.\n\nGetting Angry or allowing Overflowing Trash is desired.
The Suspension Tarot Card was drawn.

Stimulating conversation and the exchange of ideas is like a breath of fresh air to you. It's important to feed your mind just as much as your belly.\n\nCritiquing, Discussing Writing, or Color Theory is desired.
Hot air balloon or hot headed? It seems your emotions have gotten too sharp and it's time to let off some steam.\n\nFighting or Smashing a Dollhouse is desired.
The Swords Tarot Card was drawn.
Wade into your purpose and use your siren call to stabilize your energies. Patience and serenity will assist you as you seek knowledge and stronger bonds.\n\nAsking About Day or Research is desired.

Clear the skies and clear your schedule! An imbalance in your life is seeking re-alignment. Try some self-care or helping others to ease the pain of Aegean's Question.\n\nDonating or Watching TV is desired.
The Temperance Tarot Card was drawn.

Awaken to the chaos looming over you. It's time to assemble your bits and pieces so that you may embrace necessary change...and then you can salvage whatever's left.\n\nJoining a Career or Salvaging Parts is desired.

Life has dumpster-dived for you, heaving disaster upon your doorstep. It may just be your healing era should you choose personal transformation and avert romantic ruin. You're not here to make friends.\n\nDivorce or Making an Enemy is desired.
Embrace the cosmic energy fueling your ambitions! It's time to experience the magic that lies within everyone and everything.\n\nMaking a New Friend or Collecting is desired.

A lack of direction has caused quite the spiral, and it seems recklessness has cast its spell on you. You'd best take back control before you end up like a bad grilled cheese and go down in flames.\n\nBeing Mischievous or Sending a Chain Letter is desired.
The Wands Tarot Card was drawn.
Appreciate the cyclical nature of life! Commemorate this time and enjoy this rhythmic universe before the next turning point takes hold.\n\nTaking a Photo or Dancing is desired.

Resistance has taken hold and you might feel the rotation turning against you. It's time to hunker down, seek comfort, and make peace with change, or else you never know what may strike.\n\nA Hug or Staying on Lot is desired.

You draw closer to your goals and purpose. Finalize these successes, reflect on your progress, and bask in the endless joy. Chances are you have much to celebrate!\n\nPromotion or Marriage is desired.
Emotions linger like the stench of dirty dishes. You seek connections and closure!\n\nGetting to Know a Sim or Making Work Connections is desired.
The World Tarot Card was drawn.

Once upon a winter's time dwelt a wise sage, The Advocate. He held not just gifts, but promises of a brighter future, for he knew that the greatest gift of all was that of knowledge. As he spreads wisdom like fallen snow, he also brings laughter and cheer. He stands as a bridge between the known and unknown, unlocking mysteries of the universe with every lesson.
Of all things otherworldly and material, Coins exemplify security. Grounding one's self can ensure care for the future. Unchecked, and one can turn down a path of greed and unbridled ambition.

Cups flow relentlessly with the spillage of emotions. What drives one's deepest desires is the influence of relationships, romantic or not. It's best not to get lost within imagination, for fantasy can cause disconnect and result in uncontrollable feelings.

Upholding his Code, The Emperor be perched atop his mighty throne. His sway be unchallenged, his dominion unquestioned. A dead man tells no tales, but a pirate be known to spin a yarn or two. He's well earned the respect and loyalty of his crew, but if ye be seekin' more than just gold, ye best be diggin' deeper, for therein lies his treasured heart.

By the grace of nature and nobility, The Empress personifies love, beauty, fertility, and creativity. Rejuvenated by creation's lush presence, she draws her peace from Mother Nature's wellspring. With every journey she embarks on, she is blessed with abundance, as if the universe delights in her perseverance.

The Fool is merely a joyful Harlequin oblivious to the perils which surround him. Steadfast towards a dangerous ledge, one may wonder if he will awaken before plunging into the depths of his own naivety? Should he stay this wide-eyed, the only adventures he will partake in are those beyond the veil.

The Lovers, with enough blazing passion to set their own estate aflame, serve as both a symbol of devotion and a cautionary tale. Amidst the delicate threads of an arranged union, these lovers burn for one another in more ways than one. A gentle reminder to eschew the siren call of emotional folly and instead, embrace the art of harmonious communication. For it paves the way to everlasting love.

Cast in symbolic wizardry, The Magician embodies the notion "Fru Aboo, Sol Beluv". He dances between microcosms of time and space, bringing harmony amongst the elements. To conjure his wisdom and ancient power, one may manifest their own most fervent dreams. Behold! The universe's tapestry unfolds and stars align.

Howl at The Moon while its followers bask in the luminous glow. This dim cast reveals one's own dreams and intuition quite brightly. Walk the delicate line between the caution of society and the fury of the natural world, for it's often difficult for one to discern the right path.

In the midst of grave danger, a woman channels immense Strength to safeguard her gnome companion. Yet, it is her determination and mastery which truly captivates the eye. Her force is calculated, her actions disciplined. With cosmic courage, she demonstrates that by harnessing one's inner instincts with strength and resilience, raw passions can unfold positive results. Within her lies infinite potential.

Radiating positivity, The Sun shines overhead, a source of all life and energy throughout. A seedling sits proudly upon the back of a majestic stallion, embodying innocence upheld by strength and nobility. Happiness is on the horizon for those who embrace life to its fullest.

Breathe in, breathe out. Fresh air helps stimulate the mind, a double-edged faculty familiar to Swords. One's logic can be used for both good and evil, and thus our greatest conflicts can stem from this balancing act. It is vital to find harmony between honesty and harshness.

Akin to a coursing river, life ebbs and flows along its winding path towards destiny. Temperance rests with one fin attuned to this aqueous existence and the other grounded in reality. She maintains infinite duality with emphasis on harmonizing purpose with patience. One should try and test the waters before diving in.

Through simmering flames rises the primal energy necessary to push forward the cycle of creation. Associated with action, Wands imbue a powerful ambition. One may lean into cultivating plans, or fall into the directionless spiral of recklessness.

Continuing the cycle of completion and simulating new beginnings, The World depicts a future fraught with possibilities. As one level ends, another begins. Guided by the four elements, four seasons, four corners of the universe - one may persist in their cosmic journey.

In the dead of night, Evil may beckon, as if to tug on one's own puppet string. With his hypnotic stare, anyone can fall prey to his influence. And the longer one stays within this trance, the more susceptible to his power they become.

Seen and unseen, thou art the path between. The High Spellcaster dwells where light and dark share a delicate balance. Those who draw wisdom from this duality may unlock her ethereal presence. As a vessel of divine femininity, her essence and the cycle of the moon are closely entwined. She personifies magic in all forms and is guided by the rhythmic pulse of her own Intuition.

Meet thy maker, or in this case, baker? To stare into this face of danger means confronting Judgment head on. Actions shall be weighed accordingly and decisions made final. A glimpse of death might plant in one's mind, since relaying judgment often leads to dead ends and fresh beginnings.

Harken, to the noble virtues of structure, law, and truth. Justice maintains the logical stance requisite for dispensing all mystic equity. Each deed may bear the weight of its own consequence, and with a single stroke, a verdict may be rendered. Logic alone cannot be sufficient in this determination, thus intuition is honored to balance the scales. She remains the spiritual repercussions of one's own acts.

Formed long ago, this society remains bound under the sacred mission to reunite what was once whole—Lady Ravendancer Goth's Tarot Deck. Lost to the winds and scattered by crows, these fragments lay hidden amongst the realm. Guided by ancient whispers, members have sought to protect these cards before their final convergence can be made. Acting as a vessel for favors, perform society member tasks to receive a piece of the puzzle. Go to Ravenwood Festivals and find the helpers for Order of Lenore to learn about the tasks. This is just the beginning. Across Ravenwood, one may use their Intuition and exploration to complete the Order's efforts and locate the lost Tarot cards. For hints to each card's location, view the Household Collections window by selecting the icon in the Inventory panel.
As a Widowed Father, their attendance at the Moon Revelry Festival is unmatched.
A Ghost Host is often found trying to navigate this world at Afterlife Anonymous.
Spreading the gloom and predicting your doom, this Death Obsessed Sim is stationed at the Thinned Festiveil's Tarot booth.
A collector of sorts, the Grim Enthusiast is often found accepting offers at various events in Ravenwood.

Beneath The Star she kneels, a paragon of divine grace. Nourishing the soil below, she pours fresh water as a means to restore and renew. Intuitively she dips one foot into the cosmic pool for spiritual connection, the other half of her grounded in practicality and strength. Only a pigeon bears witness to this healing, giving thoughts of hope in spite of despair.

Relinquish thyself to the power of Suspension! Behold, he now hangs betwixt the threads of time, having sacrificed his soul for greater enlightenment. His serenity can be shared, so long as one surrenders fully. Delays only yield inevitable conclusions.

Chaos. Destruction. The Tower, thought to be a sturdy constant, reveals itself a mere façade. With flames aglow and meteors in flight, the universe has uttered its decree! In the midst of unrest, the only hope remains divine intervention.

Immersed amongst the building blocks of life and death, The Wheel of Fortune spins its cycle to determine one's destiny. The wheel holds both the learnings of the Cowplant and the ever approaching fate of the Netherworld. Forever in rotation, as one comes up the other must come down.
(From Exposure to the Evil, Accursed Sun)

{0.SimFirstName} has created a Will, which can be found in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} inventory! It's now up to {0.SimPronounObjective} to decide who is most deserving of each inheritance. Keep in mind that Simoleons from the {0.SimLastName} household cannot be passed down to other households unless {0.SimFirstName} is the last Sim in the household to die.
(From Dancing at the Moon Revelry Bonfire)
The Crow Collective has bestowed a special gift upon {0.SimFirstName}. Use it wisely!

Today is a Third Quarter Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo:\n\nRavenwood... I know what you're thinking, "Oh, they did it again! Ominous THEY! There are no Ravens here!" But wait, did you know, the name actually comes from the Legendary Tarot Reader, Lady Ravendancer? What a charmer! She once tried to give directions to a group of Nomads, but they were so beguiled by her, they took a wrong turn and got lost. Good thing Moppy came by to set them straight. As you kids would say it... Moppy Smacks!... Or is it "Slaps"? Nah. That's not it... Or is it?

Today is a First Quarter Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo: Alice's Kids in a nutshell: 4 children were born from her in this order, Deimos the Sentenced, Ann the Beloved, Freddy the Jester, and Edith the Troublemaker. Everyone assumes Edith is pure evil, but she's just misunderstood...and also a little bit evil! But because she was always close to Freddy, she can occasionally be a silly moose! If you catch her in a playful mood, try mocking her; I'm sure she'll respond well to that!

Today is a Waxing Gibbous Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo: As per my signed agreement with her, I am not allowed to say much about Moppy. Who is Moppy you say? Who is Moppy?! I'm sure you have seen that fantastic Goat Statue at the center of Crow's Crossing. Well, that is Moppy, and all I can say about her is that she is the B.O.A.T.! (If you're not hip to the latest lingo, that stands for Bestest of All Time.)

Today is a Waning Gibbous Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo:\n\nSpecters... And I don't mean Olive and company with all of her drama. I mean the little floaty fellas you see at Crow's Crossing or when you ring the Mourningvale Bell Tower bells. Believe it or not, they were once living Sims, but their sense of self has been long lost to them, either willingly or forgotten. The whole thing is, as youths would put it, a brain rotten situation if you ask me. Still, I understand why Sims around these parts think Specters have The Rizz. They radiate pure positivity, and that's a-okay in my book.

Today is a Full Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo:\n\nYou probably want to know more about The Ancestor. Y'know, the giant face carved into the side of that cliff in Whispering Glen. The Scrappity Restroom...or Scribbly Toilet...or whatever you kids call complete monstrosities these days. I'm so old my limbs creak and groan, and even I have no idea who that's supposed to be. It's been here as long as anyone can remember! The local Sims all gather to dance or something at the Moon Revelry. Hooligans. All I can really say is, I would rather whoever carved it had left that dang cliff alone; the landscape would have been better with a more natural beauty—like me!

Today is a Waning Crescent Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo: I am called the Guardian Tree due to my protective... Wait for it... Nature! I kid, I kid, but I always watch out for those in need, that's why I take care of Alice here! Sims can stop by to rest and refresh themselves, as well as listen to my tales of wisdom. I've been around for an eternity, literally, and through my roots, I absorb the mystical waters of the Baleful Bog and the goings on of the world. Whatever gossip or speculation you come across, remember I was there to witness it! It's true! No caps! Also, why the heck do youths get the cringe when I use their dialect? I'm cool. I dab. I can t-pose...or tree pose, I should say. Ha! But not everyone is ready for the truth. A kid ghostied me the other day for talking about the conspiracy theory I've got about the true nature of our reality—that we're not really in control of our own actions. I'm afraid I've already said too much...

Today is a Waxing Crescent Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo: Ah yes, the Baleful Bog! Did you know that the water there flows directly from the Netherworld itself? Yeah! It's what makes Mourningvale the Ghostly capital of the world. Botanists also speculate this is what makes the Undead Cowplants exist at all! Young ones these days see a glowing puddle of supernatural waters with the power to alter their corporeal reality and say, "Cannon bomb!" oblivious to the dangers of having one too many Out of Body Experiences. I've tried to warn them about the possibility of impending actual death here, but all I get is an "Okay Doomer" response. Ah to be young and reckless. Ghosts can find some interesting things here, too. If they've completed their Soul's Journey, they can take another shot at life and experience Rebirth.

Today is a New Moon, so here's what I can share with you, Kiddo:\n\nY'know that big ol' hole in Whispering Glen? Well, back in my day, it was a lot less holey. That is, until one night on a New Moon, boom! A meteor struck the site, spooking all the ghosts away. Big yike, as kids say these days. Either way, it's now a haven for collectors if you want to try your luck. They say a meteor can't strike the same place twice, right?
Check your inventory Kiddo, hope you found what you were scavenging for!
Let's see what we have here—{2.String} delivered straight to your Inventory. Was this a win or a blunder? That's for you to decide, but no refunds. Just be careful with it... Or don't.
Let's see what we have here—{2.String} delivered straight to your Household Inventory. Was this a win or a blunder? That's for you to decide, but no refunds. Just be careful with it... Or don't.
{0.SimFirstName} managed to shake loose {2.Money} from {1.SimFirstName}'s pocket! Being wicked has certainly paid off!
Good instincts! Shoving a hand into that horrifying, steaming fissure got {0.SimFirstName} a prize! Check in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} inventory for:\n{2.String}
{0.SimFirstName} has the eerie feeling that the end is near. Should {0.SimPronounSubjective} embrace {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} inevitable early demise and add the Chased by Death Trait?
{0.SimFirstName} has become more and more doubtful and questioning. Skeptical or not, is it too much to apply some healthy reasoning to things?\n\nEmbrace the change?

Your household is a recipient of a Will from a recently deceased Sim. Keep an eye on that mailbox! It should arrive with the next mail delivery. Once you've received the Will, be sure to Read It Out Loud to receive your inheritance.

{0.SimName} is a Macabre Sim. These Sims are a little off-kilter and will revel in the more morbid facets of life (and the afterlife). Expect your Sim to feel elated while doing dire activities {0.SimPronounSubjective} might consider to be Très Gothique. These Sims have their own grisly dance by the name of the Ghastly Gavotte, and they also have the ability to Spread the Gloom to others.\n\nReceive a moody boost during the witching hour of a full moon and when in the presence of glorious Grim, but beware of vibe killers in the form of overly cheerful tunes or activities they find woefully basic.

{0.SimFirstName} just achieved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} dream of knowing all there is to know about ghosts, and living to write about it! Trait Earned: Ghost Whisperer Ghost Whisperers have access to special interactions to discuss their eerie findings and published works. They have a much easier time making friends (and more) with Ghosts. They will also get particularly excited while encountering ghosts of all kinds, Grim, and even Crows!
This Sim wants to learn everything about ghosts and use the findings to write spooky horror novels!
Fills Social Need. Chance of receiving Sad Moodlet.
Fills Social Need. Chance of receiving Energized Moodlet.
Lowers work performance. Increases chance of Earning a Soul.
Boost the speed at which your Sim gains Thanatology Skill while in the club.

<font color = '#bc0f0f'>Emit a dark aura from yourself to influence the emotions of nearby living Sims!</font>

Happiness is overrated! Control the emotions of nearby living Sims by emitting a negative aura. While enveloped in the aura, Sims will feel an intensely negative mood. Afterall, life isn't rainbows and butterflies.

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>.

<font color = '#bc0f0f'>Manipulate the needs and lifespan of living Sims!</font>

Torment the living by absorbing or draining their needs, with an extra boost when targeting scared Sims. {0.SimFirstName} can also fully embrace the darkness within, drawing souls closer to the inevitable Afterlife by siphoning a Sim's life essence, shortening their lifespan.

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>.

<font color = '#898989'>Evoke heightened fear at night for extra Fear Essence!</font>\n\nWhen darkness falls, living Sims automatically become more vulnerable to {0.SimFirstName}'s scares, eliciting more extreme reactions and granting bonus <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>. Rumor has it there's a mysterious merchant in Ravenwood, driven by a thirst for forbidden knowledge and ghostly powers, that will pay top Simoleon for Essence which can become quite lucrative for {0.SimFirstName}.

Teleport anywhere and enter homes uninvited! Transcend physical limitations and traverse the world as a ghost. Uninvited? No obstacle! Use Spectral Unlock to effortlessly enter any residential abode and uncover its mysteries. Traverse is available as a terrain interaction. Spectral Unlock is available on residential front doors.

Nap inside objects to restore Stamina faster!\n\nBeds for ghosts? Not for {0.SimFirstName}. Snooze out in any possessable object to restore Energy and Ghost Stamina. Just beware: comfort matters—sleeping in cramped or gross places could leave {0.SimFirstName} feeling restless!

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Give a good dream to living Sims to restore their Energy faster.</font>

{0.SimFirstName} could very well be the kindest ghost in town, watching over {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} loved ones even as they are asleep. With this ability, {0.SimFirstName} can weave good dreams—so delightful they restore Sim's Energy faster than they realize.

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#bc0f0f'>Give a nightmare to living Sims while they are asleep!</font>

Venture into the dreams of living Sims, weaving dark visions that disturb their sleep. As they awaken from this dream, terrified, they ponder... Was it just a nightmare, or a sinister visit from beyond?

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>.

<font color='#1e81e6'>Instantly improve the quality of items!</font>

Even in the Afterlife, there’s a knack for keeping things top-notch! With an otherworldly prowess, {0.SimFirstName} can tap into the extraordinary ability of instantly improving the quality of crafted items, nurturing plants, as well as restoring the freshness to most spoiled food!

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

Chance to clean, repair, and upgrade instantly! {0.SimFirstName} can now instantly maintain and upgrade objects with ghostly prowess, transcending the Handiness Skill barrier. At this Novice level, the effectiveness of these actions are just beginning to take shape. This ability has 3 tiers, each enhancing {0.SimFirstName}'s success rate in maintaining and upgrading objects. Performing the interactions grants Goodwill Essence.

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Increased chance to clean, repair, and upgrade instantly!</font>

{0.SimFirstName} has now advanced to Adept Maintenance! With enhanced effectiveness, {0.SimFirstName}'s success rate in maintaining and upgrading objects have significantly increased. Continue advancing this ability to reach perfection!

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Guaranteed chance to clean, repair, and upgrade instantly!</font>

{0.SimFirstName} has now achieved unparalleled mastery in maintaining and upgrading objects. At this ultimate tier, {0.SimFirstName} performs these tasks with perfection, leaving basic handiness skills in the dust. The success rate for this ability is now at its peak!

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Give needs and extend the lifespan for living Sims!</font>

Once consumed by worldly ambitions, now find peace in selfless service! {0.SimFirstName} can channel needs to those {0.SimFirstName} holds dear or offer comfort and longevity to the living—a true testament to compassion bridging life and afterlife.

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Radiate a positive aura from yourself to influence the emotions of nearby living Sims!</font>

Bring some positivity to nearby living Sims by filling the room with good vibes. Make everyone feel like they’re on top of the world and brimming with life! Who knew the Afterlife could be so uplifting?

Performing the interactions grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#bc0f0f'>Summon trash, puddles, and spooky objects on the ground to cause chaos!</font>

Feeling mischievous or seeking a bit of revenge? Stir up some trouble by conjuring troublesome substances out of thin air and spawning them anywhere you please. Making a mess has never been this delightfully spooky.

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>.

<font color='#1e81e6'>Instantly remove trash, dirty dishes, puddles, messes, and more!</font>

Dreading the daily chore even in the Afterlife? Not for this ghost! Become a Dispel master and whisk away pesky items back to the Netherworld where they truly belong. Performing this in front of other Sims will make them happy and increase their social standing with {0.SimFirstName}.

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

<font color = '#1e81e6'>Save a Sim from getting reaped by exchanging a dap with Grim!</font>

Now {0.SimFirstName} has stepped up {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} otherworldly game—straight chilling with Grim Reaper himself. Just fist bump your bro Grim and bam; life saved, no biggie!

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#1e81e6'>Goodwill Essence</font>.

Let loose a terrifying scream to gain fun and elicit fear on nearby living Sims. Time to really shake things up with a ghostly rage-fueled shriek. Sims won't know what hit 'em—they'll run for cover, lose composure, or well...maybe even faint a little? Haunting Shriek can be performed on living Sims or as a self-interaction. Performing the interaction grants Fear Essence.

<font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fleece a living Sim to drop Simoleons or items from their inventory!</font>

Running low on Simoleons? Levitate a living Sim and see what drops from their pockets—could be Simoleons, could be their lunch! Roll the dice and hope for riches!

Performing the interaction grants <font color = '#bc0f0f'>Fear Essence</font>.

Sinister Haunt possessable objects or Haunt Musical Instruments to gain fun and skill! Want to level up your spook? Haunt Musical Instruments to play some eerie melodies and to improve {0.SimFirstName}'s instrument skill, or perform a Sinister Haunt on objects for some ghostly fun—all while terrifying nearby living Sims! Children, toddlers, and infants will giggle and clap at {0.SimFirstName}'s ghostly antics. Adults? Well...let's just say they won't be asking for an encore. Performing the interactions grants Fear Essence.

Create eerie effects to scare nearby Sims! Unleash terror with a Ghostly Bang on the ground or cast an eerie flickering of lights over an entire room—or just a single light. Why settle for a haunted house when you can create a Spooky Spectacle any place you please? Ghostly Bang is available as a self or terrain interaction. Flicker Lights is available on the room's floor or directly on the light object. Performing the interactions grants Fear Essence.

<font color = '#898989'>Turn living Sims into a temporary ghost for an ethereal {T0.Mess Around}{DAE0.WooHoo}.</font>\n\nPossess an everyday object with a living Sim for a {T0.Mess Around}{DAE0.WooHoo} that defies the laws of life and death. After all, who said love couldn't transcend the afterlife?

<font color = '#898989'>Use less stamina!</font>\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has reached new heights in mastering Ghost Stamina! With improved mental fortitude, {0.SimPronounSubjective} can now use each ghostly ability with minimal stamina consumption.

<font color = '#898989'>Slows down hunger, bladder, and hygiene needs.</font>\n\nAscend beyond the living realm as {0.SimFirstName}'s connection to worldly needs begin to fade. No more rushing to the toilet, eating, or stressing about cleanliness as often as {0.SimPronounSubjective} used to!

<font color = '#898989'>Stop hunger, bladder, and hygiene needs.</font>\n\nTranscend beyond the living realm as {0.SimFirstName}'s connection to worldly needs fade completely. No longer do hunger, bladder, or hygiene needs pose any concern. Experience the ultimate liberation in the afterlife without the constraints of living needs.

The Ultimate Curse! Requires a Ghost Mastery of Transcendent Wraith to use. Perform Evil Abilities to fill the meter to unlock this! Unleash vengeance upon unsuspecting living Sims by casting a malevolent curse upon them. Things just tend to go wrong and everyday tasks become a burden for Sims who are inflicted with the Ultimate Curse. As a haunting bonus, this ability unlocks the 'Mark of Evil', a tattoo available exclusively for the most malicious ghosts. The Mark of Evil tattoo is available in Create a Sim or can be applied directly as a self-interaction. Performing the interaction grants Fear Essence.

The Ultimate Blessing! Requires a Ghost Mastery of Transcendent Wraith to use. Perform Good Abilities to fill the meter to unlock this! Bestow upon living Sims the gift of boundless fortune. Watch as everything falls perfectly into place for those blessed, making tasks effortless and swift. As an ethereal bonus, this ability unlocks the 'Mark of Good', a prestigious tattoo reserved solely for the most benevolent ghosts. The Mark of Good tattoo is available in Create a Sim or can be applied directly as a self-interaction. Performing the interactions grants Goodwill Essence.

Detect a Sim's current mood and give a calming embrace to remove their negative feelings. With this ability, feelings of sorrow and troubles are mere fleeting dreams... With a Solace Embrace, turn grimaces into grins. A gentle touch of {0.SimFirstName}'s ghostly presence soothes all troubled hearts. Detect Current Mood can be used to find out a non-household Sim's current mood. Performing the interactions grants Goodwill Essence.
The crows in Ravenwood all come from Grim's secret aviary, so it makes sense that they'd have a special bond with a Sim like {0.SimFirstName}.
Sometimes you just want to plot and scheme with a crow. It's normal.
Ah, it seems that Vampire Sims and crows have more in common than just their love of darkness.
{0.SimFirstName} isn't just fashion-forward; now {0.SimPronounSubjective} can be considered an official member of the Crow Collective.
Provoking a crow is always a bad move, but at this point you're tempting fate. Knock it off now unless you fancy a close encounter with Grim!
Quite honestly, who wouldn't love cuddling with a crow?
Did the Crow Collective not make itself clear? Buzz off!
Your glorious gift to the Crow Collective has been received, catalogued, and appreciated. Thank you for your continued support, comrade.
Macabre Sims have an especially deep bond with crows, and it shows.

{0.SimFirstName} has succeeded in helping a member of the Order of Lenore. {0.SimFirstName} concedes things are more mystical than they appear. Perhaps the Magician's ancient power will offer further guidance.\n\nLet the bell toll, nevermore.

If learning the ins and outs of reaping wasn't enough, {0.SimFirstName} also has a quota to meet. Practice makes perfect, and perfect gets souls. It's hard to believe an intern is allowed to wield a scythe, but here {0.SimFirstName} is!

Despite the name, this job does not involve naps. Other than the eternal one. There's no rest for the wicked and {0.SimFirstName} is going to need to become wicked good at picking up lost souls for Grim if a promotion is in {0.SimPronounPossessiveIndependent} future!

Grim might be cramping {0.SimFirstName}'s style, which is why the next promotion will be bittersweet. For now, {0.SimFirstName} needs to dust off any nerves and find the fun in reaping. But not too much fun, laughter is quite deadly.
Real Reapers don't stop for "No Soul-icitation" signs which means {0.SimFirstName} won't either. No need for Grim to verify, {0.SimFirstName} is there to collect...whether the Sim likes it or not.

{0.SimFirstName} is becoming more masterful each day. {0.SimPronounSubjective}'ll want to keep a sharp mind and a sharp blade heading into {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} assignments. It's nothing crazy, no need to have a cow.
{0.SimFirstName} peers into the watery realms of time and space, witnessing the murky fate of distant spirits. And then {0.SimFirstName} takes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} lunch break.

Being the bridge between realms can be a struggle, especially when quality checks are missed, the bridge gets a crack, and all Netherworld breaks loose. {0.SimFirstName} may have faced the dead, but ghosts gone rogue are another story.

Repeat after Grim, "I do not negotiate except when I negotiate". Revival can be part of the job, but sometimes Sims just need to embrace that next chapter. {0.SimFirstName} will need to let go of emotional tethers to succeed in this Netherline.
{0.SimFirstName}'s been ferried across the river, deep in the depths of the Netherworld's innerworkings. The veil is thin as {0.SimFirstName} stands at the precipice of becoming a true Reaper.

{0.SimFirstName} may not be Grim himself, but a true Reaper nonetheless! Slashing souls, reviving Sims, and closing tears to the Netherworld, {0.SimFirstName} has mastered it all. Having seen behind the veil, a bond has been solidified allowing {0.SimPronounObjective} to walk hand in hand with Grim.

If jobs were a stack of paperwork, this one would be near the bottom. Luckily, {0.SimFirstName} is a master paper pusher. Plot inquiries, obituaries, lunch orders, you name it! {0.SimFirstName} puts the busy in business.
Grief can be a gut punch and some Sims need a shoulder to cry on. From coping to reminiscing, {0.SimFirstName} is a helping hand on the path to moving forward.

Feelin' like a casket case? Urns seem a bit morbid but a grave is soo last millennia? {0.SimFirstName} is there to help any Sim come to a decision that feels right. {0.SimPronounSubjective} knows an eternal resting place is forever, which is why it's important to rest in peace.

Funeral services involve far too many choices to handle on one's own. Viewings, eulogies, processions. {0.SimFirstName} helps ease the mind, offering a variety of arrangements. From funeral to fun-eral, {0.SimFirstName} has it all.
{0.SimFirstName} is there for the assist! Unruly relatives? Wrong coffin color? Uninvited ghosts in attendance? {0.SimFirstName} is on it.

Running a funeral home certainly has its ups and downs. Not every death will turn into a celebration of life, but {0.SimFirstName} is there to provide a lovely service regardless. By paying respects, Sims are one step closer to embracing the afterlife.

Shovel bound and six feet deep, {0.SimFirstName} is going to have to get {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} hands dirty. It's not the most glamorous job, but someone's got to fill it. Muscle on responsibly, or else {0.SimFirstName} may end up digging {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} own grave.

When night falls, the bodies need guarding from ghastly beings and occasional bandits. {0.SimFirstName} will want to keep a flashlight close; it's not impossible to run into lingering ghouls while making the rounds. Despite the daytime crowd, night is when a cemetery is most alive.

As keeper of the grounds, {0.SimFirstName} is there to tidy up. With fresh flowers on hand and an eye for landscaping, it should be fairly easy to keep the cemetery aesthetically pleasing for both the living and the dead.

After Grim has sorted souls, someone needs to answer the call and retrieve what...remains. Fortunately, {0.SimFirstName} is that lucky someone!! It's an honorable gig and if anyone says otherwise, that's hearse-ay!

Meteors, fires, rogue stink bombs... Death can be quite messy. That's where {0.SimFirstName} comes in. Mop up the tears and scrub away the soot so that families can grieve in peace. Squeaky clean peace.
{0.SimFirstName} is going to learn that the relationship between pathogenic microorganisms and its host is downright sim-biotic. Plus, {0.SimPronounSubjective}'ll get to use a microscope!

Not all Sims wish to be buried, and that's why {0.SimFirstName} offers this once-in-a-lifetime service. Now Sims can be scattered wherever they wish! (But please, for Sims-sake, do not sprinkle anyone inside the Tunnel of Love)

{0.SimFirstName} is in charge of The Big 3: Sanitization, Preservation, and Presentation! It's best not to let the chemicals get to {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} head, as this part of the job can really make or break a funeral.
Chattering teeth is not uncommon in a morgue so cold. That is, so long as it's {0.SimFirstName}'s teeth that are chattering. A haunted workspace wouldn't be the worst thing though, right?

A friend to both the living and the dead, {0.SimFirstName} works hard to make a Sim's last appearance everlasting. Finding comfort in the silence, and a a good lab coat for the cold, {0.SimFirstName} takes on this gruesome work so that Sims can hold on to the pleasant memories of their loved ones.

The time is nigh to don a robe and become a Reaper! As Grim's employee, you'll be able to climb his triangular ladder and gain rewards like Discussing Deathly Business and owning a Timeless Hourglass. Scry your way to the top and earn being Grim's Right Hand while unlocking a truly Grim-worthy outfit as you spread Death's Touch wherever you go.

Service both the living and the dead by undertaking this position! From grave digging to embalming, Sims who pursue a career in the funeral industry ensure all Sims are able to move on in peace. Specializing in this before-afterlife care prepares you for difficult moments like, Discussing End of Life services or Contemplating Existence. Six feet in you may be rewarded with a Plague Mask, a Murphy Membrane Bust, or a Corpus Commendation Plaque to honor your achievements.

Morticians embody the science side of death. They're likely to endure wacky chemical fumes and makeup mishaps while regularly getting the cold shoulder from clients. Ultimately, they'll need to excel in preparations for any wake without waking the dead.
Funeral Directors can offer a clean tissue and a stunning floral arrangement. From clerical work to rites of passage, viewings to processions, the director helps handle death's aftermath with grace.
I am the spooky thing who bumps.
I'll grab a flashlight and investigate.
Jealous! I would be an amazing ghost.
Intrigued! I must know all of their secrets.
I stay calm, knowing that death is already all around us.
Are subjects that require thorough investigation.
Something silly...like being a Cowplant's dinner!
Gah! I don't even want to think about it.
If I passed on today and became a ghost, I'd want to go out via...
When something spooky goes bump in the night...
When it feels like Grim is looming right over my shoulder...
When I encounter a Ghost, I feel...
Requires Level 10 Funeral Director Branch of the Undertaker Career to Unlock.
Requires Reaper Career Level 10 to Unlock
Requires Reaper Career Level 3 to Unlock
Requires Level 10 Mortician Branch of the Undertaker Career to Unlock.
Requires Undertaker Career Level 2 to Unlock.
Requires Undertaker Career Level 4 to Unlock.
Earn the 'Mark of Evil' tattoo reward by performing enough chaos and scare Ghost Mastery abilities and by reaching the Transcendent Wraith tier of Ghost Mastery!
Earn the 'Mark of Good' tattoo reward by performing enough benevolent Ghost Mastery abilities and by reaching the Transcendent Wraith tier of Ghost Mastery!
A ceiling rail so chilling, even your most nettlesome neighbors will be too afraid to make judgmental comments as it looms above them.
Don't Perform Evil Ghost Mastery Abilities
A column so chilling, even your most provoking peers will be too afraid to make judgmental comments as it towers above them.
Man, this thing is old. Are you sure you trust it to hold things up? Well, it's your funeral, I guess...
{0.SimFirstName} lost someone close to {0.SimPronounObjective} for the first time.
{0.SimFirstName} lost someone close to {0.SimPronounObjective} for the first time.
{0.SimFirstName} was awarded the Mark of Edith!
{0.SimFirstName} was awarded the Mark of Edith!
{0.SimFirstName} completed {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} first ghostly possession of an object!
{0.SimFirstName} completed {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} first ghostly possession of an object!
Made a Friend in the Crypt!
While exploring the Crypt, {0.SimFirstName}, made a new friend! Although the friend is a bit strange...
While exploring the Crypt, {0.SimFirstName}, made a new friend! Although the friend is a bit strange...

{0.SimFirstName} gave birth to a descendant of the Grim Reaper!

{0.SimFirstName} WooHoo'd with the Grim Reaper. This is an interesting choice, but good for {0.SimPronounObjective}!
{0.SimFirstName} WooHoo'd with the Grim Reaper. This is an interesting choice, but good for {0.SimPronounObjective}!

You're on my list, {0.SimFirstName}. You've been pushing the line, living dangerously. Perhaps you think you're immune to the consequences of your actions? Perhaps you're brave—or perhaps you're just foolish. But let me make this clear, you're on very, very thin ice. After your latest brush with death, I'll be keeping a particularly close eye on you, and if you even THINK about stepping one toe out of line, I'll be there to collect your soul. I like you, {0.SimFirstName}. But as you spend the next few days reeling from your near-death experience, you should know that you're on death's doorstep. It would be wise of you to be careful—your next mistake will be your last.

You and I are close; I feel like I can tell you anything. There's something about me I've been hiding from you and, well, from a lot of people. I'd feel better if I could tell you, but it would change a little something about me. Do you want to hear more?\n\nIf you say "Okay", be sure to ask me about myself next time you talk to me. If you say "No", don't worry—I won't bring it up again and it won't hurt our friendship.

There are objects found in Build Mode that are designed to work well with Funerals. The Simple Life, Simple Death Podium houses many Funeral interactions that a Sim might like to complete during the event. The Burial Casket and Gravesite objects can store Sim remains, so feel free to drag a Deceased Sim's Urn from a Sim's Inventory to the floor or ground, and then into either of these objects. These objects also allow for Funeral interactions to be performed by selecting the Urn or Gravestone inside. To view the Urn inside the Burial Casket, select Open. Place a Memorial Display and Memorial Portrait and dedicate it to the deceased. If you would like a more celebratory event, place the Memorial Cannon to give the Sim the most epic send off! Although Guest Sims will grieve freely during a Funeral, interactions like Call Over Guests can help bring attention to certain activities that you would like to complete. Funeral Activities and Interactions can be found by selecting Sims, the Funeral Podium, and the Urn or Gravestone while a Funeral is in session.

Have you considered a career in the Reaping Business? You could really make a killing. There’s no need for a dead-end job when The Netherworld Department of Death has a robust system of quotas and rewards to ensure that you’re always in charge of your own fate. Pick up a scythe and give reaping a swing!

I had a dream about you last night. You were being followed by Grim! He kept looking down at his Slablet, and then looking at you...at least I think he was looking at you. I don't think he actually had a face. Whatever. That doesn’t matter, what matters is that I think I might be psychic, so this is serious. You’re in danger, my friend!
Um. I think I'll be fine.

Hello from the other side! You don't know me, so this might sound weird, but you're going to inherit from me, kid! Why, you might ask? Let's just say it's better for both of us if you don't ask questions. The money needs to go somewhere, and quick! And I heard through the grapevine that you were a good, upstanding Sim. So, you're about to inherit a chunk of my "hard-earned" Simoleons.\n\nListen, buddy, part of life is planning for your death. You should write up a Will when you're ready to choose who's gonna inherit your Simoleons, your heirlooms, and your kids! I did mine on the Computer, but you can call an Inheritance Lawyer to help you write one too, if you want. Just, uh, make good choices in life, kid! I sure didn't!
Life is short, have you thought about writing a Will?

Want to stop by Ravenwood Family Day with me? We can look for frogs, play with the Specters, learn about setting up a Will, and I even hear a Crow Handler will be there with one of Grim's Crows. Also, food. Maybe even Boiling Death Frog Hot Pot if we're lucky!
There's a group to help Ghosts like us figure out the afterlife together. Wanna come?

Care to attend the Moon Revelry with me? It's on the shore out by the Ancestor cliff in Whispering Glen. We can swim, moonbathe, watch the stars, play music, and dance around the bonfire. It's always wildest during the full moon, but I love it any night!

I'm heading to the Thinned Festiveil—want to come? There's the Game of Chance, a Tarot reader, food, dancing, and of course, the Guardian Tree. They say if you give it a gift it'll give you one back. And, I hear there might even be some Grimterns there, recruiting.

Afterlife Anonymous is starting now. Feeling overwhelmed or in need of support? The Afterlife Anonymous is your go-to sanctuary! Gather with fellow ghosts and sympathetic Sims for a support session. Share your experiences at the podium, enjoy comforting potluck dishes, and find solace in heartfelt conversations. Whether you’re a ghost or a grieving Sim, it’s the perfect place to find support and camaraderie!\n\nThe group meets every Monday, Wednesday & Friday at 6pm and Tuesday & Thursday at 10am in the Mourningvale neighborhood, near the ruins.
Get ready for some froggy fun! Search high and low for the legendary Death Frog hiding among the central fountain. Win the contest and receive a prize!
Dare to interact with these charming crows and chat with the Crow Handler to uncover their mysterious ways!
Children can have fun at the playground with these playful specters! They might even score a special heirloom object or a delightful surprise when asked for a gift!
Ever wondered about the secrets of planning for the future? Chat with our friendly Inheritance Lawyer and get valuable advice!

Ravenwood Family Day Festival is starting now in Crow's Crossing! Stop by to participate in the Frog Finding contest, try out the tasty Boiling Death Frog Hot Pot, visit the collector, or to learn more about Wills and Crows. Child Sims can even try to get gifts from the nearby friendly specters. It's sure to be a festival of family fun!

Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life is occurring near the center of Crow's Crossing in Ravenwood. This Festival can be found every Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday from 11AM - 5PM.

The Try Before You Die Casket Sale also happens in Crow's Crossing every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11AM - 5PM. Be sure to check it out for a great deal!

The Moon Revelry happens every night in Whispering Glen from 7PM - 1AM. On the Full Moon, it's an extra special, extra nude affair.

Afterlife Anonymous occurs every Monday, Wednesday, Friday 6PM - 11PM and every Tuesday and Thursday 10AM - 4PM in Mourningvale for Ghosts or Grieving Sims needing a little extra support.
Shed all worries under the full moon and yes, clothes too, to embrace the freedom of the open sky. Revel in nature’s purest form while keeping children at bay!
Gather around the cozy bonfire and enjoy the warmth as it lights up the night. Share stories and dance the night away with fellow Sims!
Enjoy the rush of swimming beneath the stars, where moonlight dances upon the glistening waters.
Lie back and bask in the moon’s soft glow. Feel the mystical energy of the night rejuvenate in ways sunlight never could!
Daily 7PM - 1AM, Except on a New Moon
Travel to the Moon Revelry Festival
When the Full Moon Shines Brightest

The Moon Revelry is starting now in Whispering Glen! See the Ancestor cliff up-close, take a night swim, dance around the bonfire, or moonbathe under the light of the stars. Now try it all in the nude! The Full Moon means this event is clothing optional.
Consult the enigmatic Tarot Reader for insights into Tarot. Grab a chance for a personal reading and uncover hidden truths about the future!
Get ready to groove with living and ghost Sims! Enjoy a day of spooky beats and mysterious moves.
Meet Grim's mysterious underling and dive into the ultimate game of chance! Win exciting prizes or, with luck, maybe even summon Grim Reaper himself.
Offer a gift to the Guardian Tree and let its enchantment take effect! The tree is known to bestow a reward or delightful surprise on those who honor its presence.

Thinned Festiveil is starting now in the Mourningvale neighborhood of Ravenwood! Stop by to play a Game of Chance with a Grimtern or learn more about the Reaper Career, receive a Tarot reading, and offer gifts to the Guardian Tree! There's also food, dancing, and a Mysterious Merchant.
A fence so full of intricate and frightening ironwork, even your most negative nemesis will have trouble finding flaws with such impeccable craftsmanship.
A fence so chilling, even your most acrimonious acquaintances will be too afraid to make judgmental comments as they peer over it in curiosity.
It may be showing its age, but trust me, this bad boy will last forever! Nothing beats a good ol' reliable fence...in theory.

Set a dreary, rustic vibe to your home with this beautifully crafted fence. Not only does it have straw, it also has...wood! Ha, what's next, a fence made of brick? Where's that third little pig when you need him?

This foundation features a centuries-old style of masonry once mentioned in the works of Edward Talon-Crow. Apparently, it was once popular among Ravenwood's nobles who claimed to have the finest casks of Plumbobtillado nectar in their deep subterranean cellars. The materials used are...confidential, let's say. It's better not to ask. And, for the love of cowplants, do NOT press your ear to the stone...
Frozen in fear, with nowhere to turn? Look no further than this frieze. Oh, it won't help you! It's just nice to look at. Enjoy!

Serve up your bittersweet beverages and chilling concoctions in style with this one-of-a-kind bar by none other than Tell-Tale Arts. If you listen closely, you might even hear a distinct sound emanating from its very core. Could it be something terrifying embedded within the very wood of the bar itself? Or perhaps it's all in your mind, a manifestation of your greatest fears? Either way, the drinks speak for themselves, sometimes literally!
The Tell-Tale Bar by Tell-Tale Arts

Journal Entry #738 from The Many Travels of Blake Bleakman: Eerily cold tonight in Ravenwood, and it isn't just the air. The way the moonlight slips through the trees in this place casts a chill on my bones, one that all the lit hearths and warm mugs of spiced nectar in the world couldn't soothe. Decided to try my hand at the latter and headed to the local tavern. Locals call it "The Last Draught" or whatever. Funny folk around here. I sat at the wooden bar, ordered a Dim and Gusty, per the lady bartender's recommendation. "Stops the shivers," she said with a knowing smile as she handed it over. I drank it all. Didn't do much for me. "Anything to do around here?" I asked her. "Stay alive, until you don't," she said. "Getting too curious around here can shorten your life expectancy if you're not careful. Plenty of forlorn ghosts'll sing that tune, if you listen." I asked her about some tree I heard whispers about in town, the Guardian Tree. She looked at me like I'd said my mama was a cowplant. Then she leaned closer, all shifty-eyed. "Don't go there, if you know what's good for you," she whispered. "It's haunted. Don't know if that poor lady will ever find her, anyway..." I didn't dare to ask what she meant by that. I just stood up and left this cursed place for good.

A soft, cozy spot for the littlest member of your family to stay warm and safe during the cold night. This bassinet is like a veil of peace and happiness. Well, to be fair, the maintaining of peace only works from the outside looking in. From the inside out? Not so much. Once it's feeding time at three in the morning? Oh, you'll know. The whole street will!

Aren't baths supposed to be where you go to escape the drama and melancholy of the outside world? Not this one! Wallow in your fears and indulge in...whatever the opposite of self-care is. Self-uncare? Self-destruction? Whatever it is! More of that!
The Modern Grimpressions Bath by GentleNight

The writer Edward Talon-Crow preferred
To sleep in caskets much like this, I've heard.
For Sims with hearts that hold legions of woe,
This bed will surely set your soul aglow!

Elegantly crafted in the spirit of relaxed sophistication, this double bed sports a tufted silk headboard and a money-back guarantee to safely deliver you to dreamland as you bask in its idyllic silhouette!

With spiral posts reminiscent of a fabled maelstrom, this bed has an idyllic, yet unsettling, appeal. It will draw you in with its siren song and keep you wanting to sleep for ages! Just make sure to set an alarm, and make sure it's extra loud! Or tell a friend you're buying it. Safety first!

Just because your little one sings along with the eerie song of the creatures of darkness doesn't mean they shouldn't get a good night's sleep! Like, you know what I mean? You can be all like, "Hey, Timmy, the haunting reverie can wait, little guy! Whaddya say I read you some of your favorite horror book, eh? It's time for bed!" And your kid is all like, "Haha, good one, mom! I have three ghost friends that are passing through the veil tonight and there's no way I'm missing that!"\nAnd then the camera slowly pans to my flabbergasted face. Laugh track plays. And before I know it, knock knock! It's the front door, and it's my neighbor. She works for Grim now. The Grim. She called herself a "Grimtern" or something.\nI live in a parody of my own existence.

By: Vulfgang Mulder\n\nBlad the Bad is not a typical bumbling vampire. He doesn’t lounge in coffins, hiding from the sun, and common cooking ingredients. Due to a preternatural immunity to garlic, a caffeine addiction, and a tube of SPF 50, Blad has become a werewolf’s worst nightmare - efficient. His bloody reign of fathomless carnage is horrifyingly competent. Hordes of Sims drained of life. Hundreds of werewolves dead of embarrassment. Only a werewolf can stop his bloodthirsty yet well-organized rampage...but first, they must survive The Cringe!

By: Edward Talon-Crow\n\nGary is invited to his friend Brick Flusher's childhood home, an old mansion sitting atop the tallest hill in Ravenwood. As Gary begins his stay over, he experiences many washroom-related oddities, plunging him into a dangerous world of wealth and waste. Can Gary survive the unearthing of these dirty secrets that clog the legacy of the Flusher family? Or will he find himself mired in the stink of shame as he's flushed away for good?
The Fall of the House of Flusher

By: Vary Smelley\n\nLlamabelle was a doll made in the spirit of sad, monochrome monotony. It wore on her, being so dreary in a world full of color. She craved the fruity flavors of frilly cakes they sold in the town markets, the pretty dresses that the real girls wore as they skipped to school. When she first heard of the existence of Silly Gummy Bear Pancakes, she had to try cooking them. Of course, with no skill, she created a spectacular fire, in which her creator perished. Now in her fifth home, the ashes of her previous four homes dusted off, she's getting the urge to cook again...
By: Barry A. Lighve\n\nUncover the mysteries of the other side. Delve into the details of paranormal speculation, psychological sciences, and forensic findings.

By: Em T. Graves\n\nA Sims go-to strategy is often sobbing over the recently departed. With this volume, gain understanding of one's own mortal coil and be introduced to further learnings of loss, coping, and the several "stages" of grief. Published on tear-stained pages for tactile teachings.
By: D.O. Arrivalls\n\nMuch like toaster instructions, this guidebook can help any ghost or ghoul transition to the Netherworld with ease! Results may vary.
Thanatology Vol 2: Handbook for the Recently Expired

Hey, kids! A little birdie told me you like to read. If so, this bookcase would be absolutely perfect for your nest. It even sports plenty of little nooks and crannies to place all of your best trinkets and doodads. Don't settle for less!

Remember the smaller Tower of Tomes that contains multitudes? This one can contain even more multitudes. With a larger bookshelf, the infinite permutations of books you could buy and store in it are an even larger infinity than that of the smaller Tower of Tomes. You might be wondering, how can one infinity be smaller than another, since they're both infinite? Well, that's actually a mathematical concept you could learn if you bought a book about it. Just buy the bigger bookcase. Trust me.
The Taller Tower of Tomes by Tell-Tale Arts

What types of tomes might this bookcase hold? Perhaps they vary as widely as the Sims who own them. This bookcase can contain multitudes. For example, it could hold tomes of comedy, philosophy, allegory, poetry, astronomy, fantasy... ahem, like I said, multitudes! The limit is your imagination.
The Tower of Tomes by Tell-Tale Arts

It's so mysterious to me why we haven't seen more bookends like these, with cute little geometric crows on either end. Trust me, if you gaze into the future, once you own these lovely little bookends, life will be a breeze!

By: Em T. Graves\n\nA Sim's go-to strategy is often sobbing over the recently departed. With this volume, gain understanding of one's own mortal coil and be introduced to further learnings of loss, coping, and the several "stages" of grief. Published on tear-stained pages for tactile teachings.
Who to reap, how to reap, when to reap, and other information to feed the soul.

Oh wow, isn't this just the most perfect little aesthetic journal for you to tote around, taking note of your potential bucket list items as you sip your perfect little latte and live your perfect little life? Maybe at brunch next week you could bring it along as you tell the same five stories you've been repeating for the last few months about your iconic vacation in Tartosa last summer. Oh wait, you've stopped doing brunch because none of the restaurants in town carry the exact brand of nectar you insist on drinking with every meal because Sims from (you guessed it) Tartosa do that and it allegedly makes them live extra long? Of course! How could I forget...
Who to reap, how to reap, when to reap, and other information to feed the soul.

If there's one thing we've learned about our fellow Sims after 80 years in the "death & dying" business, it's that we all just keep dying! Grandpa caught a case of being too old to run on that treadmill of his seven times in one day? Dad caught a case of house fire making pancakes? Well, look no further! After countless of you sprang for The Classic Casket 1, we've brought you the Classic Casket 2! It's got everything you loved and hated about the first model, but double it all! The good and the bad! Take a chance for once and, well, if you hate it, then cope!

What if using your kitchen cabinets was as easy as opening the cabinet, seeing what you want, and pulling it out? At Schmapple, we've worked hard to deliver that for you. It's the cabinet of the future. It's the life you've always dreamed of, with a healthy dose of cynicism chic. Inspired by Vincent Schmapple's recent journey of self-discovery, his recovery from the grief of laying off his favorite private chef. His Wednesdays will truly never be the same without her. In a life full of difficult, character-defining choices like those, you can rest easy knowing these cabinets align with Schmapple's belief that life should be simple, sleek, and streamlined.
The Modern Grimpressions Cabinet by Schmapple
The firing of a cannon at a funeral is known for its symbolism, its pomp, and a really cool way to get attention and set the tone.

There's something most folks can't describe about spending a night in Ravenwood. Tendrils of fog meander through the usually clear countryside air. And ghosts weave through them, roaming the streets as frequently as living Sims. It's truly something to behold. Perhaps warming up by a nice fireplace could quell the chill of a ghostly night, or perhaps it just comes with the territory!

We here at Tell-Tale Arts are acutely aware that time goes by, sometimes so slowly, sometimes too quickly. But there's no need to get hung up on the inexorable passage of time. For example, about 10 seconds have passed since you started reading this. And there's nothing you can do about it! With that in mind, this clock is the perfect heirloom to pass down from generation to generation, reminding each of your descendants of the ephemerality of their existence.
The Inexorable Grandfather Clock by Tell-Tale Arts

Though basic in name, this Tarot Deck makes up for it in cosmic wisdom. When summoning the forces from beyond this veil, pulling a card for yourself or others, please do remember to pause and gaze upon the beautiful artwork that accompany these mystical messages.
Lady Ravendancer's deck is available only to the elite members of the Order of Lenore who have collected all tarot cards in Ravenwood. Use your cards wisely—or not at all!

The Fool is merely a joyful Harlequin oblivious to the perils which surround him. Steadfast towards a dangerous ledge, one may wonder if he will awaken before plunging into the depths of his own naivety? Should he stay this wide-eyed, the only adventures he will partake in are those beyond the veil.

As an old soul, The Hermit, stands at the peak of her growth and accomplishments. Guided by the light of life, she steadies herself upon her broom, a symbol of her own authority over time's dusty existence. Though the full path ahead may not be revealed, she strides forth with conviction, out of the darkness and into the light. Balancing introspection with caution towards loneliness should no one knock her way.

Immersed amongst the building blocks of life and death, The Wheel of Fortune spins its cycle to determine one's destiny. The wheel holds both the learnings of the Cowplant and the ever approaching fate of the Netherworld. Forever in rotation, as one comes up the other must come down.

Harken, to the noble virtues of structure, law, and truth. Justice maintains the logical stance requisite for dispensing all mystic equity. Each deed may bear the weight of its own consequence, and with a single stroke, a verdict may be rendered. Logic alone cannot be sufficient in this determination, thus intuition is honored to balance the scales. She remains the spiritual repercussions of one's own acts.

Relinquish thyself to the power of Suspension! Behold, he now hangs betwixt the threads of time, having sacrificed his soul for greater enlightenment. His serenity can be shared, so long as one surrenders fully. Delays only yield inevitable conclusions.

Akin to a coursing river, life ebbs and flows along its winding path towards destiny. Temperance rests with one fin attuned to this aqueous existence and the other grounded in reality. She maintains infinite duality with emphasis on harmonizing purpose with patience. One should try and test the waters before diving in.

In the dead of night, Evil may beckon, as if to tug on one's own puppet string. With his hypnotic stare, anyone can fall prey to his influence. And the longer one stays within this trance, the more susceptible to his power they become.

Chaos. Destruction. The Tower, thought to be a sturdy constant, reveals itself a mere façade. With flames aglow and meteors in flight, the universe has uttered its decree! In the midst of unrest, the only hope remains divine intervention.

Beneath The Star she kneels, a paragon of divine grace. Nourishing the soil below, she pours fresh water as a means to restore and renew. Intuitively she dips one foot into the cosmic pool for spiritual connection, the other half of her grounded in practicality and strength. Only a pigeon bears witness to this healing, giving thoughts of hope in spite of despair.

Howl at The Moon while its followers bask in the luminous glow. This dim cast reveals one's own dreams and intuition quite brightly. Walk the delicate line between the caution of society and the fury of the natural world, for it's often difficult for one to discern the right path.

Radiating positivity, The Sun shines overhead, a source of all life and energy throughout. A seedling sits proudly upon the back of a majestic stallion, embodying innocence upheld by strength and nobility. Happiness is on the horizon for those who embrace life to its fullest.

Cast in symbolic wizardry, The Magician embodies the notion "Fru Aboo, Sol Beluv". He dances between microcosms of time and space, bringing harmony amongst the elements. To conjure his wisdom and ancient power, one may manifest their own most fervent dreams. Behold! The universe's tapestry unfolds and stars align.

Meet thy maker, or in this case, baker? To stare into this face of danger means confronting Judgment head on. Actions shall be weighed accordingly and decisions made final. A glimpse of death might plant in one's mind, since relaying judgment often leads to dead ends and fresh beginnings.

Continuing the cycle of completion and simulating new beginnings, The World depicts a future fraught with possibilities. As one level ends, another begins. Guided by the four elements, four seasons, four corners of the universe—one may persist in their cosmic journey.

Through simmering flames rises the primal energy necessary to push forward the cycle of creation. Associated with action, Wands imbue a powerful ambition. One may lean into cultivating plans, or fall into the directionless spiral of recklessness.

Cups flow relentlessly with the spillage of emotions. What drives one's deepest desires is the influence of relationships, romantic or not. It's best not to get lost within imagination, for fantasy can cause disconnect and result in uncontrollable feelings.

Breathe in, breathe out. Fresh air helps stimulate the mind, a double-edged faculty familiar to Swords. One's logic can be used for both good and evil, and thus our greatest conflicts can stem from this balancing act. It is vital to find harmony between honesty and harshness.
Of all things otherworldly and material, Coins exemplify security. Grounding one's self can ensure care for the future. Unchecked, and one can turn down a path of greed and unbridled ambition.

All must succumb to death's embrace, yet therein lies a beauty within times changing. With fluttering purity, and a gesture to restart, Death greets one with the hope of transformation. Death grants no exemptions (except for when he totally does), but an end heralds a new beginning. One should welcome this life anew, resigning to transition with ease.

Seen and unseen, thou art the path between. The High Spellcaster dwells where light and dark share a delicate balance. Those who draw wisdom from this duality may unlock her ethereal presence. As a vessel of divine femininity, her essence and the cycle of the moon are closely entwined. She personifies magic in all forms and is guided by the rhythmic pulse of her own Intuition.

By the grace of nature and nobility, The Empress personifies love, beauty, fertility, and creativity. Rejuvenated by creation's lush presence, she draws her peace from Mother Nature's wellspring. With every journey she embarks on, she is blessed with abundance, as if the universe delights in her perseverance.

Upholding his Code, The Emperor be perched atop his mighty throne. His sway be unchallenged, his dominion unquestioned. A dead man tells no tales, but a pirate be known to spin a yarn or two. He's well earned the respect and loyalty of his crew, but if ye be seekin' more than just gold, ye best be diggin' deeper, for therein lies his treasured heart.

Once upon a winter's time dwelt a wise sage, The Advocate. He held not just gifts, but promises of a brighter future, for he knew that the greatest gift of all was that of knowledge. As he spreads wisdom like fallen snow, he also brings laughter and cheer. He stands as a bridge between the known and unknown, unlocking mysteries of the universe with every lesson.

The Lovers, with enough blazing passion to set their own estate aflame, serve as both a symbol of devotion and a cautionary tale. Amidst the delicate threads of an arranged union, these lovers burn for one another in more ways than one. A gentle reminder to eschew the siren call of emotional folly and instead, embrace the art of harmonious communication. For it paves the way to everlasting love.

With the strength of his mind and willpower, The Chariot needs no reins. As with land, one must grab onto their goals by taking action. Though tugged by opposing forces, the charioteer steers with sheer resolve. Be forewarned, failing to grasp control of one's own life can lead to being lost in a swirl of directionless rhythms.

In the midst of grave danger, a woman channels immense Strength to safeguard her gnome companion. Yet, it is her determination and mastery which truly captivates the eye. Her force is calculated, her actions disciplined. With cosmic courage, she demonstrates that by harnessing one's inner instincts with strength and resilience, raw passions can unfold positive results. Within her lies infinite potential.
Deathly frogs that are known to hold ghostly power within.

Dearest Customers,

It's everything I said about the original Modern Grimpressions Counter, but now with the added bonus of being the centerpiece of your kitchen. Need I say more?

Looking to the future,
Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Counter Island by Schmapple
