Dearest Customers, I knew this day would come eventually. It's time for Schmapple to branch out from appliances. I've been meditating on other household items, and I believe I've found my calling in counters. What if using a counter was as easy as finding the space and placing objects upon it? Believe it or not, I've brought Schmapple-grade levels of innovation to the counter space. We've achieved a new level of easy functionality and relentless style. With a touch of edge inspired by the doom that awaits us all, this counter is guaranteed to forever up your expectations for how a counter integrates into your life. This counter isn't just a counter. It's a platform, with the potential for more than just a simple surface. This is just the beginning! Have fun, Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Counter by Schmapple

Hailing straight from Grim's secret aviary, these immortal corvids are ready to dazzle, delight, and engage in all manner of deviousness with you. Show your crow affection, plot with them, send them on recon missions, or help them learn to mimic with you. Just avoid provoking them—doing so risks life and limb.

Hailing straight from Grim's secret aviary, these immortal corvids are ready to dazzle, delight, and engage in all manner of deviousness with you. Show your crow affection, plot with them, send them on recon missions, or help them learn to mimic with you. Just avoid provoking them—doing so risks life and limb.

A stone marvel of obsidian and granite, the Crypt of Eternity holds many secrets. Inside, grand halls and narrow corridors house solemn sarcophagi and urns, amidst flickering torchlight and faded tapestries. Lay loved ones to rest here, but don't be fooled, this labyrinthine tomb is filled with mysteries and wonders, and invites only the brave to explore its mighty halls. The call of treasure is enticing, but be warned, many creatures roam these halls and do not take kindly to strangers.

A stone marvel of obsidian and granite, the Crypt of Eternity holds many secrets. Inside, grand halls and narrow corridors house solemn sarcophagi and urns, amidst flickering torchlight and faded tapestries. Lay loved ones to rest here, but don't be fooled, this labyrinthine tomb is filled with mysteries and wonders, and invites only the brave to explore its mighty halls. The call of treasure is enticing, but be warned, many creatures roam these halls and do not take kindly to strangers.
This hole looks like it was made by a mid-sized malevolent spirit… or maybe it’s just shoddy manufacturing!
This hole looks like it was made by a large malevolent spirit, but was it trying to get in or out?! Do we really want to know?
This hole looks like it was made by a small malevolent spirit, but you really shouldn’t judge the malevolent spirit by the size of the hole.

Slightly larger sections of brick have begun to show on this wall, as the decay further sets in. Like a lake whose lonely waters grow still and chilly, driving away the greenery that once shrouded its surface, the poor wall has only just begun its journey to shed its lively veneer. How daring for it to endure! Come to think of it, I really should make sure to encourage this little wall...

Yes, yes! Can't you see, little wall? It's just as I predicted! This bit of wear and tear here, it's mostly exposed brick! The cruel ebb and flow of time has revealed even more of your true nature to the world. But you know what, little wall? I'm proud of you, for being so brave through it all, and still standing after all this time. You should be heralded as an inspiration to walls everywhere.

This wall, its dreams haunted by ill spirits, has begun to decay. In time, small shreds of brick will begin to show. This is only the beginning of a long descent into the claws of entropy, foretold by the stars. But for a Sim whose heart contains a legion of woes, perhaps this bit of chaos is a soothing sight. Thought that might of little comfort to the wall itself, I'd imagine. Perhaps I should ask the wall...

A vertical strip of decay. It almost looks as if the wall began to cry once the bricks comprising its core began to show.\n\nAhem... Listen here, little wall! Sure, it's not easy showing your true self in a world judges you so harshly. Though these days have been hard for you, don't despair...yet! Soon, you'll be covered in many such little vulnerabilities. It only gets harder from here!

What do you see when gazing upon this little bit of wear and tear? If you said a chicken, then you shall have the best meal of your life in a week. If you said a shrugging, floating t-shirt, you'll stain your favorite shirt next time you wear it! Be careful! If you said anything else, you're objectively wrong. Try again next time!

What do you see when gazing upon this little bit of wear and tear? If you said a giant bat flying through the clouds, then you shall be free of something that burdens you in the near future. If you said a piece of land on a map, you might find yourself somewhere unexpected one year from now! If you said anything else, you're objectively wrong. Try again next time!

What do you see when gazing upon this little bit of wear and tear? If you said a mouse yelling at a cloud, then you will find yourself in a futile argument sometime in the near future. If you said a hatless gnome front flipping off of a cloud, perhaps it's time to take the leap and try that new thing you've been putting off! If you said anything else, you're objectively wrong. Try again next time!

This is a captivating floral wall decal that merges the elegance of nature with a macabre twist. Available in haunting shades of reds, greens, or blues, this unique design brings an eerie, mysterious charm to any space. It creates a striking focal point with its shadowy, whispering blooms. What do they whisper, you might ask? Well, that's the thing, no one can understand it! It's all unintelligible. Hence, the mystery.

Life? Death? Mortality? It's all whatever, man. All this around us? It's really about what's real. It's about being real. Sims? We are real. Grim? He's real. Crows? Real. Ravens? Dunno, never seen one in real life. So those are totally not real. Ravenwood? That's where we are. That's real. Sixam? Dunno, never been there. NOT real, duh.

What do you yearn for? The restoration of a world that once was, that feels just out of reach? Or perhaps you yearn to secure the legacy of your people, remembered as they were and as they are now. Or perhaps it's for something otherworldly and inexplicable, like ham that tastes vaguely of despair. Rest assured, this urn knows your deepest desires, and will do absolutely nothing about it!

This desk is perfect for wallowing in the shallow monotony of your day-to-day life. You know, those days when you suit up, punch in, work, punch out, repeat? And every waking hour you spend as a cog in the machine contributes to a growing debt of joy and fulfillment? What a sad ballad we sing in life's concert...
The Modern Grimpressions Desk by GentleNight

Legend has it that each of these desks includes a single piece of the root of the Guardian Tree of Ravenwood. Now, for legal reasons we're required to inform you that it isn't really true. They say that tree has a real personality on it, and we aren't looking to get on its bad side. But hey, it's a fun little white lie to tell your friends!
The Guardian Desk by Tell-Tale Arts

Dearest Customers, What else can I say? This is Dishwashing to the Power of You! We've streamlined the process for washing dishes to make it as easy as picking up your dirty dishes, placing them in the dishwasher, then retrieving them sparkling clean. Believe it or not, life can be that easy. I've had them installed in all of my guest houses. They've received rave reviews from guests and maids alike. Be sure to check out some of the other items from our Modern Grimpressions collaboration collection with GentleNight. They've worked hard to keep up with Schmapple's rigorous quality standards, and sacrificed much to do it. I think it paid off! To a squeaky clean future, Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Dishwasher by Schmapple

All great things come in twos! Peanut butter and jelly, cheese and crackers, doors and...doors! We're huge fans of duos here at Tell-Tale Arts. We appreciate the duality of Sims. We appreciate the duality of these doors. And we even appreciate the duality of the iconic Ravenwood writer who inspires us to make the beautiful pieces we create, Edward Talon-Crow. It's said he wasn't quite as macabre as he outwardly claimed to be. Though it was proven to be a rumor, it's still fun to imagine, right?
At Death's Double Door by Tell-Tale Arts

We here at Tell-Tale Arts would like to take this opportunity to rescind our earlier statement, in the advertising copy for our product At Death's Double Door, that Edward Talon-Crow was not a very macabre Sim. It was wrong of us to give credence to such heinous rumors! Now please, Mr. Talon-Crow, if you have any forgiveness in that ghostly heart of yours, could you stop breaking the sinks in our offices? Our interns are getting tired of mopping.
At Death's (Taller) Double Door by Tell-Tale Arts
A door so chilling, even your most demonic dissenters will be too afraid to make judgmental comments as they pass through it.

An even taller door so chilling, even your most-...ugh, you know what? No! I've had it. I'm so beyond done with these. Go read the other Eerie Elegance product descriptions. Same deal here. Sigh. I've been informed the show must go on. "Something something tall double doors that are so scary looking, even your annoying neighbors are scared! Oooh la la, if you buy this door, you are sooooo cool and intimidating!" There, are you happy now?

What potential does a doorway hold? The pathway to a promising future? A portal to an unknown world of wonder? Or perhaps an exit, leading to a fitting end for the Sim who passes though?\nThis door is none of those, obviously. It's just a door. Granted, it's a very opulent one, but just a door nonetheless. Please tailor your expectations accordingly.
At Death's Door by Tell-Tale Arts

When it comes to potential portals to the unknown offered by Tell-Tale Arts, this is certainly the less opulent option. But it's still quite a sight! You should ask that skull his name. Perhaps he's the trusty skeletal assistant of a graying necromancer from the age of dragons. Or perhaps he's the friend of a certain bony maid that works down the street.
At Death's (Less Gilded) Door by Tell-Tale Arts

With a sharp creeeeeak, Lady Ravendancer Goth heard the old wooden door fight its aging hinges. A cold wind had blown it open, a terrifying omen for something otherworldly approaching. As she sat up, she didn't even need to light a candle to see the shadowed figure that appeared, his ominous form visible despite blending in so well with the night. He was wearing a black hooded cloak and holding a square-shaped, illuminated object in his withered hand. She couldn't identify the alien object he held...perhaps it most resembled a thin book emitting inexplicable light.\nHer tired eyes widened as she noticed images projected in the glow, flashing by as he swiped the lit surface. The figure made a sound that almost sounded like a laugh as he noticed how spellbound she was by the imagery. He hesitated for a moment, as if pondering his next move, before suddenly disappearing in tendrils of black smoke. For centuries, she sought to recreate those depicting people and places she would likely never truly know, all seen in what felt like an instant on that fateful night she unknowingly cheated death. Those recreations would eventually become her renowned tarot deck.

Don't open the bottom left drawer. Don't open the bottom left drawer. DON'T OPEN THE BOTTOM LEFT DRAWER! Nothing's been the same here since we did. Please, it needs to sleep. Don't open the-\n\nEditor's Note: We tried to contact GentleNight about this piece to see if they wanted to finish the description. They claimed GentleNight has never made a dresser before. Further attempts to contact have been unsuccessful.
The Modern Grimpressions Dresser by GentleNight
The Ancestor cliff face watches over Whispering Glen.

This fireplace has wicked tales to tell, carved from wood specially harvested from the phantasmal forests of Ravenwood's most peculiar perimeter. It's said that Edward Talon-Crow used to carve his own pencils from this wood* to pen his famous stories. And here at Tell-Tale Arts, we're the only furniture company allowed to use it, because we said so!\n\n*For legal reasons, this claim has not been confirmed by Ravenwood historians.
The Dawn Fire's Place by Tell-Tale Arts

Dearest Customers, Years ago I asked myself a simple question. What if using a fridge was as easy as opening the door, and touching the food you wished to select? So I iterated upon that thought, and made The Schmapple Fridge. A sleek, virtually indestructible fridge that was as easy as open, take, and close? What more could any Sim want? I've had ten years to manipulate The Schmapple Fridge in my mind palace, wondering what more I could add. What if you didn't even have to open it to see inside? You could make all your decisions from the outside looking in. Which artisan cold brew shall I sip today? How many courses did my private chef prepare for dinner tonight? These mundane things that Sims of the world would spend several valuable minutes a day contemplating with the fridge door open, they can all be done with this door closed. Of course, with this design update, it's no longer unbreakable. But what's life without a little risk? You're welcome, Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Fridge by Schmapple
Take your funeral to the next level with this platform for your burial casket. Guaranteed to elevate both your remains and your funeral's aesthetic!
The Fearless Funeral Bier by Tell-Tale Arts
This rustic gate holds many untold tales in every stain and tear. Luckily for Grim, it doesn't speak...yet.
A gate so chilling, even the most irksome interlopers running by your house will be too afraid to make judgmental comments!

Earned when performing Evil and Good Ghost Mastery abilities. Rumor has it there's a mysterious merchant in Ravenwood that's driven by a thirst for forbidden knowledge and ghostly powers, who will pay top Simoleon for Essence, which can become quite lucrative. Honestly, who needs a job in the Afterlife?! Make this your new hustle for some easy Simoleon!

[Redacted] Laboratories - Strangerville Branch is legally obligated to inform you that the stone used to construct this gravesite was grown from synthetic material, mainly comprised of [Redacted] and small traces of (allegedly) toxic [Redacted]. We've done our best to ensure that living Sims who come in contact with the stone only have a [Redacted]% chance of experiencing side effects!\nTo better serve our valued customers, we've streamlined our process for answering any questions you may have! Please forward all complaints via phone to [Redacted], and please select the number [Redacted] when prompted by the automated menu. It's simple!

Once your refined spirit has escaped the confines of your mortal shell, how would you feel if your ghostly eyes spotted something processed and unnatural at your gravesite? Fortunately, this gravesite is fully organic, filled with dirt sourced from the finest artisan mud piles in Selvadorada and air dried for two weeks in the Tartosan sun. You can truly Rest in Peace with the knowledge that everyone will know how much better you were than them.

Imagine showing up to the graveyard and looking...plain, with an utterly mundane headstone. It's a dead giveaway that you didn't prioritize aesthetics! Show some spirit in your final declaration of style and prove to everyone that being boring is a dying practice.

Life is messy. It's a sprawling, bittersweet cosmic jumble of juxtaposed emotions and memories. Why not represent all that perfect imperfection with a headstone as amalgamated as the chaotic gift of life?

Consider a Sim who has reached the summit, experienced all there is to experience, achieved everything under the sun. Is there no better candidate for enjoying a well-deserved eternal rest than such a decorated Sim? But consider this for a moment. Wouldn't many a Sim like that relish the challenge of another chance at life, reborn anew as someone completely different? To do this, they'd simply need to achieve the final phase of their soul's journey. Sure, it's a lofty goal. But what's an added layer of challenge to a Sim who has achieved it all?

An archived etching of the engraving that once could be read on Edward Talon-Crow's headstone, prior to its mysterious disappearance years after his demise. When faced with many an accusation, of a joyful life lived in elation, I scoff, and urge you to recall, The way I lived, first of all. Of the macabre? I am the most. Even as a simple ghost. Remember this about me first... I thrive in darkness, never cursed.

A grave that marks the end of an era and the beginning of another much more hopeful one. Perhaps this is the perfect gravestone to commemorate a cheeky little Sim who faced the trials of life's shadowy depths, all the while craving the sun. Though, perhaps not the full, concentrated power of the sun after so many years spent out of it. Just a little bit of sun, as a treat, darling!

It doesn't take a genius to know this headstone is top of the line! And let's face the facts, you're headed for the other side of at some point. So why not get that through your thick skull, get ahead in life (and death) and buy it now?

Perfect for kindly Sims who lived their lives mesmerized by the untarnished beauty and grace of nature. In the spirit of those Sims and their legacy, Ravenwood's Guardian Tree is a symbol of unexpected vibrancy amid bleak darkness. Well, vibrancy of personality, at least. Someone might mistake it for a very old, and maybe even dead, tree. Until they hear it speak, of course.
A plant known to be used to make Grimbrosia
A single tier of lights for you to illuminate your space, with a modern twist! Drive out the shadow and linger in a little bit of light, as a treat.

Imagine waking up in a cold sweat surrounded by pure darkness. You stumble out of bed, finding yourself on yet another wander through the night. In the distance, you see a beautiful light. Not just one light, but a whole host of them. They color your night, painting your view with comfort and serenity. No shadow is safe from the light of this chandelier, adorned with candles that possess a glow warm enough to burn your dread.
This big ol' slab of bar light hangs low, but has a high impact! It'll launch the atmosphere of any venue to the next level.
Two tiers of lights for you to illuminate your space, with a modern twist! Drive out the shadow and linger in a little bit of light, as a treat.

While the forces of darkness may be beautiful and iconic, sometimes we need a bit of light. Perhaps this torch is a bit of a compromise, one that sages of light and witches of darkness might find singularly appealing. Plus, fire is cool. Unless you're a Sim who is chased by death, in which case it's a reminder that Grim is always lurking...

There is something warm about this string of lights, and it's not just the voltage! Perhaps it's the comforting pattern of alternating sizes that will keep those dark nights aglow but will (most likely) not blind you or your guests, wherever you may choose to put them.
A candle lit for the deceased.

Even though this lamp can't tell the future, it's got a cute little geometric crow on it. Perfect for Ravenwood residents that enjoy sleek, contemporary interiors. Or people who really like crows. Like, just look at that little angular guy!
Did you know triangles are my favorite shape? They're pretty simple, really. They've got three points where two lines meet. This one's no exception.
Capture the otherworldly charm of Ravenwood's Mourningvale neighborhood with this little lamp. It sports a timeless style that could outlive even the Guardian Tree!

Crafted by famed Ravenwood metalworker Lucaris Del Norte, this lamp features four curled prongs at the bottom that resemble the talons of a crow. Among all of his peers at The Vinter Metallurgy, Lucaris is renowned for his dark and elegant, yet sensible, designs. And this lamp is the perfect representation of his panache, featuring a deadly combination of timeless style and perfect function! Just be careful around those talons. They might scratch.

In our willingness to buy mediocre light fixtures, we reveal our lack of courage to stand up to a system that doesn't respect us. Would you rather remain complacent in your ways, lighting your home with forgettable little bargains, or would you burn it all down for A Light Supreme? Don't just go with the status quo—friction is power, my friend! Featuring metalwork that's hand-forged by artists at the Archangel Collective in our headquarters, hidden underground in an undisclosed neighborhood of San Myshuno.

Drink deep and enjoy the light from this candle ensconced in a chalice-like holder. It emits a light that could make even the deepest of dungeons feel like home, a glow so full of life it could have a necromancer clutching their pearls.
Chalice of the Dead Candle Sconce

This lamp's vintage style is evocative of a grand masquerade ball, attended by nobility from all over. It brings to mind the allure of courtly intrigue, a mirthful air of debauchery, and even delicious frilly cakes! Perhaps it's the type of lamp that could ease some of the dread of the daily grind.

In Loving Memory: A Tribute Collection is proud to introduce A Touching Indoor Memorial Display, the perfect place to commemorate your passed loved ones' cherished items, memories or urn.\n\nThis display can hold an array of small sentimental items, including (but not limited to) A Timeless Capture that lets you remember them as they once were, Scents You've Been Gone incense, or the Whispering Wren Messenger Statue that gives you a way to still send them a heartfelt note, wherever they may be.
In Loving Memory: A Touching Indoor Memorial Display

In Loving Memory: A Tribute Collection also features A Touching Outdoor Memorial Display, for use in Cemeteries, in the home garden, or any other exterior location your loved ones might appreciate as a resting place for their urn or other cherished items.\n\nThis display can hold an array of small sentimental items, including (but not limited to) A Timeless Capture that lets you remember them as they once were, Scents You've Been Gone incense, or the Whispering Wren Messenger Statue that gives you a way to still send them a heartfelt note, wherever they may be.
In Loving Memory: A Touching Outdoor Memorial Display

In Loving Memory: A Tribute Collection presents its most prized piece, A Timeless Capture. This frame allows you to remember your loved ones as they once were. A touching addition for Funerals, gravesites, or home Memorial Displays, reminding ourselves that passing is not the end and the most special memories last forever.
In Loving Memory: A Timeless Capture
Look at you, you thing of beauty! Take a long look as you suit up. It's a wild world out there, you never know if it'll be your last chance to do so.

Perhaps it's okay to indulge in the fun little fancies you stumble across in life. Take, for example, swinging around on this finely crafted set of metal bars. At the very least, it makes for a quaint reprieve from the constant brooding! How's that for optimism?

Capable of sending a spark of life through even the coldest of hearts, this wonderful little music box is tuned to the key of nostalgia. Oh yes, you will be wallowing in a cozy puddle of bittersweet recollection. You will dwell on every poignant moment you yearn to relive (or forget!). But that's okay, that's just what it means to be a Sim. And this little guy will provide a somber soundtrack every step of the way, if you'll have him!

A collection of stunning prints featured on the tarot cards of Ravenwood, both invented and popularized by the local visionary herself, Lady Ravendancer Goth. Depicting scenes that are evocative of the many twists and turns of a Sim's life, these prints make great statement pieces. What type of statement they make, however, is entirely dependent on the card you select...

One day, when his friend Onyx was cooped up once again working his art, spellcaster Noah Fort had an idea. What if one could simply conjure art with magic? It could be efficient, requiring no skill, and inspired by existing paintings. Noah got to work, producing hundreds of spell-generated paintings in a day, bottling his spells to sell. They seemed to be works of great value. But upon closer inspection, they looked off, lacking any substance or vision.\nBut neither Noah, nor his customers, knew enough about art to tell. Soon, Noah's business took off. Homes filled with spell-generated paintings. "Artists" everywhere were posting them on Social Bunny, or even selling them for commissions under false pretenses. Noah's business failed, however, when Sims got better at identifying these falsified works and saw them as uncool.\nMeanwhile, Onyx finished his year-long project, a hauntingly beautiful set of paintings inspired by his hometown, Ravenwood. Years later, Onyx's paintings are heralded as some of the finest work of the recent century. Yet no one could remember Noah's work, or that of his customers. No amount of magic or efficiency can replace the value of a Sim with passion.
The Death of Shame by Onyx Shadowmist
Sponsored by The Netherworld Department of Death, this gallery wall is guaranteed to inspire even the laziest of your Grimterns! Now get reaping, folks. We have a brand to maintain!
Adorn your finest room with an heirloom that captures timeless family bonds. This vintage portrait adds a touch of historical charm while boasting the personal touch of the residing household.

This marvelous stone parapet will certainly cast a dramatic shadow over your house. Perfect for intimidating the neighbors. Because why not have a veritable castle for a house? Top it with style and the haters will cease their smiles!

Not only is this pedestal great for putting in corners and displaying your baubles, it also doubles as a perch for mythical or extinct creatures that miraculously happened to show up in your company's headquarters! Rest assured, we had that llamagriff sent to a safer home. Now, if only we could do away with those pesky walking cowplants chasing us down the halls...
The Modern Grimpressions Pedestal by GentleNight

For your loved ones who have passed, crafted with ironically lifelike flowers and lush greenery that offers a timeless tribute. Beautifully tied together with one big bow and offered in a variety of different flowers and colors.

These dried leaves are ancient, apparently. I mean, that's what the lady said who sold them to my grandmother 40 years ago. Apparently she bought them from someone 50 years before that and, well, you get the idea.

Is this a withered plant that once brightly bloomed? Or were the leaves always a bit sad looking? This plant is one that requires quiet contemplation, a plant that straddles the delicate line between life and death. It will be a strikingly curious piece for any home, either way.

A wheat stalk arrangement with five long fluffy wheat stems beautifully showcased in a nearly transparent glass vase. Perfect for a Sim who wants a bit of plant life in their home, but feels that something green would be too bright. Available in various muted colors, this vase perfectly blends rustic simplicity with modern design.

Where did it come from? And why does it feel so oddly familiar? It’s as if a part of something—or someone—has been left behind, though you can’t quite place it. Maybe it’s better not to ask too many questions…some mysteries are best left unsolved.
Here, heartfelt eulogies are shared, celebrating the life and journey of a cherished soul.

Do you ever find yourself looking at modern podiums and thinking, "Does a podium seriously need metal plating and frilly bits? Whatever happened to good ol' hand-carved, classic wooden podiums that get the job done?" Well, you're in luck! This one brings back that effortless style of the old days, when life was better (for you) and things were simpler (for you!)
Studded Spires & Filthy Liars Rocking Chair

Add a touch of eerie elegance to your home with this tall, pointed roof décor piece. Reminiscent of ancient castles and haunted mansions, it brings an air of mystery and history. Perfect for enhancing the gothic appeal of old houses, it transforms any roof into a spine-chilling, majestic masterpiece.
Somehow, this spire is even ghostlier than the original Ghostly Spire Pinnacle. Don't ask me how, I just work here!

This roof piece is reminiscent of a romantic grandeur long lost to time. This elegant, arrow-like piece captures the essence of historical sophistication and timeless beauty. It will make your home stand out and look like architecturally dramatic gem. Perfect for restoring classic charm, and stunting on the neighbors with dramatic panache.
Some crows sing smaller songs! A beautiful, small rug by the famous textile giant, Lunvik's Loom. It carries with it all the same rumored emotional turmoil as the larger version!
The Crow's Smaller Lament by Lunvik's Loom

The longer you stare into the center of this rug, the more you'll find its hypnotic patterns hold many secrets. They scale from mundane curiosities to unspeakable horrors. Just make sure to keep the more unspeakable ones actually unspoken. You know, to maintain that aura of mystery. We can't have just anyone knowing about the abominations that lurk in the great beyond, now, can we?

Some crows sing grandiose songs! A beautiful large rug by the famous textile giant, Lunvik's Loom. It's rumored that Pernilla Lunvik created these more macabre-inspired designs as a nod to (or perhaps in spite of) her former lover, Edward Talon-Crow, when he left San Myshuno after they broke up.
The Crow's Larger Lament by Lunvik's Loom

Want to spread a little Ravenwood spirit? These assorted banners and pennants are perfect for that. Pairs well with The Pole in the Dark to make sure the banners aren't spookily floating with nothing to hold them up. Though, I suppose that would be in the spirit of Ravenwood...

Don't walk into it! Pairs well with The Lights in the Dark or The Banners in the Dark to spread a little gloom or cheer, or to light up the area so you don't walk into poles that happen to be hiding in the dark.
An effortlessly eclectic setup is all you need to serve as the backdrop for the perfect tarot reading! And with this tent, you've got it.

Did you know that this trunk is actually filled to the brim with secrets? I'm pretty sure it even holds the secret of where The Ancestor came from, that big carved head out in the Ravenwood countryside. The catch is, you have to sacrifice a lot to access the secrets, otherwise it just looks like a normal empty trunk. What must you sacrifice exactly? That's obviously a secret, silly! Good luck!

Rather than suffering a thousand misfortunes at the hands of bland, uninspired interior décor, opt for something like these bottles to make a bit more of a deathly cool statement! This very old Plumbobtillado Nectar was discovered deep in a (now caved in) section of the Ravenwood crypts, believed to have once been the basement of a respected nobleman's mansion. Due to its age and dubious origins, it is absolutely not fit for Sims to consume anymore. But it's a lovely little statement piece for sleek, contemporary living rooms anywhere. Why not own a little bit of Ravenwood's twisted history?

Do NOT drink this. It may look like exquisite aged juice, or something of that sort. It is absolutely not that. It's weird brown goop. The goopiest goop imaginable. It's unbelievably stinky too. The sort of stink you can't place. Nondescript yet absolutely rancid. Like, this stuff should be against some kind of international law. It's that bad. Looks great though!

Like the dainty mushroom peeking through the cracked leaves on a forest's floor, where there is death there is also life. Local fable speaks of an ethereal and childlike mushroom spirit existing in the land between life and death, who not only is an avid listener but is also a giddy messenger! This messenger is known by locals as Whispering Wren. Zinnia flowers are also considered very special. It's thought that the stems of zinnias were hollowed out by Wren to record the echoes of a spoken message so it can then be delivered to the deceased. It's believed that whispering your message to the bushiest of zinnias will send Wren skipping away to find your lost love to softly relay your note in their otherworldly slumber. These decorative statues representing the beloved Whispering Wren Messenger Statue can be used to Leave a Message for your deceased loved ones.
This handsome anatomy relic would be the perfect addition to your bedside table. Who wouldn't want this to be the first thing they see when they open their eyes in the morning?
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Mortician branch in the Undertaker career.
Unlocked at level 10 of the Mortician branch in the Undertaker career.

Freezer Bunny's wish has been granted, and he's been set free! He's no longer in the clutches of that freezer, no longer a guitar, not hung up on the wall. And he's definitely not a giant stage prop.\n\nThough his wish for freedom has been granted, he is now stuck in his little Grim form! Who would've thought the monkey's paw would curl like that for this little fella? Not me!

Hey, I'm Johnny. You might be wondering how I got here, in this jar. You see, I'm a little ghost. And it's a biiiiig world. I just don't fit in anywhere else. Oh, don't get me wrong, I could leave whenever I want! But, why would I? I'm content to be here. On your coffee table, watching. Always watching...

In collaboration with the In Loving Memory: A Tribute Collection we proudly introduce Scents You've Been Gone, an incense holder. Honor the memory of your loved ones with our beautifully crafted holder. Designed to hold incense with elegance and stability, this piece is a perfect addition to any remembrance space, be it at home or at a gravesite.

An excerpt from an essay titled "The Folly of Grimperfection" by Edward Talon-Crow: Grim is often lauded as the sole arbiter of everything dark in this world. I take great issue with this idolatry. First, our mortality is perhaps the most macabre thing about us! We live and we die, driven by forces beyond our comprehension. Succumbing to the end of our mortal life, and becoming a feared ghost? That is the most macabre statement a Sim could make! Grim is neither alive nor dead. Grim simply exists. What's so macabre about being a static being? Secondly, wearing a black robe and proclaiming to be the ultimate shepherd of Sim souls is really just hubris at its finest. I have seen Grim's hirelings doing his duties in his stead. For those who don't care, I would urge you to imagine dying, and while observing your reaping, it's not Grim who carries it out, but some hired grunt. Grim is nothing but an industrious narcissist who has taken us all for a ride! Never forget, my fellow members of Simkind, we hold the most profound potential for embodying and celebrating darkness. Not some hooded figure with an unmatched ego!

The Grim Reaper bestows upon you a peculiar hourglass. Its frame is crafted from ethereal materials, entwined with the lost souls. The sands within are a kaleidoscope of stars, cascading in a graceful ballet, marking time with a mischievous glint. As each grain falls, echoes of laughter and forgotten dreams fill the air, a whimsical reminder of life's enchanting, fleeting waltz.
Unlock by reaching level 8 of the Reaper career.
Unlocked by reaching level 8 of the Reaper career.

This ornate archway is the perfect set piece for singing your haunting stanzas of the night. It really wouldn't be the same if you weren't surrounded by curtains that have been meticulously draped just so. Because how else are you supposed to revel in the tender caress of the abyss, if not in style?

Were your haunting stanzas of the night just too impressive to be framed by a normal sized arch? Perhaps you'd be interested in crooning amidst the curtains of a slightly taller version, then. This taller option is always available regardless, so don't be afraid to amp up that that ghostly reverie, all you icons of intrigue! Slay, even!

With utmost respect, as a token of our gratitude for your tireless hours spent supporting grieving families and ushering their loved ones honorably toward their next chapter, we present you with the esteemed Corpus Commendations Award Plaque.\n\nKnock 'em dead, pal.
Unlock by reaching level 10 of the Funeral Director branch in the Undertaker career.
Unlocked at level 10 of the Funeral Director branch in the Undertaker career.

These shelves are the perfect size for towels and other toiletries. Note that based on our testing, they should not be used to house corrosive materials such as, oh I don't know, potions that were brewed with the intention of melting the seat of your manager's office chair! You know, the type of activity that someone named Bobson Dugnutt who works at GentleNight as a product analyst would enjoy doing. (If you're reading this, Bobson, you're fired.)
The Modern Grimpressions Bathroom Shelves by GentleNight

What could this sensible little set of drawers hold? Eldritch horrors beyond comprehension? Or a pile of paperclips? How about you be the judge and the jury! Because if you buy them, you can fill them with whatever you like. And you know what? I think you absolutely should fill these drawers with unspeakable eldritch horrors and other fun little trinkets. Because here at Tell-Tale Arts, we support every Sim's rights and wrongs.
The Cabinet of Curiosities by Tell-Tale Arts

The perfect place for all the trinkets, trash, and fish you've fished up from the Baleful Bog. Well, let's maybe not put fish on the shelves. The neighbors might complain. Unless that's your goal, in which case, we here at Tell-Tale Arts support you!
The Haunted Hutch by Tell-Tale Arts

What good is a haunting bar without an equally haunting bar back to accompany it? Pairs wonderfully with our signature piece, The Tell-Tale Bar by Tell-Tale Arts, for obvious reasons. Put simply, you need places to store your most obscure nectars and their esoteric accompaniments because there's no way a Sim as grimly vogue as you could store such things out of plain sight! Ensure the world knows how remarkable your libations truly are!
The Tell-Tale Bar Back by Tell-Tale Arts

Lady Ravendancer Goth's grandmother always had an otherworldly talent with a sewing needle. It seemed as if every one of her creations was imbued heavily with magic. Most of the time she didn't even intend to sew magically heated quilts or sequined dresses that seemed to glow from within. It was just an unintended byproduct of her impressive power as a spellcaster. Lady Ravendancer often felt a similar latent power emanating from her hand-drawn tarot cards, as if her spellcasting power couldn't help but seep into the colors she wove, bringing each card alive. Unfortunately, that tendency wasn't the only thing that ran in her family. After some time, as her power grew along with her collection of tarot cards, she started to relate heavily with her grandmother's sharp awareness of her impending doom...as if someone, or something, out there felt she had grown just a bit too powerful.
The bane of every ghost-hater's existence.
Hey, This Shelf is a Ghost!

We ran a little test here at GentleNight, placing one of these shelves in the lobby of HQ and seeing what ended up on it by the end of the week. Well, the first week, things were a bit hectic, so it collected a nice little disconcerting layer of dust, and a cobweb in the corner. Then, the following Monday, a puddle of some sort of glowing goo appeared. The day after? A jar of pickled Striped Eggplant Frog legs was left on it, one year past their expiration date. The next day, a popular bestselling novel in pristine condition appeared, but each word was slightly misspelled in uncanny ways. What other sorts of oddities might it accrue? Only time will tell...
The Modern Grimpressions Shelf by GentleNight

This little shadowy corner shower is a juicy slice of doom and gloom. It will most certainly leave you drenched in a general sense of unease! Focus group testers at GentleNight reported that they just loved the way it made their hairs stand on end. Why settle for simply taking care of yourself when you could also scare yourself?
The Modern Grimpressions Shower by GentleNight

You came to Ravenwood for a reason! Let this sign guide you in your travels. And yes, it's hand-drawn. Just because we have a flair for the macabre doesn't mean we don't keep it cute! Stay safe out there...

You ever worry if an establishment is haunted? Or is it that ghosts love your house, and you want guests to know a specific room is ghost free? Well now you can rest easy! Carefully handcrafted and offered in a variety of different woods, this ghost sign will clearly illustrate if the area is certified "ghost free!"

This sink dispenses water. Not slugs or other abominable creatures. Not even little bugs that move like a liquid when they're gathered all together in globs! And sadly, no ghostly slime either. Just water! For strictly legal reasons, of course. Heavens forbid we have a little fun here at GentleNight. Schmapple shot down all of our fun ideas when they proposed the partnershi- I mean, ahem, we settled our creative differences with compromises that pleased both parties!
The Modern Grimpressions Bathroom Sink by GentleNight

Dearest Customers, You might've seen some of the other products in the Modern Grimpressions collection, made by our friends over at GentleNight. It's a very...quaint company. Lots of potential! Just like Schmapple once was, a very very long time ago. We've grown a thousandfold since then, for the record. But what matters is, while they handled the other rooms, we maintained creative control over the kitchen. And, of course, this is our first time delving into the "sink" space. We just wanted to bring our revolutionary product vision to the Sink User Experience, and I'd say we achieved just that. Every day for a year, I asked myself: "Vince, what if turning on a sink was as easy as lifting the handle, and getting the water to come out?" You might think me a madman for expecting it to be that easy. But I achieved that legendary vision with ease. For you, my friends. Sinks, to the power of you. Stay hydrated, Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Kitchen Sink by Schmapple

For the love of cowplants, do not use this barstool for interrogations. Especially if the person being interrogated isn't a person but is actually a haunted cake. It's really hard to get buttercream frosting out of the material. And don't even get me started on the candles. Just trust me on this one.
The Modern Grimpressions Barstool by GentleNight

Set the mood and prepare to brood! Your home office has never been more gloomy. Rest assured, no amount of aesthetically pleasing, pastel keyboards or perfectly crafted matcha lattes can bring you back into the good vibes normie-sphere, this chair's aura is just that strong.
The Modern Grimpressions Office Chair by GentleNight

Whine and dine in macabre style with this lovely little addition to GentleNight's Modern Grimpressions collection. So when you and your dinner guests discuss which type of death would be the most iconic (which, let's be real here, is majorly informed by the style of ghost you're granted by Grim) you can do it in creepy comfort!
The Modern Grimpressions Dining Chair by GentleNight

The dying candle flickered on Edward Talon-Crow's desk. He scrawled furiously with his feather quill by the candle's dull amber glow, seated on his favorite chair. Though he often referred to his favorite chair as "The Seat of Inspiration" today it seemed more like a castle spire, a viewpoint of defensive advantage and offensive pressure. To call his fellow writers "peers" would be a stretch. They were talentless hacks, catering their inane drivel to the whims of the masses. That day, his most bitter rival, Fulov Pepp, had the gall to publish a criticism of Edward's macabre themes. Rich, coming from a man whose most recent short story was about a cute puppy learning to walk. No grit, no grime, no realism. Just another gauche attempt at pulling the heartstrings of his gullible readers. The rebuttals wrote themselves, it seemed. His quill raced across the parchment, his counterattack mounting with each impassioned word. Pernilla's last words before leaving him rang achingly in his mind as he wrote. "One day, Eddie, you'll amount to something. It's a shame I won't be around to see it." One day. One day he'd prove himself, as a writer, as a Sim!

What could have been a normal chair has been modified beyond its typical mortal limits to become a fearsome chair, reminiscent of a fabled maelstrom. Like a whirlpool in the dark sea, it'll draw you in and keep you sitting. You'll never be able to settle for another chair!

Have you ever wanted to find yourself in a situation that could only be described as briny, squishy, eldritch horror? Well, today's your lucky day. The moist squelch that echoes through the room as you take a seat on this scalloped scallop-esque seat will have you feeling utterly horrified. You'll smell like a haunted wharf an abandoned town where the citizens (for some reason) left a bunch of rotting fish in baskets for unfortunate adventurers to happen upon instead of actually useful loot.

Not much to say here, except watch out for the pointy bits. We have ten confirmed cases of big ouchies caused by the pointy bits. It's not very demure to get an ouchie from the pointy bits while you sitsy sits. And before you ask, yes, I hated writing that just as much as you hated reading it.
The Modern Grimpressions Living Chair by GentleNight

An elegant butterfly is hunted by a dreaded wolf in the dark of night, its wings glinting in the pale moonlight as it flutters to safety, resting on a high branch of a tall tree. That's what it feels like to sit in this chair.

The llamagriff is a mythological creature dating all the way back to Myshupotamian times. A cross between a llama and an eagle, the regal llamagriff was often a symbol of pride or an otherworldly blessing, ever-present on the insignia of Myshupotamian royals. For centuries, most Myshupotamians believed llamagriffs could be found atop Mt. Komorebi.\nOver time, Myshupotamia sought to grow its relationship with the people of Mt. Komorebi, in the hopes of establishing long-distance trade routes. It was then that the myth was quickly debunked. Legend has it that when the current king of Myshupotamia visited Mt. Komorebi to meet with local politicians, he took a long soak in the local hot springs with them, regaling them with stories held dear by his people. He expressed interest in scaling the mountain and seeing the fabled llamagriffs in the flesh. Most of the politicians, eager to appease the king, simply smiled and nodded. But one particularly mirthful listener burst into uncontrollable laughter, eventually dying from the hysteria.\nNeedless to say, the location of llamagriffs in Myshupotamian legend were a bit less specific from then on.

This is for Sims to sit on only. Not demons. Not mythical creatures. And definitely NOT amorphous slime monsters who insist their name is Gerald, but since that was your uncle's name, it brings kind of a weird vibe every time it flops around the office. Like, it's really insistent that its name is Gerald. And it only seems to hang around me. It might be my Uncle Gerald. I really don't know, at this point...
The Modern Grimpressions Loveseat by GentleNight

As of the writing of this description, GentleNight employees have stubbed their toes on the prototype of this ottoman-bench-thing a total of 77,387 times. Thankfully I was spared, but that's a lot of angry employees with a lot of angry toes! The consumer model should be fine now. We actually discovered a tiny demon living inside of the prototype right before launch. He was causing everyone's toes to be magnetically attracted to the metal legs of the bench as they walked by. Not me, though. Ha, imagine getting your toe forcibly stubbed by a little demon that gets sat on all day! I work with a bunch of losers. The best part? The lil demon guy looks really ridiculous too, you wouldn't even believe me if I described it.
The Modern Grimpressions Ottoman? by GentleNight

Long ago, at noon on a bright day, Fulov Pepp was born. His family lived in a flowery cottage in Whispering Glen. His upbringing was humble but full of joy. His mother often read to him at night while sitting with him on a wooden rocking chair. Ironically, all that love produced the most bitter, hate-filled Sim Ravenwood had ever seen. Fulov grew up to be a writer. It wasn't for the love of the craft or the enjoyment of the saccharine themes he employed. It was entirely because he loved manipulating the average Sim, who he saw as simple and easy to please. His first published work was about a llama starting a charity for wilting cowplants, and the books only grew more nauseatingly optimistic as he achieved success. But perhaps the most important aspect of his legacy was his hatred for fellow writer Edward Talon-Crow. He would never have admitted it, but he loved Edward's works and was eternally jealous of his depth and writing ability. So, he dedicated the rest of his time to publishing extensive manifestos degrading Edward's character. This feud endured until the two writers' deaths, and perhaps even to this day!

A vintage-inspired tufted sofa, reminiscent of an elegance of the distant past. This grand piece features luxurious deep button tufting bookended by rolled arms. So comfortable, yet firm, that anyone who sits in it will slowly be swallowed into the abyss- I mean, into bliss. Yes, it's time to elevate any living (or dying) space with timeless charm and opulence!
Well, well, well, what do we have here?
Playful Specters of Ravenwood. Beloved by all in Crow's Crossing.

Dearest Customers, Please note that this stove hood should accompany The Modern Grimpressions Oven by Schmapple. Stylistically, thematically, and philosophically, the combination of these two new Schmapple products really speaks to Mr. Schmapple's visionary vision. [Insert personal anecdote about how much you love working for Vincent Schmappple here]. Sincerely, [Type Intern Name Here], from the office of Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Stove Hood by Schmapple

Dearest Customers, For years, I've peddled a dream through Schmapple appliances that I often find difficult to embody. The Schmapple mantra of "Ovens to the Power of You" and relentless improvement until we developed truly indestructible appliances? It all rings hollow for me. Life is just too beautifully imperfect to fall prey to hubris. Upon reflection, I rallied my team of trusted advisors to help me explore a deconstruction of those design ideals. What if the beauty of life and its many implements lies in the fallibility of those implements? We sought a sleek, stylish, yet brooding style that guided us away from the brutal, technical perfection we've previously embodied. Sure, it breaks, unlike The Schmapple Oven. But doesn't everything, in some way, at some point? Let that thought stew for a bit. I humbly hope you find yourself as lost in wistful thought as I do while using this oven! 'Til death (and beyond), Vincent Schmapple
The Modern Grimpressions Oven by Schmapple

It's Nibbles' first day on the job as a reaper, and she's ready to to do her best. No veggie in Ravenwood is safe from her clutches! Nibbles the Grimtern will personally see to all leafy green, carrot, and (as a treat) apple reaping in town. But since it's her first day, she requires hugs and kind words to keep her motivation high!

It's not easy to find a fun distraction that even a Sim who appreciates the darker side of life could enjoy. These elegant swings could feel at home in even the most macabre of backyards. Though, fair warning, these swings seem to have a mind of their own...

These swings really aren't as old as you think they are... they're even older! But, believe it or not, that extreme age is a safety feature! Because there's nothing like a splinter in the backside to keep you alert while flying through the air at increasing velocities.

This coffee table sports a little patch of velvet on top, which is pretty neat. In theory. It's all fun and games until the miniature walking Cowplant you inadvertently brought home from the office has an accident on your brand new coffee table. The smell is indescribable.
The Modern Grimpressions Coffee Table by GentleNight

Sorry it came to this, "Exploring the Sights of Ravenwood!" You're being relegated to the underside of the Hexagon of Shame, where you'll collect dust, and only be brought out once a year when cool company comes over and I need to seem like a "cool guy who has hobbies and interests" or whatever. You're still pretty cool, at least for a coffee table book that I received for Winterfest one year and never actually read.
The Hexagon of Shame by Tell-Tale Arts

What was once a simple round dining table has been modified to transcend its mortal limits. It now sports a corkscrew leg, twisting round and round like a fabled maelstrom. It's a ruthless little table that'll stop at nothing to make a statement. It's a cold-hearted little table! It might even be evil, prowling the streets and striking fear in the hearts of weaker, less stylish, unmodified tables! It- ahem, sorry about that. It's a table with a corkscrew leg. Nothing more, nothing less.

Dine deliciously and in style. Though make sure to leave an additional place setting for Blarg. He's the incorporeal entity that demands a place be set for him every time someone eats at this specific model of table. And, well, we never figured out why he haunts every single one of them. Just, remember, okay? One additional place setting. You really don't want to make Blarg mad...
The Modern Grimpressions Dining Table by GentleNight

Let us be absolutely clear here. Contrary to what many of our employees thought during its R&D phase, this table is NOT meant to be used as a funeral bier. Sim remains are NOT meant to be placed on this table. Please also refrain from piling large amounts of pet waste on this table in an attempt to "please the Stink Spirits" or whatever you read on the forums that week. That debacle was a bit too interesting for a Tuesday, if you ask me...
The Modern Grimpressions Side Table by GentleNight

A nice, sturdy table that has been proven to handle even the most robust sleep paralysis demons when they need somewhere to perch near your bed! So when you lay awake in the dead of night, filled with dread, at least you won't have to worry about your nightstand buckling under the pressure. Life's little victories!
The Modern Grimpressions Nightstand by GentleNight

Whether it's cloudgazing or moonbathing, this towel is great to rest on while you take in the sights of the sky! Or, better yet, put it out in your yard to make everyone think you do those things but never actually use it. Because who has time for tangible life experiences when you could just curate the perfect public image? You've got algorithms to feed, anyway.

The Modern Grimpressions collection isn't just limited to the kitchen or dining room! When GentleNight had the opportunity to team up with Schmapple to bring you a bit of a moodier home collection, we thought, "Hey, why not feel those big feelings while watching TV, too?" Bring a little bit of that unsettling darkness to your living room with this lovely TV stand. Guaranteed to make you happy you bought it, and sad you ever had another TV stand.
The Modern Grimpressions TV Stand by GentleNight

What do you yearn for? The restoration of a world that once was, that feels just out of reach? Or perhaps you yearn to secure the legacy of your people, remembered as they were and as they are now. Or perhaps it's for something otherworldly and inexplicable, like ham that tastes vaguely of despair. Rest assured, this urn knows your deepest desires, and will do absolutely nothing about it!

This window may be a little aged, but it will last you a lifetime. Even after you've entered the marvelous world of the afterlife. Living or dead, you won't regret having this beautiful window in your home!
Did you say you wanted a taller version of the Everlasting Window? No? Well too bad, here it is. Because every wall height deserves stylish windows, forever.
Find light in this beautiful sea of life with the Curved Diamond Window, guaranteed to shine bright in your home!
May not be as fancy as its more ornate contemporaries, but this will look beautiful in your Sim's home nonetheless!
The perfect window for crowded walls with not much room to work with. Bask in the glory of the iconic queen that she is!
Something sinister is among us... It might be this window, or it might be something else. Only Grim knows the answer, but he's acting pretty suspicious right now...
Beautifully carved and perfect views for you and your pet crow! Careful not to leave the window open, we are not responsible for loose birdies.
If you want more style that'll send a chill down your spine in your home, this window has exactly what you need.
Sims who have this type of window in their home are said to have the most beautiful souls in the world. So if you believe your soul is beautiful, purchase this window today!
The taller, older, cooler version of the original Reflection of the Soul window. Which makes your soul doubly as beautiful as the owners of the original, right?
Squares are not welcome in this home. Unless you're of the sponge variety.
Want to bring a little more life into your home? This window will do it! I should clarify, it only works for your home...sorry, ghosts.
A grim-tastic addition to your lovely undead abode.
Look through this window, you may just see outside. You may even spot the souls of the dead moving on toward ghostho-... You know what, actually? You'll just see the outside! Everything's fine here!
Cook or Serve Food for Guests to enjoy.
Food brings Sims together and makes mourning easier.
Successfully run any interaction under the Funeral pie menu.
Select an Urn, Podium, or your Sim and choose any interactions under the Funeral pie menu.
Select a Stereo that's playing music and choose Dance
Dancing can uplift and inspire, celebrating life!
Complete by selecting a Podium or the Funeral menu on Urn or Gravestone, and choose Eulogize Lightheartedly.
An event to give lighthearted speeches and recount humorous tales.
Somber speeches reflecting the tone of a lost loved one.
Complete by selecting a Podium or the Funeral menu on Urn or Gravestone, and choose Eulogize Mournfully.
Complete by selecting a Podium or the Funeral menu on Urn or Gravestone, and choose Eulogize Mournfully or Eulogize Lightheartedly.
Guests Can Recount Tales of the Departed, Whether Happy or Sad.
Complete by selecting the Funeral menu on Urn or Gravestone, and choose Toast Deceased Sim.
Gather everyone around for a toast to the departed.
Have a Sim Listen to Music.
Music sets the tone that Sims will feel during a funeral.
Complete by selecting the Funeral menu on a Sim, Urn or Gravestone, and choose Light Candle.
A bright candle lighting reflects the light that a Sim brings into another's life.
Complete by selecting the Funeral menu on a Sim, Urn or Gravestone, and choose Moment of Silence.
A respectful moment of silence for Sims to remember the departed.
New life grows in the memory of the departed Sim.
Select a garden plot or planter and plant a seed
Musical performances have a special reverence during funerals.
Complete by selecting an Instrument and have a Sim Play a song.
Ghosts can haunt and cause mischief during funerals.
Have a Ghost use Scare and Chaos Ghost Mastery Abilities.
Have a Ghost use Comfort and Helpful Ghost Mastery Abilities.
Ghosts can use ethereal forces to console those around them.
Complete by selecting the Funeral menu on the Urn or Gravestone and having a Sim Mourn, Weep, or Pretend to Wail.
An opportunity to view the final resting place of the departed.
Recently deceased? Living but Macabre? This spacious lot is the perfect starter spot for any Sim who is seeking an eerie setting and a charming afterlife aesthetic.

Club Eternity takes the saying "dance like no one is watching" both figuratively and...literally. If anyone knows how to party, it's the deceased. With a breathtaking, dark gothic aesthetic, this club's more Macabre patrons thrive and even Skeptics are convinced that Ghosts still know how to live.

This green-thumb-friendly manor is conveniently located in central Mourningvale. One of the standout features of this home is the attached greenhouse, which has been converted into a breakfast nook that looks out over the central plaza. This space is perfect home for any Sims interested in gardening...and the afterlife living.

Esther Gomes was already looking for a ghostly roommate when poor Zuleika met her end in a rather unfortunate Cowplant "accident" and also found herself looking for a new home in the same neighborhood. Now the two are sharing a home, and Esther is teaching Zuleika the ins-and-outs of ghostly living and career development working for Grim.

Casket House lies nestled along the bog's edge. The air is thick but peaceful, interrupted only by the haunting whispers of Sims entering the afterlife. Many believe the house got its name due to the empty Casket inside, but in truth, it was first haunted by Catie Casket, a Ghost who finished her Unfinished Business and was Reborn in Willow Creek—or so they say. With its eerie charm, this lot promises potential for any brave mortal ready to make some Ghostly friends or any Ghost ready to start fresh in the life beyond.

This empty plot of land, nestled amongst pastoral, rolling hills, is the perfect locale for Sims aspiring to live a simplistic, rural life. A family living here will find themselves just down the old dirt lane from their neighbors and always under the ever-watchful gaze of the Ancestor across the river.

The Final Draught is a cozy establishment, welcoming all beings. The Draught's regulars come for the dimmed lighting, comfortable seating, and gentle tunes. However, the upstairs is often host to private events—most commonly, events for those saying goodbye to their loved ones. This is Ravenwood, after all!

This rustic chateau has existed in its rolling countryside setting for over a century now. When the Aethers moved in it was renovated, and it's clear someone really liked the color pink. In a region that so often celebrates the Macabre, the wildflower gardens outside provide a cheery place to celebrate life in its many forms.

After a miscommunication with a pet Crow, Kai Aether found himself in a less corporeal form than expected. It's a story familiar to many families, but there's an unfortunate wrinkle to this story that has made things extremely stressful for not just Kai's husband, Ekade, but also for their son, Takama—you see, not only does Kai not seem to understand that he's dead, he also doesn't believe in Ghosts. Period. Awkward, right? But with the help of a local support group and with the love of his family, maybe Kai will start to see the light.

This large family cottage is perfectly situated on the river's shores, under the watchful gaze of the Ancestor. It's only a hop, skip, and a jump away from the nightly Moon Revelry festival as well! If that doesn't sell it, the wrap-around porch is the perfect reminder that sometimes it's good to slow down and enjoy the small things in life.

Having tried being a ghost on for size, Radwan and Tziporah Gomes have decided that being a Ghost isn't for them—at least, not quite yet. Meanwhile, Radwan has his hands full keeping his clumsy wife from meeting Grim a little too soon. In the midst of all this chaos, their teenage child Zelmira has plunged headfirst into their own study of the afterlife after finding a tarot card on a walk one day. Now, Zelmira's embracing their inner Macabre side and finding unique connections in the family's past to a very special member of the Goth family. Things definitely seem to be getting a bit spooky for this household!

It's Grim's office. He works here. While his personal crow should always be the employee of the month, Grim has decided he is the best at his job. He does own the place...and has been Reaping for centuries. Now Grim has opened up his practice to new Grimterns, eager to climb their way up the noncorporeal ladder.

Everyone in Ravenwood knows about old Ravenwood Estate. It's one of the oldest buildings in the village, though it's been vacant for years. Locals whisper about its regal but oddly overbearing presence, the once fastidiously-tended garden turned wild, and the lovely abandoned greenhouse on the estate's grounds. Rumor has it this was once the summer home of a powerful Spellcaster and Tarot reader long ago. If a Sim comes along who can get past the flickering lights, foreboding sounds, and other inexplicable happenings inside, they'll have quite the fixer-upper...

Eternal Hollow is Ravenwood's primary Cemetery. The main building is an intimate locale to say goodbye to the recently passed, and with plenty of graves and crypts still open, it'll continue to be a popular location for burials for years to come. Locals to Ravenwood know Eternal Hollow's pond is also one of the better places to find a Death Frog or the rare Bonefish. Whether a Sim is spending their forever here or just visiting, they will certainly feel at home in Eternal Hollow.

For decades, this home has housed the Specter family, but now its history is closely tied to Olive Specter, a widow many times over. This house, sits almost like a crow on its perch watching the Specter cemetery below and waiting for yet another skeleton to join the closet. (Or in this house's case, maybe the basement...)

The Specter family has an air of mystery to them; rumor has it that Olive's prior husbands all met unfortunate ends, which makes things rather awkward now that she's engaged to Layne Coffin, the founding and sole member of the band Withering Widdershins. Does Layne know his soon-to-be Specter spouse has skeletons in her closet? He's definitely not going to be asking too many questions about her son Nyon's mysterious parentage. Let's just say that maybe Grim's not keeping tabs on their household solely because of Olive's past loves.

Nestled at the highest vantage in the village, this historic building is the perfect home for any family hoping to get the full Ravenwood experience. Head down to the village square to enjoy any of the three local festivals, explore the abandoned houses, or stop by the haunted playground and introduce the kids to Freddy, everyone's favorite specter.

Another Ravenwood historical building that boasts a fascinating past. This home was originally built for Moppy. Yes, the goat. It's now vacant and the perfect home for any Sim moving to the region. There's lots to do and plenty of goat-laden architecture to ponder. Just don't be too unsettled if the Moppy statue's eyes glow at night...or if lights start flickering in the abandoned houses next door. It's all part of the aesthetic.

Feeling overwhelmed or in need of support? The Afterlife Anonymous is your go-to sanctuary! Gather with fellow ghosts and sympathetic Sims for a support session. Share your experiences at the podium, enjoy comforting potluck dishes, and find solace in heartfelt conversations. Whether you're a ghost or a grieving Sim, it's the perfect place to find support and camaraderie! Festival Happens: • Every Monday, Wednesday, & Friday at 6:00 PM - 11:00 PM • Every Tuesday & Thursday at 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

They say Alice's ghost haunts the Guardian Tree. She's always looking for her lost offspring... This is also the location of the Thinned Festiveil every Wednesday from 10AM to 6PM. Learn more in the Calendar.

The Try Before You Die Casket Sale is a local event where Sims can explore a selection of luxurious caskets, guided by a professional Funeral Director. Want a discount on a coffin? Curious about what it takes to become a Mortician? Stop on by for the chance to plan ahead with style and grace!\n\nFestival Happens: Every Monday, Wednesday, & Friday at 11:00 AM

At the base of the hill is the old Specter cemetery, a family plot with a rumored, nefarious past. It's here that the ghost of the Mysterious Merchant is said to engage in Mysterious Dealings with those passing by.

The Ancestor, a mythical face carved into the side of a cliff. Sims gather here every night in reverence of the Moon, the Stars and the Ancestor itself, but things get extra special on Full Moons, when the Ancestor sheds his tears. The Moon Revelry festival takes place at the base of the Ancestor each night. During the full moon...clothing is optional.

The Ravenwood Family Day festival is the largest event in Crow's Crossing. Stop by to participate in the Frog Finder Contest, meet up with some playful, gift-giving Specters, learn about Ravenwood's mysterious Crows (and even interact with one), or consult with an Inheritance Lawyer to help secure your family's future with a Will!\n\nFestival Happens: Saturday 12:00 PM - 8:00 PM

The Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life is a small, local celebration that is both heartwarming and delicious! Stop by for some burgers and hotdogs, remember past loved ones, and lift the spirits. It's a wonderful way to honor the past while savoring the present!\n\nFestival Happens: Every Tuesday, Thursday, & Sunday at 11:00 AM

An unseen battle is constantly fought between the living and the undead within the Oldies Twin Houses! Ghosts go there to Infest and gain ghostly experience. The living go there to Cleanse and find some loot! Everyone agrees though that the houses are fun to Explore.

Whispering Glen's Moon Revelry festival happens every night as the moon rises. Bask in a lunar glow and feel the mystical energy of the night, savor the rush of a swim beneath the stars, or gather around the cozy bonfire with friends and enjoy stories and the flames' warmth.\n\nFestival Happens: Every Night (During Full Moon, Clothing is Optional)

The Baleful Bog—one of the great enigmas of Mourningvale. Those who enter the Bog's magical waters can Have an Out of Body Experience and undergo a temporary Ghostly transformation. They say not to overdo it though... This is also where Sims can come to experience Rebirth (once far enough along on their Soul's Journey).
One of Ravenwood's three Tarot Tome Shrines, created long ago by the Order of Lenore. They say it holds information on how to begin the quest to reunite Lady Ravendancer Goth's scattered Tarot Deck.

During the Thinned Festiveil, locals and Ghosts alike gather around the Guardian Tree once a week to bestow gifts upon it and receive the tree's enchantments. There's dancing, Tarot reading, and even Grimterns willing to play a game of chance...sometimes Grim even shows up himself.\n\nFestival Happens: Wednesday 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Everyone in Ravenwood knows that the angry child ghost, Edith, haunts the Well of Longing and Regret. Those brave enough can make a wish and cast a coin into the well, but beware! It may backfire! Some say that gaining the Mark of Edith from the ghost child will not only guarantee a wish comes true but make that wish even more powerful.
This Ghost does not have this ability unlocked yet!

This death was caused by a Killer Rabbit! They always seem like harmless little bunnies, don't they?
This death was caused by laughter... That's not very funny, is it?
This death was caused by exhaustion. An eternal nap will do them well.

This death was caused by hunger. Makes you want a grilled cheese real bad.

You must understand that our role is not just about the end, but about the journey and the respect we must show to every soul we encounter. Reflect on this and strive to improve, for our work demands the utmost diligence and empathy.

Born and died. Survived by... preceded in death by... Services on Saturday. A kind soul, a difficult loss. Rest in peace.
What beautiful sentiments! With melodic prose such as this, a funeral director position could be in {0.SimFirstName}'s future!

Moving onto the Great Beyond will permanently remove {0.SimFirstName} from the household and leave all {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} worldly possessions behind—including family members! This is a one way ticket, be prepared!
Embrace the final chapter and let {0.SimFirstName} depart this world permanently. This is a one-way ticket, and cannot be undone.

You cannot do this while a Sim is moving on.

{0.SimFirstName} is leaving this plane of existence. This will permanently remove {0.SimFirstName} from the household and leave all {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} worldly possessions behind—including family members! This is a one way ticket, no turning back!

Reborn Sims Only! (Seriously, it's the only way to populate Traits)
Locked doors? No one home? {0.SimFirstName} can now walk right in without seeking permission. Is it morally okay? Meh, who cares.... Afterall, {0.SimFirstName} is a Ghost!

A giant, gnarled tree stands before {0.SimFirstName}. Bits of moss hang from its tangled branches, and is that a face? Faint whispers carry on the wind, but surely this is all just {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} imagination...

Whenever the ancient bell tolls, local Sims abandon their tasks and convene in the square for leisurely conversation. The bell, a relic from the town's founding days, has always been a symbol of unity. Occasionally, lively debates flare between the Macabre and the Skeptical, though they never escalate beyond spirited discussion. The true purpose of these gatherings is the joy of connecting with fellow Sims. Legend persists that with each resonant chime, ethereal lights flicker around the tower. Macabre Sims whisper that these lights are Specters, while Skeptical Sims dismiss them as mere tricks of the eyes...

The colossal monument towering over Whispering Glen is shrouded in mystery. Scholars believe it’s an effigy of a long-dead ruler carved into the cliff, but its origins remain unclear. Paranormal enthusiasts claim the full-moon "tears" are linked to the netherworld, while scientists argue they are merely floodwater runoff from the Baleful Bog. These tears have etched deep grooves into the stone, hinting at ancient rituals. Today, the Ancestor attracts nature lovers to its scenic waterfall and continues to inspire those who practice ancient rites during the full moon.

Long ago during a New Moon, a meteorite struck Whispering Glen, filling the sky with a breathtaking display of light and sound. Though no Sims were harmed, the event was witnessed from far. Centuries later, a gemologist discovered a glowing rock within the crater. Fascinated, he built an imposing castle around it, sealing his discovery within. Legend has it that the gemologist’s find was no ordinary rock. Some say it was cursed or used to create remarkable artifacts, like the Ancestor or Moppy’s glowing eyes. To this day, the castle stands shrouded in mystery, its secrets kept hidden from the curious eyes of locals.

Kudos to {0.SimFirstName} for successfully cleansing the Golden Oldies house of its ghostly infestation! The vacant house, once ruled by the mischievous Oldie Twins, Birdie and Biddie, is now temporarily free from their eerie antics. Those infamous pranks and spine-tingling scares, which once terrified the respectable folks of Ravenwood, are set to rest—for now. In the process, {0.SimFirstName} also discovered some residual Fear Essence left behind by the Oldies. Word around Mourningvale is that Waylon Warez will purchase these essences for Simoleons by the Crypt in Crow's Crossing!

Unfortunately, {0.SimFirstName} was unable to fully cleanse the Golden Oldies house of its ghostly infestation. The vacant houses, once resided the mischievous Oldie Twins, Birdie and Biddie, remain plagued by their eerie antics. The infamous pranks and spine-tingling scares that once terrorized the residents of Ravenwood continue unabated. Looks like this infestation is far from over, and more work may be needed to bring true peace to this town!
Must be a Living Sim to cleanse infestation!
{1.ObjectName} must be Infested by a ghost Sim first.

Not every village can claim a goat as its founding hero, but the tale of Moppy is just that. Long ago, a group of medieval nomads, led astray by the bewitching tarot reader Lady Ravendancer Goth, were on the brink of starvation when they encountered a clever goat. Choosing to follow the goat rather than feast on her, they were guided to a land rich in resources. Grateful, the nomads settled there, naming the area Ravenwood after Lady Ravendancer’s Wood and honoring their savior with a fountain in Moppy’s name. Despite modern skeptics, the legend endures, and few dare to dismiss the ancient goat’s impact on the village.

Alice? Hmm... Alice...Alice! She was...my...mother! I remember her face as much as I remember my Sim nature, which is to say, not much at all. There is one thing I do remember though—her unconditional love.

I'm about to info-dump on you, so I hope you're ready! Specter-kind, the blue type, exist for one purpose and one purpose only—to lift spirits! Not in a literal, necromantic way, but in the emotional way! We might not be the best talkers out there, but we are the best listeners. If you're ever feeling down, come talk to a Specter, I say. I know I can't remember much about being a Sim, but I do remember one thing clearly: My Clown Degree and my mission in life...well, and now in the afterlife I suppose!
Edith...that little girl by the Well of Longing and Regret. I feel like I know her, and that I have always known her. More than that, like we were best friends at some point in our souls journey.

To be or not to be...a blob? That is the question... But also, did the Specter family name themselves after my kind or the other way around? I guess that is the real question, though it's probably just coincidence.
{0.SimFirstName} is in too good of a mood to find this helpful.
This specter will console grieving Sims, but {0.SimFirstName} isn't experiencing Grief.

{0.SimFirstName} tosses a coin in the well and suddenly feels incredibly courageous. Edith seems much easier to talk to. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can now also use Unnerving Stare on other Sims; an Edith special!

That wish didn't quite go as {0.SimFirstName} planned. Not only did {0.SimPronounSubjective} not muster up the courage, but {0.SimPronounSubjective} can hear Edith taunting {0.SimPronounObjective} from afar, hurting their relationship.
{0.SimFirstName} already has the Courage to Face Edith!
