The Bucket List and Unfinished Business are lists of goals that you'd like to complete before dying or moving on. Once you write the goal on the Computer or in your Journal, completing goals from the list will contribute points towards your Soul's Journey. Each milestone of the journey will reward you, eventually granting you the ability to be reborn as a new Sim, if you'd like!

Calling all Undertakers! Do you have an inexplicable knack for soothing grieving Sims? Do you have an innate fascination with all things non-living? Then the Undertaker Career is certainly for you. Undertaker is a 10-level career where you can choose to take the path of either the business end of death in the Funeral Director branch, or take the less glitzy yet equally admirable path of the Mortician branch. Both paths are equally rewarding with not only material rewards but also with a somber sense of satisfaction tossed with a looming sense of existential dread. Who's with me?!

How many ways can I wax rhapsodic about the noble crow! No other creature will craft nefarious plots with you, cuddle with you, or attempt magnificent mimicry with you in quite the same way. Plus, I hear the Crow Collective bestows gifts upon those it deems worthy. Have you heard that Waylon even offers a Deluxe Ascendant Crow?\n\nPurchase the Grim Standard Ascendant Crow in Build Mode or seek out Waylon in the Crow's Crossing Neighborhood for the Deluxe version!

The Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life is all about just that—celebrating the lives of the living and the dead. Enjoy food, music, and good company while reminiscing about dearly departed loved ones.
Ask about the Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life

If you're interested in becoming a Reaper, you should know that straddling the worlds of the living and the dead is a huge responsibility. Although it is serious business, it can also be very rewarding, and sometimes fun, work! Donning the robe and wielding a scythe is pretty neat, and collecting souls isn't all that hard, once you get the hang of things. Oh, and the coffee's not half bad either!\n\nTo enter the Reaper Career select the Career Panel and Join a Career. You can also enter the career by using the Sim Phone, selecting the Business Icon and choosing Find a Job.
Give this a whirl for a chance at various prizes, including a potential visit from the Grim Reaper himself!
Here's some free merch, enjoy! You can find it in your Inventory.

Whoa! I summoned the Grim Reaper himself?! What an honor to be in his presence right now. Quick, see if you can take a selfie for me. I only started this Reaper job for a chance to meet him. I'm such a fan!

Well, that didn't go as expected. Oh well, these things happen sometimes. Don't worry, it's only temporary... I'm pretty sure. Do you mind not mentioning this to the Big Guy with the scythe? Thanks, you're a lifesaver!
After a death, grief can begin to take hold. It's kind of you to offer soothing words during this difficult time.

Everyone needs a work rival and mine is Waylon Warez. That peddling pipsqueak has unregistered souls for sale! That is against regulations! You'd think my disdain would have been squashed when I came to collect his soul, but alas the ghoul lives on to haunt and taunt me.
I run a respectable triangular shaped business. The benefits can really trickle up or down, depending on how solid your Netherline is. Some call it Multi-Level Reaping, I call it sim-ergy.
Look, does the N.W.D.D. know I'm recruiting help? No. Do they need to know? Also no. And you're not gonna tell them.

You could say I'm in the business of misery, but it's not all bad. A good game can cheer up any soul, a great game can bring them back to life! Do I let them win sometimes? Sure. I'm the Grim Reaper, I'm not a monster.
You may have noticed your assignments never involve animals. Truth be told, I like to handle those myself. Despite the unfortunate situation, I quite like visiting the rainbow bridge.
You have to familiarize yourself with business lingo—OKRs, KPIs, MLRs, RIPs. Once you have that down, you can learn your quarterly's, your circling back, and my most favorite, per my last email.
The business of death is actually quite simple: You just have to wait! Life's hourglass runs out for everyone eventually... Except me, of course.

I have a pretty sizable Soul Quota to reach before I can get my boney hands on a second scythe. Hence my Grimlings! The key to being a successful entrepreneur is working smarter, not harder. Together we can achieve greatness!
(From Telling Ghost Stories in the Crypt)
(From Listening to Ghost Stories in the Crypt)

Mother...she is not the reason I died...no....but I drowned here and am now bound to this accursed well forever!

One Simoleon for a Wish...a dream or a nightmare. But gain my trust...Ask for My Mark and the best dream you shall have.

Edith let out a little giggle and appreciates {0.SimFirstName}'s attempt to Mock her. She appears to be ready to socialize! This could be a good time to attempt friendship and Ask for the Mark of Edith.

(From Discussing the Journeys of the Soul)
There’s a mysterious similarity and connection that {0.SimFirstName} can’t quite explain, but it’s real. Share this revelation with {1.SimFirstName}!

Ancient mysteries? Oh, those are my bedtime stories! From the pyramids to Atlantis, I've seen it all unravel. Spoiler: The sphinx's riddle is just a bad joke, and Atlantis? Let’s just say their underwater Wi-Fi is terrible.

Ah, Cowplants. Nature's little carnivorous comedians. You might wonder why I never bother with their souls. Simple, really—that's for the Cowplant Reaper! Besides, their manipulative way is just too amusing to disrupt. Cowplants are nature's way of saying, 'Even plants have a dark side,' and trust me, I respect the hustle.

Ah, the afterlife! It's like a never-ending vacation, but without the sunscreen and beach towels. Some find themselves lounging in Elysian Fields, while others are stuck in bureaucratic purgatory filling out forms for eternity. Trust me, the paperwork is killer!

The meaning of life? Oh, that's my favorite prank! Everyone spends their whole life looking for it, and when they finally meet me, they realize the punchline: It's just one big scavenger hunt with a surprise twist. And guess who’s the final clue?

Time is a tricky fellow, always slipping through your fingers like sand. But for me, it's more like a never-ending rerun of your favorite sitcom. Same old jokes, different day. Just remember, time waits for no one...except me.

Souls are like fine nectar—some are aged to perfection, others are more like vinegar. But hey, they all end up in my collection eventually. Think of it as the ultimate soul food buffet, where everyone gets a taste of immortality.
Try improving your relationship with {1.SimFirstName} first.
{1.SimFirstName} might need to be a bit older to fully appreciate {0.SimFirstName}'s words.
{0.SimFirstName} must reach Comedy Level 10 in order to conjure up something truly magnificent.
This family relationship seems fine. Is there another one {0.SimFirstName} might seek to mend?
Perhaps your child needs to be a bit older before having this heartfelt moment.
Cemetery Keeping is great, if you don't mind a Ghost here and there. You can try it for yourself if you join the Undertaker Career!

Do you think we all actually work for the N.W.D.D.? It seems quite strange for them to be outsourcing the living. I don't mean to be a skeptic, but something is fishy about Grim and it's not the Baleful Bog smell.

I accidentally made Grimbrosia wrong, so I’m trying to stay under the radar. Grim wasn't exactly happy about “the undead” and “causing an innocent soul to hang in the balance”, blah blah blah. Personally, I thought it was pretty neat, but I'm not trying to get fired.

Have you seen under Grim's hood?! He looks like *whispers discreetly*. CRAZY RIGHT?! You could probably ask to see for yourself if you really wanted to, but I think you need to be pretty good friends.
I heard Grim say he spent all day “slayin”. I don't know if he meant literally or not, and to be honest I’m too scared to ask.
Have you seen the top Reaper uniforms? Grim said he hand stitched them! I didn't know he was so multi-talented.

Sims can participate in a variety of rituals, large and small, to pay their respects to deceased Sims during funerals. Funerals can be customized with specific activities to accommodate many end of life wishes, allowing you to represent the essence of each individual Sim's personality in the event of their death.

Heirloom Objects are designated objects that have special value to you and may be passed down through generations of Sims via Wills. Many objects are worthy of being Heirlooms—crafted items and artworks, chairs, tables, decorations, and more! Even toilets, believe it or not! If you own an Heirloom Object, be sure to write a Will to make sure it's accounted for when you pass on. You wouldn't want your Heirloom lost to time, would you?

Wills allow you to designate what happens when either you or your entire household dies. Upon your individual death, your Will dictates: • Which gravestone or urn you would like your Sim remains to be stored in • What funeral activities you would like to be held in your honor • Passing on Heirloom Objects to another Sim Upon your full household's passing, your Will dictates: • What happens to dependents who cannot take care of themselves (any Child Sim or younger, as well as pets) • Where your household's Simoleons go, whether it's to another household or to charity

Tarot is an ancient form of divination! One can tap into intuition, and through the readings, can find clarity or guidance. Inner desires come forth and the universe's influence takes hold! Amongst the Tarot community, there are whispers of a magical deck waiting to be found. A secret order has been performing rituals throughout Ravenwood, and their sacred site, a Tarot Tome Shrine, could reveal some truth to the rumors.

Intuition is within us all, Tarot merely taps into it. I thank you for reviving my most precious deck. I can no longer seem to recall how those images came to be. Visions, maybe? My death was many moons ago, such memories fade with time. May it guide you through this life and the next.

Send your soul adrift for a new life with some faded memories of those you once knew. Once you select to Rebirth, you will be taken to Manage Worlds to select a new household to Rebirth your Sim into.
Must be a ghost with the Dreams Fulfilled reward tier unlocked from the Soul's Journey.

Requires the Dreams Fulfilled reward tier from the Soul's Journey.

The Town Hall serves as a hub for both spectral and administrative functions. Ghosts frequently visit to resolve their Unfinished Business, morticians file for zoning rights to expand their operations due to the booming death industry, and Sims consult estate attorneys for will preparation. The second floor contains the Office of Afterlife Festivals, documenting decisions on festival schedules, locations, and attire. Notable entries include the Pet Crow licenses, officially deemed unnecessary due to excessive paperwork, despite the belief that crows answer only to Grim.
Boring? Maybe. Maybe not. Watch if you dare.
Without level 10 Fitness skill, {0.SimFirstName} is unworthy of true Fitness glory.

Need to let out some ghostly steam? Possess this chest to gain some additional experience in Ghost Mastery.
Pesky ghosts leave behind Ecto Puddles as a way to disrupt the living world.

Earned when performing Evil and Good Ghost Mastery abilities. Rumor has it there's a mysterious merchant in Ravenwood that's driven by a thirst for forbidden knowledge and ghostly powers, who will pay top Simoleon for Essence, which can become quite lucrative. Honestly, who needs a job in the Afterlife?! Make this your new hustle for some easy Simoleon!
Drag Sim remains or occupied burial casket here to assign plot to that Sim.

The Eternal Reflections: Indoor Memorial Ensemble offers a serene space to honor and celebrate the lives of your loved ones. This thoughtfully designed collection accommodates treasured keepsakes, such as the Timeless Capture to capture their essence, Scents You've Been Gone incense for a soothing ambiance, and the Whispering Wren Messenger Statue to convey heartfelt messages—perfect for a peaceful indoor tribute.

The Garden of Memories: Outdoor Memorial Ensemble creates a tranquil setting to remember and cherish those who have passed. Ideal for cemeteries or garden spaces, this collection holds precious mementos, including the Timeless Capture for lasting remembrances, Scents You've Been Gone incense for a comforting aroma, and the Whispering Wren Messenger Statue for sending messages of love—a beautiful outdoor tribute.
Garden of Memories: Outdoor Memorial Ensemble
Choose Join when it's time to go to work.

He rests where many others rest...in the darkness...underground. Find Deimos by Exploring any Crypt.
He has forgotten his Sim nature...but as they say, it takes a village to raise a child. Find Freddy the Specter by the playground in the center of the Crow's Crossing neighborhood of Ravenwood.

Always by my side, but now remote and at peace...surrounded by fields and water...an island. Find Ann's gravestone on a small island in the river running through the Whispering Glen neighborhood of Ravenwood.
I feel anger and fear...next a place with village riches, where wishes can turn to dreams or nightmares. Find Edith by the Well of Longing and Regret in the Crow's Crossing neighborhood of Ravenwood.

To know a ghost is to know about them, too. Therefore, {0.SimFirstName} must get to know a ghost well enough to call them a friend. Ravenwood is a great place to start meeting local ghosts!

It's time to become a fledgling Thanatologist. To prepare for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} journey to ghastly greatness, {0.SimFirstName} needs to at least understand the basics of the darker side of life (and death!)\n\n{0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can improve {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Thanatology skill by reading theories on a Computer, ordering Thanatology skill books, or perhaps even joining the Reaper or Undertaker careers.
The first step in a long journey of becoming a notable writer of all things scary! To build Writing Skill, head to a Computer to Practice Writing or simply Write Genre Books.

{0.SimFirstName} should make a second ghost friend to expand {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} horizons and learn even more about ghosts! Ravenwood is always a great place to start meeting new ghosts.
Find a Rare Item in a Crypt

Crypts are an amazing way to find cool, ghostly treasure and potentially learn even more about ghosts! They can be placed on any lot by purchasing the Crypt of Eternity from Build Mode but can also always be found in Ravenwood. Once located, select Explore the Underground Crypts to potentially find treasure!
{0.SimFirstName} can continue to improve {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Thanatology skill by heading to a Computer and choosing to Read Theories, or by ordering Thanatology skill books.
The best Ghost Historians are always prepared to write about their findings in great detail. So head to a Computer to Practice Writing or simply Write Genre Books!
Find a Rare Item in a Crypt

Head back into the Crypts and find something amazing! Crypts can be placed on any lot by purchasing the Crypt of Eternity from Build Mode, but can also always be found in Ravenwood. Once located, select Explore the Underground Crypts to potentially find treasure!

Edith is a ghostly child that haunts Ravenwood. A good starting point for finding her would be locating her mother, Alice, who often hovers near the Guardian Tree in Ravenwood's Mourningvale neighborhood. Another good place to investigate might be the Well of Longing and Regret in Ravenwood's Crow's Crossing neighborhood.
Continue to Practice Writing or Write Genre Books at the Computer to reach Level 7. At this level, {0.SimFirstName} will unlock the ability to write Horror books!

This is your chance to write about everything you've learned so far and write some chilling stories! Head to a Computer, choose Write... followed by Write Genre Book... to start writing your Horror novel.
Once {0.SimFirstName} has fully written a book, select a Mailbox and either Self-Publish or Sell to Publisher to start earning royalties from published books!

Go to the Sylvan Glade\nI've heard of a special tree somewhere in Willow Creek that opens up to a secret passage. Something about looking at the tree, watering the tree, talking to the tree, and following the sound? Who comes up with this stuff? I guess I should at least check it out, it might be a fun adventure!
"I want to discover the Forgotten Grotto!"
Find the Forgotten Grotto\nI've heard legend of secret tunnels in Oasis Springs that lead to some kind of underground grotto? That sounds like the adventure of a lifetime if I've ever heard one!

Befriend, WooHoo, or fight a Ghost Sim in Ravenwood\nI'm looking for a memorable experience with a ghost, no matter what that looks like. And there's no better place to have a close encounter with the ghostly kind than Ravenwood, the most macabre town I can think of. I'm ready to live out my phantasmal fantasy!
"I'd like to explore the deepest reaches of space!"

Ride a Rocket Ship, or go to work as a max-level Astronaut\nThe moon and stars have always inspired me. I've always dreamed of finding myself among them one day, exploring new planets. Time to make that dream a reality!
"I seek the power of the Well of Longing and Regret!"
Find the Well of Longing and Regret, and receive the Mark of Edith\nIt's time for me to unlock the mysteries of Ravenwood! Now, to actually find Edith and ask her about that well...
"I'd like to write the greatest book ever!"

Reach Writing level 10 and Declare Life's Finest Literary Work\nI will be counted among the pantheon of the best writers in all of Simkind! After mastering the skill of Writing, I will pen a tome of the utmost quality. Then, I can proudly Declare it my Life's Finest Work! Only then will I have reached the true pinnacle of writerhood.
"I want to mix the ultimate drink!"

Have a Max Level Drink-Making Skill and Create the Greatest Drink Ever\nI want the world to know me as a master of drinks! Whether it's Mixology, Juice Fizzing, or Nectar Making, I must achieve greatness in one of the drink-related skills and create one highest quality drink. Once it's made, I can Declare it the Greatest Drink Ever. It's time to get flippin' and sippin'!
"I want to serve the greatest dish ever made!"

Reach Cooking Level 10 and Cook the Greatest Dish Ever\nWhether it's regular Cooking or Gourmet Cooking, I'm determined to reach the absolute peak of culinary capability. Once I've gotten there, and I've cooked a dish of the maximum quality, I need to Declare it the Greatest Dish Ever. The whole world should know just how tasty my cooking is!
"I want to handcraft the perfect punchline!"

Reach Comedy Level 10 and Unleash the Perfect Punchline, or Tell the Funniest Joke (from the Joke Star Aspiration)\nI want to be remembered for being funny and easy to get along with! I'll try and come up with my own material for the perfect punchline, or I can hit them with the funniest joke in the world. One of those has got to land, right?

Reach Gardening level 10 and Bask in Your Gardening Greatness\nI will have the best garden in the world and be renowned for reaching the pinnacle of planting. Once I've grown the highest quality plant possible, I should take the time to Bask in My Gardening Greatness while beholding that little green piece of perfection.

Reach Level 10 Painting, Paint a Masterpiece, and Declare it Life's Finest Painting\nArt is important in so many ways to me. And if there's one last thing I'm determined to do, it's to leave my brush stroke on this world before I go! Once I've reached the peak of my artistry, I should select a Masterpiece I've painted and Declare it my Life's Finest Painting. My body of work will be lauded for generations to come!

Reach Photography Level 5 and take 10 Photos outside of your home world\nSmile for the camera! The best way to document a life well-lived is through photographs, and I plan to document mine perfectly. After mastering Photography, I have to travel around, experience life in other places and take photos to remember my journey! I can't think of a better way to leave my mark on the world.
"I want to sculpt the greatest sculpture ever made!"

Reach Handiness Level 10, craft a Masterpiece sculpture and Declare it Life's Finest Sculpture\nI'm not afraid of a little elbow grease! Nothing's more fulfilling than making something with your own two hands. That's why I've valued Handiness so much in my life. It's time to perfect my skill and pick one of my sculpted masterpieces to Declare it my Life's Finest Sculpture. Once I've sculpted such a thing of beauty, my legacy will never fade away!

{0.SimFirstName} should consider filling out {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} goals!\n\nGoals will naturally accumulate over time for {0.SimFirstName}, or {0.SimPronounSubjective} can explore goals by writing down ideas on a Computer or Journal.
"I've been dreaming of becoming a parent!"

Become a Parent\nI think it's finally time to start a family. Whether it's traditionally, via science baby services, or adoption, I'm really looking forward to having a child of my own to raise. Let's make this house a home!
"I want to go on the best date ever!"

Proclaim Best Date Ever while on a Gold level date\nDating should be fun and memorable! Before I go, I want to go on a date that'll surpass all other dates, one that both of us will remember. Once the date has proven itself to be the best it can be, I should make sure to tell the other person. When the moment is right, I'll Proclaim it the Best Date Ever!
Get Married\nIt's time for me to settle down! I'd like to spend the rest of my life in a happy marriage with the love of my life. Is that too much to ask?
"My love and I will never part, even in death!"
Get Married or Renew Vows as a Ghost\nDeath isn't the end of this love life of mine! Now that I'm a ghost, I want to celebrate love just as much as I could when I was alive. What's stopping me?

Add a new child to the family\nI love my family as is, but I still have even more love in my heart to give to another child! Whether it's through Trying for Baby, adoption, or a science baby, it's time to expand this family.
"I should make sure to tell my parents I love them."
Tell a Parent You Love Them\nI wouldn't have made it this far without the love of my parent, and they should know that! Before it's too late, I should meet with my parent and Tell Them I Love Them.
"It's time to mend some of my family relationships."

Successfully Mend Family Relationship with a family member\nSome of my family relationships haven't gone so well over time. Maybe it's time for me to bury the hatchet, so to speak. As an offering of peace, I should meet with a family member I've struggled to connect with and try to Mend our Family Relationship. Maybe things will get better with a little effort and communication?
"I want to be seen as a role model for my family."

Run Mentoring interactions 10 times on Family\nI hope I'm remembered as someone who really cared about their family members, who helped them strive to achieve more. Once I purchase the Mentor trait from the Rewards Store, I can Mentor members of my family as they work on skills I've already mastered. That way, I can turn my own hard work into my whole family's success!
"I should make sure my kids know I'm proud of them."

Speak with your child and Tell Them You're Proud of Them\nI want to make sure any child of mine knows how much I love them. They should always feel confident in knowing how proud I am of them! Next time I see my child, I'll make sure to Tell Them I'm Proud of Them. It's the least I can do before it's too late.
"I should reconnect with my family before it's too late."

Improve a family relationship, and Connect with Family\nI think it's important for my family to know just how important they've been in my life. I should focus on one of those bonds and make sure it's strengthened, then actively Connect with that Family Member while we're together. I want to make sure they know how much they mean to me, while I still can!

Renew Vows at a wedding arch\nThis love is forever! I want to make sure my spouse knows I love them, while I still can. We just have to head to a Wedding Arch and take the time to Renew our Vows once more.
"I'd like to protect the future of my assets."

Write a Will\nWills aren't just about protecting my assets, it's about protecting my family and my legacy! Before it's too late, I should start my Will, either on a computer or by calling an Inheritance Lawyer. That way, once I've assigned inheritance rules and planned my funeral, I'll be free to go about my life knowing my legacy is secured.
"I want to throw the most bizarre costume party of all time!"

Host a Gold level Costume Party\nThere's no party like a costume party! Dressing up and seeing all your friends' creativity (or lack thereof) is a blast. I'm absolutely going to host the best costume party ever. Time to get weird with no fear!
"I want to host the most extraordinary dinner party!"

Host a Gold level Dinner Party\nNothing beats a nice night in with a group of friends, catching up over a lovely dinner. While I still can, I want to host an impeccable dinner party, with an unbeatable guest list! Let's make some delicious memories before it's all over.
"I'm gonna throw the most EPIC house party!"
Host a Gold level House Party\nTime to get those drinks made, jokes ready, and dance music playing! I'm gonna host an absolute banger of a house party, one for the ages. It's gonna be sick!
"I'm dreaming of fishing up the big one!"

Reach Fishing Level 10 and make an Amazing Catch\nI just know the big one is out there, waiting to be fished up and prized as my finest catch. Once I master the Fishing skill, I should find my favorite fishing spot and secure an amazing catch! It might help to Angle for Big Catch to make sure I'm fishing up something worthy of my iconic fishing legacy!
"I'd like to give back to my community!"

Reach Charisma Level 3 and make 5 donations\nI'd like to leave my mark on the world by giving back to my community. Once my Charisma is practiced enough, I can Donate to Online Charity on a computer. It's important to look out for others in this life!
"I want to bolster my reputation as a cool musician!"
Reach Guitar, Piano, or Violin Level 10, and Serenade 4 Sims\nI will forever be known as the charming crooner. No one can steal this from me!
"My house should be filled with plenty of beautiful new art!"
Own wall art and floor sculptures worth 10,000 Simoleons\nI want other Sims to think of me as the most cultured Sim they know! Amassing such a lovely collection of art would be a great start.
"I must own an incredibly lavish house!"
Own a house worth 250,000 Simoleons\nI can't think of a better indication of my success in life than a lavish house to show off. I'll be the envy of the neighborhood!
"It's time to reach glorious levels of fitness!"

Reach Level 10 Fitness Skill and Bask in Your Fitness Glory\nI want to be the strongest, fastest Sim in the world! Or, at least in my own world. Once I reach peak levels of performance, I should head to the nearest mirror and take in the results of all my hard work by Basking in My Fitness Glory. Time to get moving!
"I want to be known for my unparalleled intelligence."

Reach Logic Level 10, then beat some loser in chess\nEveryone will remember me for being the smartest Sim they ever knew, I'm sure of it. Once I've perfected my intellect, I should find someone willing to face me in chess and show them who's boss.

Reach Level 10 Gaming, then win a tournament\nListen, there's no room for scrubs in the story of my gaming prowess. Time for me to perfect my skill and win one of those tournaments I've seen advertised online. Everyone else can try just as hard to get good, or cope!
"I'd like to hoard tons of Simoleons!"
Have 100,000 Simoleons in household funds\nWhat does success look like to me? Being rich. And I'm gonna be rich!
"It's time to make a bunch of Simoleons!"

Make 10,000 Simoleons in Live Mode\nI've been yearning for the fulfillment of amassing more Simoleons in this life. 10,000 should be a good start, I think! Selling things I already have won't do it for me! I want to actively make these Simoleons and grow my net worth without sacrificing anything but time and energy.
"I'm finally going to quit that stupid job!"

Quit your stupid job\nI'm done! I refuse to be a link in the chain of corporate tyranny any longer! Well, this particular chain, at least. Perhaps there's another job out there that's more my speed. But this one? It's gotta go.
"I want the best yard in the neighborhood!"
Have 10,000 Simoleons worth of landscaping or outdoor items\nI want everyone who walks by my house to know how successful I am! There's nothing like a strong first impression.
"I'm destined to become the ultimate ghost!"
Achieve Transcendent Wraith level of Ghost Mastery\nI want to be the best ghost that's ever...lived? Er, died? Existed! Time to brush up on my skills...
"I'm going to achieve my loftiest ambitions!"
Have 10 skills at Level 5 or above\nI'm not just a run-of-the-mill Sim. I'm extraordinary. I was born for greatness. So why settle for less?
"I want to peak as an artist!"
Create 5 Masterpieces\nIt's about time I peaked as an artist. This will be the era they'll remember me by! My talent will inspire generations of artists to come.
"I'd just like some time to myself before it's all over."
Spend some alone time at a park\nSolitude is an beautiful thing, and I'd like one more solid go at it. Maybe I'll be alone in the park for a nice change of scenery? Yeah, that sounds lovely.
"I'd just like to hug my bros, while I can..."
Hug a friend with max friendship\nMy bros mean everything to me. EVERYTHING. And there's no way I'm dying before they know that.
"I'll burn every bridge, and no one's going to stop me!"
Become Despised by 5 different Sims\nI'm done pretending I like just anyone. It takes a lot for a Sim to really impress me. The rest who don't? Who cares! It's time to show the real me to the world!
Fight Grim\nYou know what, if death is gonna chase me, I'll give him something to remember me by. You can count on that one!
"The world needs to hear about my brushes with death!"

Discuss Near-Death Experiences with 5 Sims\nEven though death did technically catch up with me in the end, I put up a good fight. No, a great fight! All the times I evaded death? I'm a legend!! I can use the Discuss Near-Death Experiences social interaction to spread the word.
"I'm going to leave this world cleaner than it was before!"
Run 20 cleaning interactions\nNobody will ever out-neat me. Nobody!
"I'd like to comfort the living as much as I can."

Use Comfort Ghost Mastery Abilities 5 Times\nLiving Sims have it hard too! I should try to help out a few of them, if I can. Maybe I could learn powers like Solace Embrace to make my living friends feel better, or Euphoric Presence to radiate a positive aura for everyone around me. Little things like those could change the course of someone's day, or even their life, for the better!
Craft 30 things\nListen, as a Creative Sim, I don't care what it is! Cooking, painting, anything, whatever. I just need to make THINGS. There are so many things to create, and I must make them!

Do Critique Interactions\nAs a self-proclaimed Snob, many things in this world are just not up to my elevated standards! I must seek out some decor whether hideous or glamorous, and make sure to express my many valuable opinions on it as I Critique the Work.
"I just want to eat some great food while I can!"
Eat 10 Excellent Dishes\nOne thing about me, I will always let my Foodie flag fly! I've gotta enjoy some great food while I still can. The best food, even!
"I'm taking on the world! Come at me!"
Get into 5 fights\nYeah, I'm Hot-Headed. Always have been, always will be. And I'm ready to fight some Sims. Who cares about my reputation? I'm looking for a good fight while I still can!
"I'm going on one last amazing run!"

Go jogging for an hour at a park\nAs an Active Sim, I've always valued going out and getting in a good workout. Getting some fresh air and a great run at a park sounds amazing, I should make sure to do it while I still can!
"I want to help the living any way I can."

Run 5 Helpful Ghost Power Interactions\nEven as a ghost, I can have a tangible impact on the world! I should look for opportunities to use Helpful ghost powers like Dispel, Give Need, or Bestow Longevity to help out the living Sims around me.
"I just want to listen to my favorite album while I can!"

Listen to a liked genre of music\nEvery time I hear that one song, it always feels like the first time! I want to listen to that one, while I still can. Sometimes, it's the simple things that mean the most.
"I'd like to finally find love within myself."

Find Love Within Yourself on a mirror\nLike, okay, hear me out. I just need to find love...on the inside? You know, in order to love other people, I need to love myself first? Maybe that's all a Romantic Sim like me really needed? Am I onto something? Well, couldn't hurt to try.
"I hope I'm lucky enough to see a dead body."

See a dead Sim\nThere's something so special about death. It's an ending, sure, but it's also a glorious beginning! I'd like to be lucky enough to witness one in person. Maybe if I'm lucky, I'll get to see them reappear as a ghost!
"I'm going to finally make them pay!"

Be Mean 10 times to Despised Sims\nLook, I know I'm a Mean Sim. Why not live my truth while I still can? Once a Sim despises me, it'll be that much more delicious to be Mean to them. Any type of Mean interaction will do it for me!
As a Teen, Mess Around\nListen, don't judge me. I'm just, uh, curious! Yeah, I'm curious about how it all works, that's all! Ugh, this is awkward...
"I'd love one last nice trip to a museum!"
Admire 10 Artworks at a Museum\nAs an Art Lover, nothing sounds better than making sure I get one more day spent at the museum, taking the time to Admire beautiful works of art.
"I want to take a nice, quiet nap."
Take a nap\nLife is about the quiet moments. Especially my life! Let's indulge a bit more in the sweet, sweet solitude of slumber, and take the best nap ever, while I still can.
"I just want time to myself to read."
Read for an hour at the library\nI wish to be in my element one last time at the local library. It's a bookworm thing, you might not understand...
"I need to reaffirm all my suspicions through vigorous research!"
Reaffirm All Suspicions on the Computer\nI just know I was right all along. I have to be. I have to make sure to confirm it while I still can. The internet should have all the answers I need...
"I'm gonna scare the living daylights out of living Sims!"

Use Scare Ghost Mastery Abilities on Living Sims\nGhosts are what? Scary, that's right! Time to make those living Sims shake in their boots with my new powers. Let's see, I could make use of a nice, loud Haunting Shriek or maybe Levitate some Sims for a scary shakedown!
"It's time to sow ghostly chaos! Mwahaha!"

Use Chaos Ghost Mastery Abilities on Living Sims\nTime for a little bit of entropy! Perhaps I can cause some chaos with the Conjuror power and create a giant mess. Or, I could give sleeping Sims some nightmares with the Dream Corruptor ability.
"I want to spend a full day outside!"
Spend a full day outside\nAs a Sim that Loves the Outdoors, the idea of spending a full day outside sounds incredible. Just fresh air, the natural world, and me. Gotta enjoy it while I can!
"I want today's youth to know how hard it is to grow up!"

Warn Sims about Growing Up\nI may be a Childish Sim, but at least I'm self-aware. Every kid out there needs to know how much growing up sucks. Like, it's real bad. Nothing's fun anymore. Like, what even is a utility bill? Are you serious?!
"I need everyone in my fandom to know my name!"

Write Essay about Niche Fandom\nIt's time for me to sit down at the computer and Write Essay about Niche Fandom. I won't rest until every single member of the fandom is shouting my name throughout the forums. I will be the discourse champion!
"Let's fly with the crows of Ravenwood!"

Spend a full day in Ravenwood\nI've got chills just thinking about it! I want to uncover all the eerie secrets and storied history of Ravenwood. There's gotta be something fun to do there among all the doom and gloom, right?
"Time for a sunny stay in the Oasis!"
Spend a day in Oasis Springs\nI think I'd like to spend a day in Oasis Springs. It'll be a good chance to meet some locals, take in the sights, and hopefully soak up some sun!
"Let's take a daytrip to the Creek!"

Spend a day in Willow Creek\nI should spend some time in the historic town of Willow Creek, meet the locals, have a good time. All that good stuff! Not every destination has to be particularly exciting or out there, you know?
"Honestly? I just wanna get weird in a bush..."
WooHoo in a bush\nHear me out. I'd like to WooHoo in a bush, just to try it this once. Not looking for judgments!
"I want to WooHoo somewhere that gives me the chills!"
WooHoo in a Crypt on a Cemetery lot\nI don't care what you think! The dead can't judge me!
"I want to WooHoo in a way only Ghosts can!"

Possess WooHoo with another Ghost\nThere's something so cool about being able to possess an object with another Ghost and WooHoo while we're possessing it! Who cares about how that even works, I just gotta do it. Maybe we could start with a sink. Or a chair! The possibilities are endless.
"I want to have an unforgettable hot tub WooHoo!"
WooHoo in a Hot Tub\nTurn up the temperature and turn on those jets, I'm looking for a steamy WooHoo in a hot tub! Nothing else will do.
"I'd like to join the 60 mile high club!"
WooHoo in a Rocket Ship\nI just have to know what it's like. Is there any better way to enjoy zero gravity? To the stars, then!
A stair rail so chilling, even the most monotonous monologues from your garrulous peers will cease in the presence of its intimidating form.
What better to hold onto while ascending the stairs of life and death unendingly than this stunning railing! Made of finely weathered wood to add a dose of drama to the monotony of your existence.
Scary monsters, evil ghosts, rooms with no doors, pools with no ladders...
Who to reap, how to reap, when to reap, and other information to feed the soul.
Grimbrosia is used by Grim himself to cater to any and all pleas.
Cooking these supernatural amphibians renders a delicious stew that has some strange, but temporary, side effects.
Grill a Pot of Boiling Death Frog Hot Pot
Serve Boiling Death Frog Hot Pot
Riddled with the rich flavors of everlasting essences and lifelong energies, this soup is sure to warm the soul.
These Sims share an uncanny sense of familiarity with each other, as if they might have once been family. Could this strange connection hint at a deeper bond?
These Sims feel a peculiar bond with each other, as if their souls want to reunite. Could this strange connection be the start of something more profound?
Like a fairytale ending, not even death can keep these two apart! In a world filled with loss and uncertainty, they’ve found eternity in one another.
{0.SimFirstName} has a strong feeling of knowing {1.SimFirstName} somehow. Maybe from a past Life?
{0.SimFirstName} feels a strong connection with the Sim remembered via this heirloom.
The outcome of that Will didn't feel fair. To receive so little after everything...
{0.SimFirstName} has experienced the soothing touch of a ghostly embrace and now feels a deeper, otherworldly connection to {1.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} has a strong feeling that {0.SimPronounSubjective} once loved {1.SimFirstName}. Could {1.SimPronounSubjective} be...{0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} soulmate?
How could someone just sell a beloved family heirloom like that? Completely unbelievable...
A fulfilling feeling when loved ones honor your final wishes.
Don't you just hate it when someone ignores something you specifically requested?
Inheritance is a tricky process, and {0.SimFirstName} is still feeling hurt about what went down with that Will. This resentment runs deep!

Ghost Whisperers have access to special interactions to discuss their eerie findings and published works. They have a much easier time making friends (and more) with Ghosts. They will also get particularly excited while encountering ghosts of all kinds, Grim, and even Crows!
Lady Ravendancer Goth's mystical Tarot Deck.
An Undead Cowplant has been sent from the darkest regions of the Netherworld directly to your Household Inventory.
Emerging from the darkest regions of the Netherworld, this Undead Cowplant can be placed anywhere on your residential lot. Keep it happy, or face its consequences...

This glass roof sure has seen better days! Though, perhaps it still has some potential. Featuring precariously old and rusted metal framework and glass that looks like it's one stray pebble away from catching you a lawsuit.
This tile roof isn't as pristine as it once was. But it's still beautiful. Like a fine nectar, it has grown more... aged, with age.
Ending the Funeral early will result in Guests being sent home. Your Sim may still remain on the lot after the event has ended.
A time for loved one's and acquaintances to remember, grieve, and celebrate the life of a Sim recently departed.
Welcome! Waylon Warez and his friends are here to greet you with some Pan de Muerto. To learn a little more about your surroundings, be sure to Ask about Ravenwood.
Use the Computer to Analyze Death Trends.
Select a Bookshelf to Research Assignment for the day.
Locate Soul Orbs and select them to Collect.
Locate the Grimbrosia Plant and Select to Harvest.

Grim has given you a new task! Some souls have escaped, and the Netherworld is breaking through. You'll have to retrieve the souls and stop access to the Netherworld. Luckily, souls won't fight back. They just need a little pick-me-up.\n\nSide note, if you see any Grimbrosia Source lying around, could you grab it? Grim's supply of Grimbrosia is running low.
You've successfully harvested Grimbrosia Source! You'll be able to cook Grimbrosia in the office kitchen upon your return.
A crisis call is coming in! The resident comedian has been knockin' 'em dead at their latest show...literally. It looks like there are multiple deceased Sims to process. This is no laughing matter.
A crisis call is coming in! Sims with a sweet tooth have been tricked by a mischievous Cowplant! Be ready to reap a few Sims that have gotten their just desserts!
Select the Phone, and under Business, choose Make Cold Calls.
Select a Fridge or Stove to cook Grimbrosia recipe.
Use the Scry Bowl located in the main floor of the office to receive Assignment.

Welcome to the Grim Branch. Here you'll learn the ropes of reaping and attend Grim's very own training session. Make your way to the Scry Bowl to receive your assignment and then feel free to prep for the reap by completing tasks such as Research Assignment, Practice Reaping and Perform Scythe Maintenance before traveling.\n\nAs an employee, you'll want to hit your weekly Souls Quota, which you and your Netherline contribute to with each reap. Feel free to check your status on the Computer.
Select the deceased and use Lazy or Standard Collect Soul for an easier reap, or try a more challenging reap with Careful, Flamboyant or Grim-Level Collect Soul.
Killer deductive skills! Now you're ready to Collect a Soul. Based on your prep work, you may be able to try a specialized reap. Or feel free to stick with the tried and true, your choice!
Select the deceased Sim to Investigate Cause of Death. Once investigated, select the deceased Sim to Determine Cause of Death.

You've arrived at Reaper Training! Here you'll find Kenny, our undead-all-around-good-dude. Kenny is unfortunately dead at the moment, but don't be alarmed! It doesn't hurt (we think). Head on over to his crumpled little body to survey the scene. You'll want to Investigate Cause of Death to Determine Cause of Death before you start swinging your scythe around. And if you need advice, Grim is here to help.
Use the Computer to File a Death Certificate.
Use the Netherworld Portal to Release a Soul from your Inventory.

Nice slice! Kenny's Soul has now been placed in your Inventory. Before you leave, you're welcome to Request Reaping Review from the remains of the deceased or from lingering bystanders. It helps boost morale!\n\nNext, Return to the Office and Release his Soul into the Netherworld Portal. Don't forget to also File a Death Certificate, the N.W.D.D. loves red tape.
Use the Scry Bowl to Travel.
Add Grimbrosia to Sim Inventory and Deliver Grimbrosia to Grim.
Socialize with a Coworker by being Friendly or Gossiping about Grim.

How Ghast! Ghosts are mucking about a property and causing mayhem! The worst part? They've stolen souls!\n\nYou'll have to travel to their haunting grounds and collect what was taken. It's the only Ghost busting Grim has a license for, so keep it clean and focus on those souls.

How Ghast! Ghosts are mucking about a property and causing mayhem! The worst part? They've stolen souls! You'll have to travel to their haunting grounds and collect what was taken. It's the only Ghost busting Grim has a license for, so keep it clean and focus on those souls. As a Ghost, you'll be able to use your Ghost Mastery to join in the revelry!
Select a Ghost and Collect Soul by choosing one of the Reaping Styles.
Using Ghost Mastery, perform Haunting Shriek.
Find the Netherworld Fissures located on the lot and select to Close.
Find the Ghost hiding in an eerily floating object and select Expel Ghost to banish them from the office.
Select the Netherworld Portal and choose Repair. A higher Handiness Skill will help this go faster!
Select the Scry Bowl and choose Repair. A higher Handiness Skill will help this go faster!
Select Self to perform Scythe Maintenance.
Select a Coworker Sim while they Practice Reaping and choose Mentor.
Select a Computer to Order Office Supplies.
Use a Slablet to Plan Reaping Schedules.
Practice Reaping on the Test Mannequin.
Select the Netherworld Portal to perform a Quality Check.
Select Grim and choose Get Expert Opinion.
Select the Urn and choose Deliver to Family.
Select an Object near the body and choose Investigate.
Locate the Sim nearby with the Has Plea headline and select Listen to Plea.
Select the deceased Sim to Revive.
Select the Urn and choose Request Reaping Review.
Select a Witness and choose Get to Know from the Friendly, Small Talk Social Menu.
The time has come to float solo! Grim is staying behind to address some paperwork (and totally not play Blicblock) while you reap alone. Good luck! Kisses!
Locate a Witness Sim nearby and Soothe.
Select a Witness and choose Take Witness Statement.
Select the Scry Bowl and Scry for Lost Souls.
You've successfully made Grimbrosia! Now go deliver it straight away.\n\nIt's proprietary material so it cannot leave the premises.
Use a Computer and select Write. Write Genre Book for Reapers Creepers: Training Manual Installment
Schedule a Funeral Event to attend from the Phone, the Calendar or by clicking on an Urn or Gravestone of a departed Sim that {1.SimFirstName} knows.
Place a Tarot Deck from Build Mode, look for Tarot Tome Shrines throughout Ravenwood, and look around for hidden cards, too!
Select the speakers' podium at Afterlife Anonymous and choose Admit Ghost Problems or Admit Grief Problems.
Select a Ghost Sim at Afterlife Anonymous, then the Friendly Affection category, and choose Console Ghost.
Attend Afterlife Anonymous and Possess the Chest.
Speak with an Inheritance Lawyer and select Ask about Wills.
Select the Crow at Ravenwood Family Day and choose Give Gift.
Select the Crow at Ravenwood Family Day then choose Provoke Crow.
Select the Fountain at Ravenwood Family Day and choose Search for Frogs. Keep trying until you get one!
Select one of the Specters floating around at Ravenwood Family Day and choose Ask for a Gift.
Select any towel or the ground while attending Moon Revelry and choose Moonbathe
Select the bonfire at the Moon Revelry and choose Dance.
Visit the late night Moon Revelry festival and take a dip in the nearby river beside the Ancestor cliff.
Select the Guardian Tree while at the Thinned Festiveil and choose Offer Gift. Sims need to have a gift item in their Inventory.
Select Waylon Warez at the Thinned Festiveil and choose Purchase Warez under the Mysterious Merchandise category, then buy something.
Select the Tarot Reader at the Thinned Festiveil and choose Ask about Tarot or Receive a Reading.
Socialize with Grim and become friends.
Select available object to Possess WooHoo with another ghost or Transcendent WooHoo with living!
Explore the Underground Crypts throughout Ravenwood and see what horrible adventures await. Enter if you dare...

Once {1.SimFirstName} has collected all 26 Tarot Cards throughout Ravenwood, or once {1.SimFirstName} has bought the Bibbity-Basic's Tarot Deck, {1.SimPronounSubjective} can Draw Daily Reading from the Tarot Card Deck in {1.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} inventory or click on a friend and Offer Tarot Reading.
Visit the Well of Longing and Regret
Visit the Crow's Crossing neighborhood in Ravenwood to find the Well of Longing and Regret. But unless you have the Mark of Edith, be careful what you Wish for...
After progressing to Level 9 in the Mortician branch of the Undertaker career, Contemplate Existence can be accessed by selecting self.
Progress to Level 3 in the Undertaker Career to access the "Gossip about the Dead" interaction under the Friendly Social menu.
Learn any new skill from any category.
Use Healing Hand or Death's Touch
Select an object and perform Healing Hand or Death's Touch
Select Grim and Discuss Deathly Business.
Attend an Active Work Day in the Reaper Career and Collect a Soul from Reaping.
Select a Sim and Discuss Deadly Enigmas.
Select a Sim and Speak a Dead Language.
Using a Computer or Journal, write a Bucket List goal.
A Will can be started by using a Computer or by hiring an Inheritance Lawyer, then updated at any time once it's in your Sim's inventory!
Select a Sim with a close relationship to use an unlocked good or helpful Ghost Mastery ability.
Find an object worthy of passing on through generations of future Sims, select it, and choose Make Heirloom.
Select an enemy living Sim and perform an unlocked evil Ghost Mastery ability.
Become Close Friends with a Ghost
If your Sim doesn't know many Ghosts, try finding one roaming the streets of Ravenwood.

The Words in the Tablet Read: Deimos Son of Alice. Skeptical, Genius and Macabre. Lived a full life and passed away as an elder from death by Cowplant. His very last word as he accepted his fate of getting swallowed whole was "Sentenced..."

{0.SimFirstName} takes a turn and comes upon a dead-end. Upon turning around, two yellow, glowing eyes peer out from the darkness. The unknown creature walks forward with a low sounding hiss. It reaches its bony hands toward {0.SimFirstName}...

{0.SimFirstName} runs faster than ever before, narrowly escaping the hissing creature. With sweat dripping off {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} brow, {0.SimFirstName} leans against a nearby wall to catch {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} breath. Yikes, maybe it's time to return to the surface for a bit.

{0.SimFirstName} sprints towards the exit, but clumsily trips onto the stone floor. A loud hiss and a big thud follow as {0.SimFirstName} is knocked out cold. A few moments later {0.SimFirstName} comes to and slowly limps out of the crypt, embarrassed but none the worse for wear.

{0.SimFirstName}'s first instinct is to show kindness to the creature, gently outstretching a hand to signal that there is no threat. Like a scared animal, the creature hisses softly as it approaches. Feeling no fear, {0.SimFirstName} steadies {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} hand, allowing the creature to sniff around. Once it appears it is more relaxed, {0.SimFirstName} happily gives it a gentle scratch, the creature responding in a pleasant hum, while leaning further into the touch. {0.SimFirstName} may have just made an unlikely new friend!
Point Behind the Creature and Run the Other Way!

The creature is not amused, if anything they seem to be more angry! The hissing increases in volume, echoing through the halls. {0.SimFirstName} covers {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} ears as the grating noise becomes louder. Starting to shake, {0.SimFirstName} does the only thing {0.SimPronounSubjective} can think of in a moment like this.
Sigh in Relief and Continue Exploring

As {0.SimFirstName} slowly backs away, {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} mind begins to race, trying to think of a way out of this mess. {0.SimFirstName} proceeds to pat {0.SimPronounReflexive} down, searching for anything in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} possession that might aid {0.SimPronounObjective} in this escape. {0.SimFirstName} feels around in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} pocket, only to retrieve a snack that {0.SimPronounSubjective} had grabbed before heading into the Crypt. {0.SimFirstName}'s hand shakes, offering the food to the hissing creature, allowing it to sniff the delicious gift. The creature softly nibbles away at the snack, the hiss transitioning to a pleasant purr after every bite.

Dusty happily smacks its tongue and sits down obediently, waiting for a delicious treat. {0.SimFirstName} confidently offers the snack, holding it out in front of {0.SimPronounObjective} proudly. Dusty quickly devours the food, lapping up every crumb. Seemingly satisfied, Dusty races behind {0.SimFirstName}, disappearing into the darkness from which it came.

{0.SimFirstName} can't help but feel that {0.SimPronounSubjective} should have left the Sarcophagus alone. Shrugging it off and exiting the room, {0.SimFirstName} can't shake the feeling as though someone or something is behind them...
Show Them a True Creature of the Night
The Energy of the Moon Can Be Felt... Rip and Tear
Fight Back! We Already Died Once!
This is Why We Practiced Magic!

Now walking swiftly, {0.SimFirstName} rounds the corner only to be met with a ghostly creature blocking the path ahead. Red, glowing eyes seem to pierce into {0.SimFirstName}'s soul, filling {0.SimPronounObjective} with dread. A quick decision needs to be made.

Despite fear bubbling up inside {0.SimPronounObjective}, {0.SimFirstName} summons all of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} might, and with eyes closed, starts swinging! After a few moments, {0.SimFirstName} opens {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} eyes, bewildered to see that the creature has gone. Looks like they got scared off!

{0.SimFirstName} launches {0.SimPronounReflexive} forward, fists clenched and ready for action. In disbelief, {0.SimFirstName} removes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} fist, causing a slimy goo to slop onto the ground. The ghostly creature is surprised by {0.SimFirstName}'s actions. No one has ever tried to talk to them before... Individuals usually run away scared before they have the chance. The two spend the next ten minutes talking and laughing, before agreeing to part ways. {0.SimFirstName} hopes they can meet again some day.

{0.SimFirstName} reaches {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} hand inside, the coolness from the shadow and surrounding bricks giving {0.SimPronounObjective} goosebumps. Surfacing forgotten treasures hidden inside cause {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} heart to race with excitement. ...But what else? {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} fingertips suddenly come into contact with something hard. {0.SimFirstName} yelps, startled! {0.SimFirstName} hits a few notes making a terrible sound, causing the cover of the piano to violently snap shut. Once back on {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} feet, a light to the outside world can be seen. Maybe it's time for {0.SimFirstName} to cut {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} losses and head home.

As {0.SimFirstName} presses the keys, a melody surges through {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} fingertips with ease. {0.SimPronounSubjective} perfectly play the notes and the puzzle happily chimes, opening another door. Impressive! Maybe {0.SimFirstName} should pick up an instrument and explore this newfound talent.

Piece of cake! {0.SimFirstName} reads the sheet music with ease, precisely pressing each key with confidence. The puzzle chimes after a job well done, opening up a new corridor for {0.SimFirstName} to explore.
A beautifully adorned silver box with a ruby heart on it calls to {0.SimFirstName}. {0.SimFirstName} gently opens the box, as a beam of light comes forth and fills the room.

{0.SimFirstName} is drawn to a dark and dusty wooden box. Once opened {0.SimFirstName} pauses, realizing there is nothing inside. A chilly sensation runs down {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} spine. {0.SimFirstName} can't tell if the feeling is from relief or horror. There is something about its emptiness... Is it a metaphor or something more sinister? {0.SimFirstName} decides not to stick around to find out.

{0.SimFirstName} nearly misses the iridescent box, as it almost looks translucent. The box feels light as a feather and smooth to the touch. Opening the lid brings forth a sense of power and strength that {0.SimFirstName} has never experienced before. As quick as the sensation is felt, it fades into a distant memory as the box chooses to close.
After a short rest, a small hearty meal and some deep breaths, {0.SimFirstName} is ready to continue exploring!
Well, well, well. It appears lady luck was on your side after all.\n{0.SimFirstName} receives some epic loot from this mysterious stranger! You can find it in {0.SimFirstName}'s Inventory.
A labyrinth of forgotten corridors and ancestral vaults lie ahead...
{0.SimFirstName} comes across an ancient and forgotten sarcophagus, a name can be read in the stone tablet next to it...Deimos. This must be it! This is one of Alice's children!
{0.SimFirstName} walks steadily through the dimly lit corridors. An occasional extra footstep, and light hissing sound echo through the halls around {0.SimPronounObjective}.

A familiar hiss is heard, echoing through the stone hallways. {0.SimFirstName} has encountered this cryptid creature in past visits and has heard tales from other travelers. Its shape is ever changing, sometimes slithering like a snake, and other times prowling like a wolf. It's referred to by the name Dusty by the town-folk for reasons {0.SimFirstName} is unsure of. Although assumed to be friendly, it's always best to approach with caution...or with food if one is smart enough to remember to bring some along.
Light a Candle and Continue Exploring

{0.SimFirstName} stumbles into a dimly lit room, with an open sarcophagus and scattered debris strewn about the floor. Cobwebs and dust line the Sarcophagus's opening, suggesting that whoever was here must have been gone for quite some time.
Remove the Brick and Stick Your Hand Inside

As {0.SimFirstName} ventures through the Crypt halls, a brick, just barely sticking out of the wall, catches {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} eye. {0.SimFirstName} gives it a little wiggle and realizes that it's loose!

{0.SimFirstName} comes across what looks to be some sort of musical puzzle. Perplexed, {0.SimFirstName} deduces that {0.SimPronounSubjective} will need to play the correct sequence of notes on a dusty old piano that has taken up residence in the Crypt. Investigating further, {0.SimFirstName} spies some sheet music, which would likely make this puzzle a breeze for anyone skilled in music.

A dim light emanates at the end of a dark hallway, loud thumping and frantic muttering can be heard. {0.SimFirstName} musters the courage to walk into the torchlit opening only to encounter a hooded figure with boxes and bags of goodies lining the room! The hooded figure looks at {0.SimFirstName}, with a crooked smile they gesture at three ornate boxes sitting on a table nearby. "Care to choose one? Be warned you must take whatever it provides".

{0.SimFirstName} comes across a door with warm glowing lights flickering underneath. Opening the door, {0.SimFirstName} finds a cozy room with a bed and fireplace. A signpost above the fireplace reads "Visitors Welcome". It's been a tiring journey, perhaps {0.SimPronounSubjective} should stay and rest for a while?

{0.SimFirstName} peers inside and is met with a mysterious, trench coat wearing fellow. The stranger is holding a box, but it's too dark to see its contents.\n"Welcome, welcome, welcome to Waylon's Pop-in-Shop. I have some fine items available for free, as long as you ain't afraid of a bit of chance. Lady luck may be on your side." He shakes the box enticingly.

A weight has been lifted... I no longer wallow in this ocean of sorrow; unshackled from these chains that kept me down. Thank you...thank you for finding my children. My Guardian Tree now opens to you.

As sand rained down in my final resting bed and I clenched the red flowers in my hands...all I could think of were my children. What happened to them? I don't know where they are, but I can feel their locations...their Essence. Please, I must know what became of them.

Welcome to Mourningvale: Where the Dead Haven't Moved On—They've Moved In! Nestled within the misty embrace of Mourningvale lies a town where the boundary between the living and the afterlife is as thin as the fog that clings to its moss-covered trees. Is it the eerie clang of the bell tower at odd hours? The unexplained footsteps echoing through empty houses? Or perhaps the cawing of a murder of crows that sends shivers? Whatever it is, Mourningvale has rightfully earned its reputation as the world's funeral capital, where the death industry thrives. Immerse in everything Mourningvale has to offer by attending the Thinned Festiveil and Afterlife Anonymous. For more details about each festival, read festival information below.

Welcome to Whispering Glen: Where Nature’s Splendor Meets Ancient Secrets. In the tranquil expanse of Whispering Glen, nature's hidden wonders and timeless legends unfold amidst a landscape of serene beauty. The colossal Ancestor monument, with its ancient tears and forgotten rituals, stands as a testament to the valley’s past. Nearby ruins—a remnant of a celestial impact—hints cosmic origins and enigmatic connections to bygone civilizations. Here, every whisper of the wind and every rustle of the leaves carries the weight of a thousand untold tales, inviting explorers from all over the world to uncover the magic of this secluded haven. Explore Whispering Glen’s natural beauty and uncover its magical transformation through these enchanting festivals. Read festival information for more details.
The Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life
Try Before You Die Casket Sale

Welcome to Crow's Crossing: A Village Where Legends and Tradition Intertwine. In Crow's Crossing, the tapestry of history is ever-present. Founded by a group of lost nomads enchanted by an enigmatic tarot reader, this village thrives on the echoes of its mystical beginnings. Today, Crow's Crossing celebrates its rich heritage through vibrant festivals that honor both the past and present. Join these festivals that make this village truly special! Read festival information below to find out more.

{0.SimFirstName} placed the order for a replacement gravestone. Unfortunately, with no family to contact, the cost falls on the company. It's a rather hefty bill which makes {0.SimFirstName}'s boss not too happy.

With a little elbow grease, {0.SimFirstName} made the grave look practically new! (Minus the crack, of course.) Before leaving, {0.SimFirstName} runs {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} fingers along the sigils. "What strange carvings." A chill passes over {0.SimFirstName} before turning to leave.
Flipping through the office's records, it looks like the plot belongs to a Jon Smith Tricou. Sadly, no family contact is listed. Poor Jon.

While doing rounds, {0.SimFirstName} notices a rather large crack running straight down the center of an old gravestone. Strange sigils lay carved into the sides and a sad aura envelopes {0.SimPronounObjective} as {0.SimFirstName} draws near.\n\nUpon a closer look, {0.SimFirstName} sees the grave sits caked in dirt, barely legible, and {0.SimFirstName} begins to wonder why no one has ever come to visit or bring flowers. Is it cursed or just forgotten? Either way, {0.SimFirstName} has to do something.
Grim's ego is clearly wounded, but at least we did it by the book. Hopefully Grim doesn't hold on to this grudge when {0.SimFirstName}'s time is up.
Grim owes you one for your discretion. Now that soul is safely in the afterlife where it belongs and this won't be a mark on The N.W.D.D.'s insurance record.
Call Grim to Finish the Job
Our little secret, sure. Do you have any spare souls in the lost & found I could have as a thank you for this generous discretion?

Well this is awkward. As a new cadaver is rolled in, {0.SimFirstName} can tell something's... off about it. {0.SimFirstName}'s been in the business long enough to know the subtle sweet aroma of a lingering soul, still left in the body. Looks like this must have been a botched job by Grim, or most likely - one of his new Grimterns. How might {0.SimPronounSubjective} go about handling this?
{0.SimFirstName} shares a few kind words before beginning {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} process. Hopefully these mysterious deaths one day stop...although it is good for business.

It might not be {0.SimFirstName}'s job but it is someone's job to go hunt down ghosts. And now {0.SimFirstName} can move on, knowing {0.SimPronounSubjective} gave the information to the right parties. The extra coin doesn't hurt either.
Not {0.SimFirstName}'s ghosties, not {0.SimFirstName}'s haunted house. It's best to just let dead things lie.

With the estate name in mind, {0.SimFirstName} was able to find the estate owners. 'Tricou.' TRICOU?! Like that creepy broken grave?! Theories online claim Fricorith and Gvaudoin Tricou now haunt the residence, scaring off anyone who dares enter. Could they be responsible for the string of fright-wrought deaths on the property?

Another death has come in from off the coast, at the House of Fallen Trees estate. Fright seems to take the life of just about anyone who walks through those doors. In fact, {0.SimFirstName}'s records show 3 deaths in just the past year! What could be so scary about a house? Could it be truly cursed?

It's hard to believe {0.SimFirstName} had the guts to step foot in that house, let alone exhume the burials. There's no sure way of knowing if the reunification worked, but there's already been word that the estate's paranormal activity has died down. A grave keeper did mention heightened activity at the cemetery, but that's probably just a coincidence, right? ...Right?
Stopping a haunt is not {0.SimFirstName}'s job.

With almost an ethereal sense, {0.SimFirstName} was able to track down the ghouls responsible for this whole mess. But, like most ghost tales, these unfortunate events were never with malicious intent. There are just some Sims out there who can't handle the paranormal! It's hard to say why these ghosts linger here, but {0.SimFirstName} hopes that with certain ghostly behavioral adjustments the hauntings won't inadvertently take any more lives.
The whole situation goes far beyond what {0.SimFirstName} can do, but knowing who to call was pretty impressive.

That previous case just keeps itching in the back of {0.SimFirstName}'s mind. {0.SimPronounSubjective} can't let it go. Apparently, records showed two registered plots located at that estate, House of the Fallen Tree. If {0.SimFirstName} were to use certain connections and job expertise, could {0.SimPronounSubjective} reunite these burials with the other family plots and end the hauntings?
A truly generous offer! {0.SimFirstName} should be wary not to do it too often, lest {0.SimPronounSubjective} bankrupt {0.SimPronounReflexive}. Even in death, debt follows.
Unfortunately business is business, and no special treatment is allowed. {0.SimFirstName} can't help but feel a bit sorry for the client though...
An unfortunate financial crisis is affecting one of {0.SimFirstName}'s clients. It's hard living in this economy, even as someone who is not living. Will {0.SimFirstName}'s kindness peek through?

The Tricous were the original owners of the estate. Unfortunately, not a single relative remains alive. There's no record of foul play in any of the deaths; however, online thanatology enthusiasts claim otherwise. A lot of fingers point towards Jennicor Tricou as the main suspect in some truly dastardly deeds. The internet can really come up with some wild theories...
Further digging revealed quite a number of deaths on the grounds. Including an entire family, the estate's original owners. {0.SimFirstName} notices they all died under suspicious means. How tragic.
It's probably best to leave it alone. Unless a detective comes knocking, what's the point of getting wrapped up in this?
It might not be {0.SimFirstName}'s job to investigate, but that doesn't mean it's not somebody's job.

The morgue has been receiving deaths from off the coast, at an estate called 'House of the Fallen Tree'. Odd name. Their records are riddled with mysterious deaths dating back decades. {0.SimFirstName} is hesitant to dig any further. What if someone out there wants this to stay buried?

While that may work, or at the very least sound really cool, in movies, {0.SimFirstName} did not get a great response after egging on the ghoul. They live to tell the tale, but their office rests in pieces.
Grim appeared, oddly with what seemed to be an intern in tow? He managed to wrangle the ghost into his pocket and poofed away. Problem solved?

Fighting while dead at least takes the pressure off of a fight to the death. Luckily, {0.SimFirstName} has been hitting the gym. It didn't take long to overpower this ghoul and send them back where they belong.

{0.SimFirstName} kept chanting 'Jennicor Tricou...Jennicor Tricou' as the ghost shrieked in horror. {0.SimFirstName} carried on, reading aloud a list of names from Jennicor's family. Jennicor wailed and crashed out the window, never to be seen again.

A ghost is haunting the funeral home! How fitting... Either {0.SimFirstName} brought this on or someone in the morgue has been messing with something they shouldn't have. An angry spirit whips through the showroom, crashing caskets to the floor and shattering vases full of floral arrangements. {0.SimFirstName} has to stop them!
Although the facts about revivals that {0.SimFirstName} has published are true, Grim is not happy about the implications that this will have on his Soul Quota.

{0.SimFirstName}'s report is music to Grim's ears (if he has them). Looks like there is room for growth in this company after all! As long as this department keeps meeting their weekly Soul Quota, that is!
Death is trending up... but needs to be higher!

The stats say that the most common way for Sims to kick the bucket is old age, and death by fire comes in second place. I mean, it makes sense that most Sims live out their life till the end, but no doubt it starts to get boring for Grim. Death trends are looking good, but {0.SimFirstName} notices another pesky stat about death revivals increasing over time. What should {0.SimPronounSubjective} put in the report?
Sold! Congratulations to the highest bidder, which appears to be...Grim! Oh, that's awkward. The next run in at the coffee machine in the break room is no doubt going to be awkward.
Sell information to the highest bidder.

The news {0.SimFirstName} leaked on Social Bunny is gaining traction! No doubt this information is going to be trending soon! Wait a second... it's all gone? All of the links to Grim's reaping count are dead. Suddenly {0.SimFirstName} can feel Grim's endless shadowy stare looming behind {0.SimPronounObjective}. Not wanting to become another statistic, {0.SimFirstName} decides to get back to work and hopes that Grim can forgive and forget.

Due to a technical error, Grim's reaping count has become accessible. Looking at these numbers, {0.SimFirstName} is amazed! Grim's reaping count is insane! I mean, considering Grim has been doing these reapings for centuries, it can't be too surprising, but {0.SimFirstName} is still blown away and wonders who else might be interested in this information?
Grim is impressed by {0.SimFirstName}'s initiative! Scouting the perfect location is in progress as we speak!

Stats say that Death by Killer Rabbit is not trending as high as it could be. This gives {0.SimFirstName} an idea! What if Grim could start a petting zoo featuring these fluffy little monsters? This idea could certainly increase the stats! But how could we promote this endeavor? Surely we would need to warn Sims of the potential danger...or do we?

{0.SimFirstName} approaches the Ghosts and explains that while they can't be aimlessly floating about, {0.SimFirstName} would love to interview them. The wayward Ghosts gasp, honored and flattered by the proposition. They happily agree, resulting in an eye-opening chat and a short break for {0.SimFirstName} to enjoy.

{0.SimFirstName} chooses to investigate and handle the problem by the book. The wayward Ghosts are caught by surprise, seemingly embarrassed that their master plan was thwarted. In a last-ditch effort, the lead Ghost tries to convince {0.SimFirstName} to let them stay by doing the missing thumb magic trick and finishing with enthusiastic jazz hands. Unamused, {0.SimFirstName} tells them to go back to where they belong and then continues to complete the routine checks.

As {0.SimFirstName} is in the middle of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} routine checks, a big red Warning appears. Apparently there are some wayward Ghosts milling about, which is an odd occurrence so close to the portal. {0.SimFirstName} is curious of their true motives but wonders whether they will be straight with {0.SimPronounObjective} and tell the truth.

{0.SimFirstName} proudly walks out after the full hour, looking a little worse for wear but still in one piece. {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} coworker stares at {0.SimFirstName}, awkwardly scratching the back of their head before reluctantly agreeing to honor the bet. Ah, who cares about the potential permanent damage that an hour in the Netherworld might cause? At least {0.SimFirstName} isn't cleaning the employee bathroom today!
Though thrilling, the Netherworld is no place for the living. Bathroom duty isn't that terrible and is much better than whatever may have happened if {0.SimFirstName} stayed in there any longer!

A coworker has bet {0.SimFirstName} that {0.SimPronounSubjective} wouldn't be able to last an hour in the Netherworld. This particular coworker isn't the type to back down, but whoever can stay the longest and wins, is off the hook for cleaning the employee bathroom. Not one to shy away from a dare, {0.SimFirstName} considers what to do next.

It was a tough choice, but at the end of the day, this task had to be done. Unfortunately it took a lot out of {0.SimFirstName} to manage this work, making {0.SimPronounObjective} feel exhausted and uncomfortable.

{0.SimFirstName} went with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} gut and checked on those pesky Netherworld seals. Whoever did this job last didn't fully repair the rifts, resulting in some concerning leakage! Getting this fixed is top priority and gives {0.SimFirstName} the opportunity to learn something new, too!

There are many tasks one can do when inspecting the Netherworld for quality. Unfortunately, {0.SimFirstName} can't complete every task at once, so a decision needs to be made. Today there have been reports of the seals between the portal opening, which could be a potential disaster. Another report of Ghosts getting stuck in the Netherword's access point to the Baleful Bog is also on the radar. What task will {0.SimFirstName} take on?

Although it feels odd, {0.SimFirstName} understands that this is possibly a natural part of the circle of death. After all, {0.SimPronounSubjective} might even learn how to make this delicacy {0.SimPronounReflexive} one day. {0.SimFirstName} can't help but wonder what that specific soul tasted like? Probably a little too salty after that demise.
Try as {0.SimFirstName} might, {0.SimPronounSubjective} cannot save these lost souls. Unfortunately this is just a part of the larger cycle of death and the natural order of things.

As {0.SimFirstName} stares into the hypnotizing swirling colors within the Scry Bowl, an alarming message is received. Lost souls are making their way into...soup?! How morbid! Should {0.SimFirstName} try and save these souls or accept that there is much more for {0.SimPronounObjective} to learn about the inner workings of Thanatology?
{0.SimFirstName} chooses to look the other way. They promise to return to their proper place, they just want a bit of fresh air. Back by sundown, they promise!

Sorry wisps, maybe next time. {0.SimFirstName} has to follow through with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} job. The N.W.D.D. takes over from here. {0.SimFirstName} hears through the grapevine the wisps are sad to lose their freedom, but the N.W.D.D. are thrilled with them being back where they belong. Phew, looks like {0.SimFirstName} made the right call.
It appears there are some wandering wisps out of place. {0.SimFirstName} knows for a fact that they aren't lost and are actually hoping to stray a bit further.
{0.SimFirstName} sends a coworker to Waylon to demand he give up the soul and he...surprisingly easily relents. It's likely Waylon won't change his ways, so it's best to keep an eye on him.
{0.SimFirstName} decides to let it go, but Grim is displeased. Apparently Grim places loyalty above all else.

While gazing into the swirling vortex, {0.SimFirstName} is able to see that Waylon has some souls in his wares that have not been authorized by Grim. Should {0.SimPronounSubjective} send a coworker to the Crypt and handle Waylon or just let it go?
