<font color='#FF0000'>You have not earned this option yet, but you can still earn it by continuing your Soul's Journey as a Playable Ghost.</font>

Rebirth

Rebirth into a new Sim, either in the same household or a different one. You will have the opportunity to fully customize the appearance of this Reborn Sim and assign available non-romantic relationships with new household members in Create a Sim.

As a Reborn Sim, you'll retain certain connections from your previous life, such as new relationship bits with close Sims and access to new social interactions. Once choosing to Rebirth, you will lose all Soul's Journey progress and will not be able to undo this action.

<font color='#FF0000'>A Funeral where the Sim is set in the Deceased Role cannot be held for Sims who have been Reborn. Funerals can still be created without selecting a Deceased Sim.</font>

\n\nRebirth into a new life with faded memories of those you once knew. You will be taken to Manage Worlds to select a household to Rebirth your new Sim into. If you've earned the Burning Soul Trait, your soul will be able to manifest pieces of past personality traits along with certain others. If you choose to Rebirth as a younger Sim, you will have certain developmental skills immediately unlocked giving you a head start in your new journey.
{0.SimFirstName} has already created as many heirlooms as {0.SimPronounSubjective} can handle!
Once the 25 Tarot Cards in Ravenwood have been found, Summon Grim to aid you in your quest and complete the deck.
{0.SimFirstName} isn't quite old enough to care about such things yet.
All of {0.SimFirstName}'s Unfinished Business is, well, finished! Well done!
{0.SimFirstName} has done everything possible with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} bucket list! At least for now...

{0.SimFirstName} will need some additional life experience in order to write specific goals. This perspective is available for Sims who:
• Attend an Afterlife Anonymous group meeting in the ruins in Ravenwood's Mourningvale neighborhood
• Witness another Sim die recently
• Have the Chased by Death trait (time may be short for them, so they have a solid perspective of their priorities!)

An excerpt from the essay "The Stairs of Ruin" by Edward Talon-Crow, published one week after being dumped by San Myshuno furniture mogul Pernilla Lunvik, who famously ran off with her spellcaster paramour. "We ascend the stairs of life and death unendingly, every ounce of effort lost to the ether as we toil forever. When is this loss ever more painful than in the form of unrequited love? Few things appall me more than watching my efforts be taken, stomped in the dirt, and left to wither by someone who once claimed to love me. Bitter are the days I've survived recently. The air in this accursed city reeks of shady industry, broken dreams, and more heinously, magic. I once beheld modern magic as a joyous advancement for Simkind, but now the wicked art leaves me wishing for a simpler age. I daresay we have ascended these stairs to unsustainable heights! Mark my words, there is little good to come of spellcasting, only melancholy! Perhaps I shall find my respite in the quiet hills of another horizon, far away from this city of smog-tinged sadness."

Depleted Stamina\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s Ghost Stamina is now completely depleted and the intense exertion of Ghost Mastery has left {0.SimPronounObjective} appearing completely faded. {0.SimFirstName} is now no longer able to perform any abilities in this state and must wait for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina to replenish or take a Spectral Slumber to recharge back up to Low Stamina.

Critical Stamina\n\n{0.SimFirstName} is in a state of Critical Ghost Stamina and the intense use of Ghost Mastery has left {0.SimPronounObjective} appearing more faded. When {0.SimFirstName} completely depletes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will no longer be able to perform any abilities. {0.SimFirstName} must wait for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina to replenish or take a Spectral Slumber to recharge faster!
Healthy Stamina\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s ghostly energy is overflowing and brimming with spectral vitality! At this state, {0.SimPronounSubjective} can perform Ghost Mastery abilities with ease.

Fading Stamina\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s stamina is slowly fading and the continuous use of Ghost Mastery has left {0.SimPronounObjective} appearing a bit less vibrant. When {0.SimFirstName} completely depletes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will no longer be able to perform any abilities. {0.SimFirstName} must wait for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina to replenish or take a Spectral Slumber to recharge faster!

Low Stamina\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s stamina is low and the continuous use of Ghost Mastery has left {0.SimPronounObjective} appearing more faded. When {0.SimFirstName} completely depletes {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will no longer be able to perform any abilities. {0.SimFirstName} must wait for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Stamina to replenish or take a Spectral Slumber to recharge faster!

You have ascended to become one of the most formidable ghostly entities in both the Living world and the Afterlife! Continue mastering your abilities and unlock your full potential by earning additional Experience Points.

{0.SimFirstName} has now become the most powerful Ghost, Transcendent Wraith. With the ultimate ability, {0.SimPronounSubjective} now carries unparalleled influence. Embrace this pinnacle of Ghost Mastery with wisdom and might!
Congratulations! {0.SimFirstName} has now ascended from a mere Wispling to an Ethereal Novice! Unlock more abilities and continue the path towards Ghost Mastery!

Remarkable! {0.SimFirstName}'s Ghost Mastery has reached new heights and {0.SimPronounSubjective} is now a Phantasmal Ascendant! New, formidable powers await, granting greater influence over the living world. Time to embrace newfound strengths!

Incredible! {0.SimFirstName}'s ghostly prowess has reached an extraordinary level. As a Spectral Luminary, {0.SimPronounSubjective} now stands amongst the most elite ghosts. Continue to illuminate the path forward!

Finding Purpose\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s hard work pays off! {0.SimFirstName} will receive bonus gains to {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} career performance, extra discounts on any computer purchases, as well as access to the Share Soul's Journey social interaction!
The Road Ahead\n\n{0.SimFirstName}'s journey is just getting started! With this reward tier unlocked, {0.SimFirstName} receives extra Satisfaction Point gains!

Dreams Fulfilled\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has accomplished so much, but what else is out there to do? This sense of yearning emboldens {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} spirit with the power to Rebirth. As a ghost, {0.SimPronounSubjective} can choose to Rebirth at anytime by visiting Baleful Bog in the Mourningvale neighborhood of Ravenwood, or as a living Sim {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be given the option to Rebirth at the moment of death!

Quite a Journey\n\nWhat a ride it's been! {0.SimFirstName} can now leave {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} lasting mark on the world by gaining the Pass Down social interaction, as well as the ability to create additional Heirloom objects.
Newfound Purpose\n\nDeath certainly offers a fresh perspective! {0.SimFirstName} now gains extra Ghost Mastery experience points!

No Regrets\n\nThanks to {0.SimFirstName}'s satisfaction, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will enjoy an extended life as a living Sim. As a ghost, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will also gain the ability to use the Move Onto the Great Beyond interaction on urns or gravestones when it's decided that it's time to permanently leave this world and embrace the next journey with peace and fulfillment.
Making Headway\n\n{0.SimFirstName} is gaining momentum! With this reward tier unlocked, enjoy extra skill gain bonuses to help {0.SimPronounObjective} through life!

The Big Picture With an unimaginable clarity of life, death, and everything between, {0.SimFirstName} now has enhanced stamina when performing Ghost Mastery! {0.SimFirstName} also acquired the coveted Burning Soul trait! With this trait {0.SimFirstName} can retain one personality trait from the previous life through the Recall Past Life self-interaction in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} next life. Additionally, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will also have access to the Peer into Soul interaction available on mirrors to inherit as many reward traits gained. If {0.SimFirstName} chooses to be reborn as a younger Sim, certain developmental skills will be instantly unlocked.

{0.SimFirstName} has reached the summit of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Soul’s Journey, manifesting the coveted Burning Soul Trait! With this {0.SimPronounSubjective} will now have resilient stamina when performing Ghost Mastery. When it's time for {0.SimFirstName} to Rebirth into the next life, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be able to retain one personality trait from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life through the Recall Past Life self interaction. {0.SimFirstName} will also have the Peer Into Soul interaction available on Mirrors to inherit as many reward traits gained! If {0.SimFirstName} is reborn as a younger Sim, it's a breeze! Certain developmental skills will be instantly unlocked. Celebrate the triumphant end of this epic journey and enjoy the fullness of a soul transformed!
{0.SimFirstName} has fulfilled {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} purpose and completed the Soul’s Journey!

{0.SimFirstName} has almost reached the zenith of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} journey, where the ties between life and the afterlife grow ever stronger through the Soul. This amazing achievement grants {0.SimFirstName} a bonus to all Ghost Mastery Experience Points gained!

When the time comes, {0.SimFirstName} can now choose to Rebirth! This pinnacle of the Soul's Journey allows {0.SimPronounObjective} to start anew as a fresh Sim, carrying with {0.SimPronounObjective} a touch of memories from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life. As a ghost, embrace this chance for a new life by choosing to Rebirth at Baleful Bog, or as a living Sim, opt for Rebirth at the Moment of Death!
{0.SimFirstName}'s soul shines brighter and feels more fulfilled with each step! As a reward, {0.SimFirstName} now enjoys a boost to all skill gains!

Fantastic progress! {0.SimFirstName}'s soul is finding its true purpose and radiating with newfound clarity. {0.SimFirstName} now receives a boost to Career performance and a discount on all Computer purchases! Plus, {0.SimPronounSubjective} can now share {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Soul’s Journey with other Sims through the new Share Soul’s Journey social interaction.

Remarkable progress! {0.SimFirstName} can now share and preserve treasured memories and legacies with others by unlocking the ability to create additional Heirlooms. {0.SimFirstName} can also now share some aspirational knowledge to other Sims through the Pass Down social interaction!

With each moment cherished and no regrets holding {0.SimFirstName} back, {0.SimPronounSubjective} can Move Onto the Great Beyond whenever {0.SimFirstName} decides it's time to leave as a ghost. {0.SimFirstName} now also has extended lifespan as a living Sim so that there's ample time to savor life to its fullest!
{0.SimFirstName} is off to a great start in {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Soul's Journey! With this achievement, {0.SimFirstName} now gains extra Satisfaction Points!
{0.SimFirstName} can now speak the dialect of Death himself and these deathly whispers have unlocked further Voodoo doll abilities! The realms are revealing themselves.
{0.SimFirstName} can now access more literature and purchase a Voodoo doll! Keep creeping closer to death's door, who knows what skeletons exist in that closet!
{0.SimFirstName} has started {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} postmortem studies! Continue delving into death to level up!

{0.SimFirstName} can source Grim for deeper learnings. {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} studies have enhanced {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} understanding of loss, thus granting {0.SimPronounObjective} some Mortuary benefits. Death certainly takes a toll!

{0.SimFirstName} casts off {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} mortal coil! Figuratively, that is. Understanding the other side allows {0.SimFirstName} to capture the essence of life and boil it down into a more useful concoction. With afterlife delights and the ability to Toy with Death, {0.SimFirstName} can live on and live after more comfortably.

Dip your toe into the Baleful Bog of knowledge by studying death and loss. Sims enticed by this grim calling will eventually be able to partake in the vocalization of a dying tongue or the creation of a soulful treat meant to boost a Sim's motivations. It's really a skill to die for!\n\nThe Thanatology Skill is increased by Reading Skill books, Reading Theories on a Computer, or Progressing in the Deathly Career.

Death caught up with these Sims at last. Without the constant threat of death looming over them, these Sims now feel free to embrace their souls' future. They still have a desire to achieve meaningful things, learn new skills, and complete their unfinished business. Now they may even feel amused and entertained by the threat of death.

Chased by Death Sims know that death follows their every move. While risky and dangerous behaviors may have deadly consequences, frequent near-death experiences give these Sims a desire to live each day to the fullest and progress along their soul's journey faster. Keenly aware of their own mortality, these Sims feel best when they are achieving something meaningful with their limited time left.
These Sims are more successful when interacting with Edith, who can be found at the Well of Longing and Regret in Ravenwood. They can also use the Unnerving Stare on other Sims.
Ghost Whisperers make friends (and more) with Ghosts more easily. They will also get particularly excited while encountering ghosts of all kinds, Grim, and even Crows!
During a mesmerizing experience of Transcendent {T0.Mess Around}{DAE0.WooHoo} with a ghost, {0.SimFirstName} has temporarily touched the realm of the afterlife!

Sims with this Grief Type often have intense frustration and frequent Angry Emotions, leading to outbursts and mean interactions. Sims can Cope Positively by Attending Grief Counseling, working out those frustrations in the gym (or at home) by Exercising or channeling {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} emotions through Playing Instruments. These activities can be a great outlet for all of that pent-up anger.

Sims with this Grief Type gain Bored and Fine moods as they turn away from processing their emotions while grieving. Sims can Cope Positively by Attending Grief Counseling, Gardening, Painting, Writing, Cooking, or Playing Instruments. If this Sim stays in Denial, their Grief can evolve into Anger or Blues Grief Types, prolonging their Grief.

Sims with this Grief Type frequently experience Sad Emotions and are prone to gloomy interactions. Sims can Cope Positively by Attending Grief Counseling, Reading, Painting, improving their Logic Skill, practicing Wellness, or Playing Instruments. These activities can help lift their spirits and provide a healthy outlet for their emotions.

Sims with this Grief Type manage their Grief with a positive outlook on life. They try to project Confident Emotions during the day to day, however sometimes Sad Emotions are able to slip their way in. Sims can cope with their Grief by Attending Grief Counseling and any other positive activities that enrich life. While Holding It Together is admirable, this Sim may find that their Grief transitions into Anger or Blues Grief Types, prolonging their Grief.

The offspring of the Grim Reaper carry an air of mystique. A scythe-shaped birthmark on their neck serves as a haunting reminder of their otherworldly lineage and their inevitable connection to the cycle of life and death.
Offspring from a Grimborn Sims carry on the legacy of the Reaper!

Embrace your inner darkness - and your occasional intrusions of light. Macabre Sims are all about being their best, unique Sim self while still reveling in all that life (and the afterlife) has to offer.

{0.SimFirstName}'s soul burns bright! As a ghost, {0.SimFirstName} receives extra benefits to {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Ghost Mastery stamina, enabling {0.SimPronounObjective} to perform abilities more frequently. The Burning Soul trait persists beyond death, accompanying {0.SimFirstName} into {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} next life after Rebirth. {0.SimFirstName} can retain one personality trait from {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life with the Recall Past Life self-interaction, along with certain other traits by using the Peer Into Soul interaction available on mirrors. If {0.SimFirstName} is reborn as a younger Sim, certain developmental skills will be immediately unlocked. As an added bonus, young adults and older get the extraordinary ability to defy the boundaries of life and death, enabling Transcendent WooHoo as a living Sim. This trait is a one-time blessing, accompanying {0.SimFirstName} into {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} next life only once.

Someone in {0.SimFirstName}'s household Moved onto the Great Beyond and now new reflections of life, death, and everything in between stir within {0.SimPronounObjective}. These profound insights enhance {0.SimFirstName}'s ability to manage grief, making {0.SimPronounObjective} more resilient and likely to remain confident through difficult times. Additionally, it provides a boost to all Soul’s Journey gains, inspiring {0.SimFirstName} to enrich {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} own journey with newfound clarity and purpose.

This Sim has been reborn! Reborn Sims have special connections with Sims they once knew in their previous life and may have some somber feelings when visiting their old gravestones. Take this extra chance to live life to its fullest!

Sims with this trait have achieved an understanding of what exists beyond the veil. They hold a different feeling about death and can handle grief with better coping skills. Having formed a personal (and professional) relationship with Grim, these Sims can avoid an untimely end knowing there's more to death than life.
(From Reaching Level 10 of the Reaper Career)
Not entirely trusting of the majority of things you see or hear? Skeptical Sims like to challenge the universe to provide concrete proof that something is indeed as it might appear.

As your Sim makes progress on the Soul's Journey, various rewards will be unlocked! Track progress on how far your Sim has made by viewing the meter fill up. You can hover over each icon in the Soul's Journey to learn more about each reward, which includes new social interactions, bonus satisfaction gains, and more!

As a living Sim with the reward tier Dreams Fulfilled unlocked, you will have the option to choose to Rebirth at the Moment of Death. Make sure to choose wisely as there will be no option to return once the decision is made. If you are a Ghost Sim, you can Rebirth at anytime by visiting Baleful Bog in the Mourningvale neighborhood of Ravenwood. Choose to Rebirth by selecting a spot in Baleful Bog and select Rebirth.

If you'd like to add new Bucket List or Unfinished Business goals to the list immediately, you can interact with a Computer or Journal to Write Goal and have a goal picked specially for your Sim. Or, if you'd like to narrow down the goal to come from a specific category of goals, you can Write Goal from Category.\n\nIf your Sim has the Chased by Death or Embraced by Death trait, has recently witnessed a Sim die, or attended an Afterlife Anonymous meeting, they have a new perspective that allows them to Write the Perfect Goal, which gives you the ability to hand-pick the goal your Sim will explore!

Bucket List or Unfinished Business goals are lifelong goals that will generally take a bit more time or effort to complete compared to most Aspiration goals, though they may range in difficulty!\n\nThese goals will generate gradually over time, as your Sim lives their life. The types of goals your Sim receives will often be based on their traits/experiences. If your Sim would rather go in a different direction, you can Scrap Bucket List or Unfinished Business on the Computer or Journal to reset their goals.

Child ghosts get a second chance at life too! Children Sims now have the option to age up to progress their Soul's Journey and unlock the option to Rebirth. Choose to Age Up your child Sim at Baleful Bog and become a teen ghost Sim to allow access to the Soul's Journey!

Performing good and evil Ghost Mastery abilities will grant Fear and Goodwill Essences to your Ghost Sim's Inventory! These essences can be sold to Waylon Warez, a mysterious merchant by the Crypt in Crow's Crossing of Ravenwood, for valuable profit!

While Ghost Sims by default change color based on their mood, you can now choose to Set Ghost Color for any Ghost Sim! This allows the Ghost Sim to maintain a specific color, regardless of their mood.

Ghost Sims can harness their full ghostly potential by unlocking powers and rising through the ranks in Ghost Mastery! To explore available perks, open the Ghost Mastery section in the Simology panel. As Ghost Sims use their unlocked abilities, they will earn experience points and gradually advance their tier in Ghost Mastery, affecting the living in more formidable ways!

There are now two ways to become a ghost: Create a Sim and Dying at the moment of death!\n\nIn Create a Sim you can create a Ghost by selecting the cause of death next to the Aspiration trait icon. To revert your Sim back to a living Sim, simply select the 'X' on the death trait icon. Once you have created a Ghost in Create a Sim, you will be able to access the Ghost Sim's urn in their inventory!

Keep an eye on Ghost Stamina! Overusing abilities will gradually drain a Ghost Sim’s stamina, causing them to appear more faded. You can track your Ghost Sim's Stamina in the Ghost Mastery panel. If your Ghost Sim’s Stamina hits zero, they’ll need to rest or enter a Spectral Slumber to recharge back up to Low Stamina before they can perform Ghost Mastery again!

When a Sim dies, you will be able to choose what type of Ghost they become. By choosing Become a Playable Ghost, the Sim will remain in the Household and continue to be playable as a Ghostly presence. Choose Become a Freeroaming Ghost if you would prefer this Sim live on as a Ghost in an unplayed Household. These Sims will no longer be a played Sim but can still be found in the World.

Peel back the veil to uncover the secret to richer Sim lives and beyond in the Life & Death Expansion Pack. Achieve your dreams in life by ticking items off your Bucket List or pursue them as a Ghost with Unfinished Business. There is a ghastly new world, Ravenwood, to haunt, a career that’ll bring you closer to Grim, Wills to write, Crypts to explore, and even a new Thanatology Skill to master. There are no real endings – only transitions – as you move between life, afterlife, and even Rebirth.

Once a Sim dies, their remains can be customized to fit that Sim's personality! By interacting with their current urn or tombstone, you can select Display as... to choose a style for their remains. After that you can go to Build Mode and use the Design Tool to change the swatch of the model, if you'd like.\n\nYou can also Turn On or Off Auto-Switch when interacting with an urn or tombstone. By default, Sim remains placed outdoors will display as tombstones, and change to urns when placed indoors. This is the behavior seen when Auto-Switch is turned on. Turning off Auto-Switch allows you to set either type to stay as, regardless of whether it's placed indoors or outdoors.

Crypts can be purchased from Build Mode and are also found in each neighborhood of Ravenwood. To add Sim remains, select the Crypt object and choose Urn and Gravestone Inventory, which allows you to drag a Sim's Urn or Gravestone directly into the Crypt.\n\nSims can tell Ghost Stories, Nap, WooHoo, and even embark on adventures when they Explore the Underground Crypts! When exploring, a Sim will disappear inside and can discover valuable rewards while on their quest. However, be warned, creepy encounters with otherworldly beings are also possible when descending into the Crypt.

Gravesites are objects that can be purchased in Build Mode, allowing you to slot Sim remains onto them and decorate them as you see fit. It's a lovely way to honor a loved one that passed with mementos, or a sneaky way to make fun of a deceased not-so-loved one with something they'd hate.\n\nOnce it's placed, you can drag an urn or tombstone onto the plot, which will designate that gravesite for that Sim's remains. You may also place a burial casket on a gravesite, and slot the remains into the casket!

The In Loving Memory: A Timeless Capture portrait object is another special way to commemorate those who have passed, even after they're already gone. Search for it in Build Mode or place it from the Life Event Activities category. Once placed, Sims can interact with it to Update Frame and Flowers. More importantly, they can Assign Sim to Memorial Portrait. They simply need to know someone who recently passed. This will display the passed Sim as they were at the moment of their death. To ensure this image doesn't change, simply select the portrait to Lock it. When paired with a Memorial Display that has already been dedicated or a Gravesite that has an Urn or Tombstone slotted into it, the portrait object will automatically update to the applicable Sim's portrait. Pro Tip: For further customization, photos from your Sim's Inventory can also be dragged into the portrait object at any time as long as it's not currently Locked.

Memorial Displays are a touching way to honor and remember passed Sims as well. There are two which are available in Build Mode. Just search "Memorial Display" or look for them in the Life Event Activities category. Once placed, select the Memorial Display and choose to Dedicate Memorial Display to either a Household or a specific Sim. If you change your mind, you can always select it again to Remove Memorial Display Dedication. Once dedicated, Sims can interact with the Memorial Display to Reminisce about Deceased or to Talk to.\n\nMemorial Displays can also be decorated. Try placing an Urn of someone who has recently passed, the Whispering Wren Messenger Statue to let your passed loved ones know how your Sims are feeling, some flowers, incense, or the In Loving Memory: A Timeless Capture portrait object. There isn't a wrong way to memorialize your loved ones.

Grief is a journey, and with every path, there are bumps along the way. You’ll notice that Denial and Holding It Together Grief Types have a chance to transition to Anger or Blues during the grieving period, so being proactive about Grief is beneficial to a Sim’s wellbeing.\n\nGrief always finds its way to acceptance eventually. However, it may change a Sim’s personality when all is said and done…either for better or worse, depending on how Grief was dealt with. Dealing with Grief is a natural part of life. With the right support, a Sim can come out stronger on the other side!

A Sim’s Grief Type can be found in the Traits section of the Simology Panel. This is where you'll see whether your Sim has the Anger, Blues, Denial, or Holding it Together Grief Type.\n\nThe Grief Type gained by a Sim is based on Sim Traits and (if applicable) their relationship. For example, Macabre Sims are less likely to gain Grief, and if they do, you will most likely find them with Denial or Holding It Together Grief Types. Grief will have its own set of behaviors for your Sim to navigate.

When a Sim experiences a difficult period in their life, Grief may surface. Tough situations, such as Loss of a Family Member or Close Friend, Loss of a Pet, Divorce, or Getting Fired from a Career can be trigger points for a Sim to begin the Grieving Process. Not all Sims surface Grief in the same way, and not all Sims will gain Grief. It can show itself as Anger, Blues, Denial, or Holding it Together. Each Grief Type comes with its own challenges and opportunities to grow! When a Sim gains Grief from losing a loved one, Grief is often delayed, taking a few days to take hold once the mourning period has ended and those Moodlets have subsided.

Sims can cope with Grief by engaging in uplifting, creative, or proactive activities. A Sim can Attend Grief Counseling, an interaction found by selecting the grieving Sim.\n\nCertain Sim activities are more helpful in coping with Grief, depending on the Sim’s Grief Type. Specific activities can be found by hovering over the Grief Icon in the Traits section of the Simology Panel.

Funerals provide an opportunity to gather, grieve, celebrate, and give Sims a chance to say their final goodbyes. There are multiple ways to plan a Funeral: Phone and Computer: To plan using the Phone, select the Sim’s Phone, then the Social Icon. You can then choose Plan Funeral from the list of options. While using a Computer, you can find Plan Funeral from the Household section of the Pie Menu. Urn or Gravestone: Select the deceased Sim’s Urn or Gravestone and choose Plan Funeral from the Pie Menu. As an added perk, planning a Funeral from the Urn or Gravestone will automatically set the Deceased Sim role in the Funeral Event panel. Calendar: Select the Calendar, which will bring up the Calendar UI. Here you can select a specific day to plan the Funeral in advance. Once you are set on the day, select Add Funeral Event from the list of events and choose the time you would like it to start. Using the Calendar feature is the only way to plan a Funeral Event in advance, otherwise the Funeral will begin once the event selection is complete.

There are objects found in Build Mode that are designed to work well with Funerals. Place the Funeral Podium during the event, which when selected, houses many Funeral interactions. Burial Caskets and Gravesites can store Sim remains and allow for Funeral interactions to be performed. Place a Memorial Display and Memorial Portrait and dedicate them to the deceased. If you would like a more celebratory event, place the Memorial Cannon to give the Sim the most epic send off!\n\nAlthough Guest Sims will grieve freely during a Funeral, interactions like Call Over Guests can help bring attention to certain activities that you would like to complete. Funeral Activities and Interactions can be found by selecting Sims, the Funeral Podium, and the Urn or Gravestone while a Funeral is in session.

When in the Funeral Planning UI, you can assign Sims to specific event roles. The Deceased Sim is the Sim that is being honored and the Host Sim is the Sim that is currently selected when planning the event. You can add Guest Sims, who are Sims known to the Deceased, and if you are concerned about the crowd size, feel free to add some Hired Mourners to the mix. An Entertainer Sim, once invited, will play an Instrument when it is available on the lot chosen for the event. Select the Guest Attire Color or Style to define how Guests should dress for the event. If nothing is selected, Guests will arrive in their set Formal Outfits. Select Activities for Sims to complete during this event. A serious, formal event might mean that Moment of Silence and Lighting Candles are the desired vibe, while a more laid-back celebration of life could call for Dancing and Giving Toasts. Once everything is set, all that’s left is setting a Location. Funerals can be held on a Home Lot, a Cemetery, or other Venue Lots that feel like they are the right fit for the type of Funeral being planned.

The Grim Reaper can be friendly, dependable, and...romantic? Sims can gain a deeper relationship with Grim by Socializing, Flirting, and even WooHooing! As Sims increase friendship with Grim, more socials become unlocked. Once a Sim has become Good Friends with Grim, they can even call Grim to hang out.

Sims can even Try for Baby with Grim, no matter the gender of the Sim! Grimborn Sims, the offspring of Grim, are born with a distinct Scythe Birthmark and will live a little longer than normal Sims. When Grimborn Sims have children, the Grim's Descendant trait is passed on to mark Grim's legacy.

Sims may battle it out in a game of life or death when they Challenge Grim to a Game when a Sim has died. In order to do this, the game must already be placed on the lot before death occurs. After a Sim has died, and Grim has shown up to do his business, select a living Sim in the Household, choose one of the supported games and challenge Grim!\n\nSupported games include: Chess, Darts (Get Together), Don't Wake the Llama (Get Together), Foosball (Get Together), Basketball (City Living), Ping-Pong (Discover University), Hopscotch (For Rent), Horseshoes (Outdoor Retreat), Bowling (Bowling Night).

Once an object has been made an Heirloom, your Sim can engrave a personal message on it to leave their mark for future generations! They can also Claim Higher Value on the object to ensure it increases in value each time it's passed on.

Heirloom Objects can be passed down via a Will when your Sim dies. Once your Sim has a Will created, you can interact with the Heirloom and select Pass on Heirloom to... to open the Heirloom Object inheritance menu. You must then choose a worthy Sim to inherit the object.\n\nThis can also be done by interacting with an existing Will in your Sim's Inventory. For more information on Wills, refer to the Wills section of Lessons!

Heirloom Objects are designated objects that have special value to Sims and may be passed down through generations of Sims via Wills. Many objects are worthy of being Heirlooms—crafted items and artworks, chairs, tables, decorations, and more!\n\nTo designate an Heirloom Object, select an eligible item and choose Make Heirloom. This will designate your current Sim as the original creator of that Heirloom. If inherited, your Heirloom will always commemorate the original creator of the heirloom!
Since this is an active career, you may choose to either send your Sim to work alone, or you may join them at HeadlessQuarters, the location of Grim’s office.

The Reaping Test Mannequin in the office can be selected to Practice Reaping. This action, when completed before going out on assignment, can contribute to a smoother Soul Collection.\n\nOther ways to prep for a Reap include Research Assignment and Perform Scythe Maintenance. Doing these activities before traveling to location prepares a Sim for their job and makes it less likely that the reap will fail.

Working in the Reaper Career also has its surprises. You may load into the office lot and find that mischievous ghosts have sabotaged the headquarters! Another day might require multiple reaps of Sims who have experienced a catastrophic event!\n\nOne constant, however, is the Weekly Souls Quota. Be sure to keep up on collecting and releasing Souls. You can learn about the Soul Quota by selecting a Computer at the office and choosing Check Soul Quota. If the Soul Quota is achieved over the week, the Sim will be rewarded with a gift from Grim's Box-O-Fun(eral)!

There are a few objects at the office that a Sim in the Reaper Career will use almost daily. The Scry Bowl is where a Sim will learn the assignment of the day and is usually the first stop for a Sim once entering the lot. The Netherworld Portal is where souls are released, usually done after each reaping.

Once on the job, a Sim in this career will be tasked to complete many different Goals. Once each goal is completed it will count towards the progress for the day.\n\nA Sim is awarded Bronze, Silver, or Gold, depending on the amount of tasks completed. This will impact the Sim’s Career Performance for their career level. Keeping performance up and completing Promotion Tasks outlined in the Career Panel will ensure that your Sim is promoted to the next level.

The Reaper Career is a new active career where a Sim will team up with Grim himself to perform reapings and other deathly tasks to keep the afterlife functioning. Join the Reaper Career by selecting the Sim’s Phone and locating the Business Icon. Once selected, choose Find Job from the list. A Sim can also join this career by selecting Grim and choosing Ask to Become Reaper.

The Burning Soul is a coveted trait given as a reward for completing the last tier of the Soul's Journey, The Big Picture. As a ghost, you can enjoy additional benefits such as being able to use less Ghost Stamina when performing Ghost Mastery abilities!\n\nAfter Rebirth, you will be able to choose one personality trait from your Sim's previous life through the Recall Past Life self-interaction! Additionally, the Peer Into Soul interaction available on mirrors, allows your Sim to recover some other traits acquired from their previous lives. Children, toddler, and infant Sims will also benefit from immediate boosts, with certain Milestones and Developmental Skills unlocked right from the start!

Reborn Sims also retain certain connections from their previous lives. Your Sim may recognize former family members or Soulmates, gaining special relationship bits that allow them to rebuild familiar bonds. New interactions will give your Sim the chance to rekindle these relationships. These connections help your reborn Sim pick up where they left off, making it easier to reestablish important relationships!

After choosing to Rebirth, whether at the Moment of Death or by visiting Baleful Bog, you will be taken to Manage Worlds to select your new household! The choice is completely up to you, choose to Rebirth into the same family or a completely new one!

Once you've selected a new household and lot to move into, you'll enter Create a Sim to customize your new Sim. The Resemble Past Sim allows you to adjust your Sim's facial structure, skin tone, and eye color to closely match the appearance of the previous Sim. Additionally, Play with Genetics enables you to modify your Sim's look based on the genetics of members from their new household.

Now the Rebirth path is complete! Your newly reborn Sim is ready to dive into a fresh start. Check out the Soul's Journey panel to see the Rebirth count, which keeps track of how many times your Sim has been reborn. Progress the Soul's Journey in this new life and unlock the reward to Rebirth again to keep the cycle of new beginnings rolling!

Rebirth allows your Sim to start a new life while retaining some pieces of their past. It’s a unique way to give your Sim a fresh start in the world! Whether you choose to rebirth as a completely new Sim, or a Sim that strongly resembles their past, the choice and story to tell is completely up to you!

You have the freedom to create and customize any new household members and set applicable relationships to them with your reborn Sim. Certain settings will be restricted such as any romantic relationships. If joining an existing household, existing traits and appearances cannot be modified. Once finished customizing your reborn Sim and additional household members, select Confirm to enter your new household!

The Soul's Journey is a new reward system to guide Sims through the later stages of life, offering self-fulfillment, closure, and even Rebirth! For living Sims, the Soul's Journey becomes available once they reach a young adult, while ghost Sims can start their Soul's Journey early as a teen!\n\nLiving Sims have a Bucket List, that can be filled with goals they hope to fulfill before they die. Ghost Sims will have Unfinished Business, consisting of goals that they're aiming to achieve before moving on. Completing goals from this list will earn your Sim progress through their Soul's Journey track.

In addition to fulfilling goals from the Bucket List or Unfinished Business, the Soul's Journey can also progress by completing things like Aspirations and Wants! Whether it's working toward life's greater purpose or satisfying everyday desires, each achievement counts towards a Sim's Soul's Journey!

Learn about Tarot, Tarot Collecting, and the Order of Lenore by locating the Tarot Tome Shrine that can be found in each neighborhood of Ravenwood. Once a Sim has interacted with this object, they are now able to find and collect Tarot Cards hidden throughout the world.
To jump right into Tarot without finding the cards, the Bibbity-Basic's Tarot Deck can be purchased from Build Mode. Once placed, this object can be added to a Sim's Inventory for use.

The Tarot Tome Shrine will reveal key Sims who are happy to reward Tarot Cards to your Sim in exchange for completing Favors. Cards are also hidden all over Ravenwood and can be found by exploring the Crypt, digging in specific areas, and using a little Intuition.\n\nOnce all 26 cards are collected, the deck can be created by selecting the card stack in the Sim Inventory and choosing Create Deck. Lady Ravendancer Goth's Tarot Deck is now complete and can be used while in the Sim's Inventory.

If you ever get stuck searching for a card, navigate to the Household Collections panel, which can be found by selecting the gem icon in the Sim's Inventory. In the section marked Tarot Cards, hovering over an empty card slot will reveal a cryptic hint as to where this specific card can be gained.

With the deck in the Sim Inventory, select the Tarot Deck object to complete interactions. With the Bibbity-Basic's Tarot Deck, a Sim can Draw a Daily or Nightly Reading and Offer Tarot Reading to others.\n\nLady Ravendancer Goth's Tarot Deck, which is gained through collecting cards (and also available in the Reward Store) allows for a few extra special interactions. With this deck in a Sim's Inventory, they can also perform Meditative Divination which allows them to Summon Lady Ravendancer, perform Affirmation Healing, and perform Divine Slumber interactions.

This skill can be gained by reading Thanatology Skill books, Reading Theories on Sim mysteries on a Computer, and by Looking up Historical Deaths on a Bookshelf. This skill can also be gained in the Reaper and Undertaker careers.\n\nIf The Sims 4 Discover University is installed, a Sim can also take elective courses to learn more about Thanatology, do research on an Archive Machine, and debate Afterlife or After Living.

Thanatology is the study of Death and the practices associated with it. Sims can master this skill, giving them new interactions such as Discuss Deadly Enigmas with Grim, learn how to Speak a Dead Language and cook Soul Soup.

If your Sim or Household is inheriting something via a dead Sim's Will, you should receive a copy of their Will in the mail shortly.\n\nOnce your Sim receives the Will, they must Read the Will Out Loud for it to take effect and receive whatever was inherited. Simoleons and Dependents should arrive immediately, and you will receive any inherited Heirloom Objects in your Sim's Household Inventory.

A Will is a document that allows your Sim to pass on their assets to their current household members, or other households, depending on what's being passed down.\n\nWhen your Sim starts their Will, they'll receive one directly in their inventory. Wills can be started on a Computer with the Start Will interaction. Your Sim can also start their will by hiring an Inheritance Lawyer service on the Phone!

Certain designations made in Wills will only go into effect if the Sim is the last Sim in the household to die. The following Will designations will go into effect when the individual Sim dies, regardless of the rest of the household: • Passing on Heirlooms • Funeral activities & wishes for Sim remains The following Will designations will only go into effect if the Sim who wrote the Will is the last Sim aged Teen or older in the household to die (which means there are no other Sims aged Teen or older left in the household): • Passing on Simoleons • Moving Dependents to a new guardian Household

Once a Will is created, it can be updated by interacting with it directly. As for inheritance, Sims can select individual Sim recipients for their Heirloom Objects. They can also decide where Simoleons are sent, whether it's Charity or to another Household. They can also designate a new home household for their Dependents (Sims of Child age or younger, and pets).

For personal wishes, Sims can decide what they would like their remains to be housed in, and the style of their gravestone or urn. They can also indicate their wishes for funeral activities.

Your Sim can also leave a personal message that will be read to recipient Sims, along with an associated emotion to really drive home the message you're choosing to send to the next generation!

Welcome to Ravenwood, a spooky and mysterious World that bridges the gap between the living and the unliving. Here Sims can participate in any of the six festivals across the three neighborhoods, explore Crypts and haunted buildings, embark on ghostly quests, collect rare ingredients, find Lady Ravendancer Goth's legendary Tarot deck, meet collector Sims, and more...

There are Collector Signs and Sims in each of the three neighborhoods. What's a Collector? Well it's a Sim who will buy your Collection items! You can Read Sign to learn more about their schedule, then show up when a Collector is around to sell those extra items and earn a few Simoleons in the process.

In the heart of Ravenwood, Crow's Crossing is a small village founded by Moppy the Goat and rumored to be frequented by Ghosts and regular hauntings. Visit the Mysterious Merchant in the old Specter graveyard for a variety of oddities, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine on the edge of town, explore an abandoned house, or seek out the Well of Longing and Regret for a chance to make wishes come true. Just watch out for Edith! Crow's Crossing hosts a variety of Festivals: • Try Before You Die Casket Sale • Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life • Ravenwood Family Day Be sure to check out the Town Hall for more information.

There's something otherworldly about Mourningvale. Maybe it’s the way the wind howls through the moss-draped trees, the eerie clang from the Bell Tower at odd hours, or the sentient plants. No matter the reason, many Ghosts choose to call this place home. The Grim Reaper has even been known to wander through now and then! Sims can find the Baleful Bog here, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine by the Bell Tower, or listen to the whispers of the Guardian Tree and Alice. Mourningvale hosts a variety of Festivals: • Afterlife Anonymous • Thinned Festiveil Be sure to check out the Town Hall for more information.

Nestled in the rolling hills of Ravenwood's countryside, Whispering Glen offers a quiet, rural locale for those hoping to take a step away from all the local hauntings and into a slow-paced lifestyle. Steeped in ruins and rumors, it's paradise for collectors and historians alike. Explore the local Crypt, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine at the base of the ruins, garden in the shared community plots, or just round out a Collection. Whispering Glen also hosts a nightly festival beside the Ancestor face cliff: • The Moon Revelry (Clothing Optional during the Full Moon)

Each neighborhood in Ravenwood hosts its very own Tarot Tome Shrine. These shrines explain the mysterious origins of the Order of Lenore and their quest to reunite the missing cards from Lady Ravendancer Goth's legendary Tarot Deck. Interact with these shrines to begin your Sim's journey. Learn more in the Tarot Lesson in this section.

Tarot Tome Shrines can be found at the following locations:
• Crow's Crossing: On the outskirts of town amongst the forest's edge.
• Whispering Glen: In the bowels of an abandoned ruin, shrouded in fog as the moon rises.
• Mourningvale: Near to the Bell Tower.

You can also interact with the Town Hall or Collector Signs in each neighborhood to pan the camera to the shrine locations.
Whenever you're ready, visit the Mourningvale neighborhood in Ravenwood and select a spot in Baleful Bog to Rebirth! Hover over the new trait Burning Soul to explore additional benefits!

{0.SimFirstName} will be given the option to Rebirth at the moment of death! Once {0.SimFirstName} starts {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} next life, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be given a new trait Reborn, allowing {0.SimPronounObjective} to hold some lingering connections to {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} previous life.

Level up to earn more Experience Points!\n\nGhost Sims can level up to the next tier by continuing to master and perform unlocked abilities. Advancing to the next tier, grants access to unlock even more powerful ghostly abilities.
Select perks to purchase before confirming.
Unlock abilities with Experience Points and ascend to become the most formidable ghost!
The Cemetery is a great place to some well-urned relaxation time.
(From being a Vampire at a Cemetery)
The Cemetery is a respectful place for Urns and Gravestones. Come here to mourn lost loved ones or take a moment of quiet contemplation.
Though the office work can be tedious, each parchment signed and every ledger updated carries immense importance, ensuring the balance between life and the afterlife remains intact.
The best way to overcome a Fear of Death is to become Friends with Death.
Let me tell you about last time I almost died. It wasn't scary at all!
Being a Ghost is hard! Talking about the hard points with other Ghosts can help ease the difficulties.
The Ghosts are all here for each other, and giving support is just as important as receiving it.
That chest is pretty banged up from being possessed all the time! Time to release some stress.
Wills: maybe not the happiest of topics, but there is comfort in security and knowing your affairs are in order.
Everyone knows crows love gifts! Sometimes they even give them back.
The fountain water is slimy with frogs. It might get a little dirty, but it shouldn't be hard to catch one, right?
But what happens if you make the crow mad? Don't we all want to know?
Specters are so cute! They probably give the best little gifts!
Dance under the moon's light, near the embracing heat of the bonfire at the Moon Revelry festival.
There's something so magical about laying in a moon beam. Don't worry, no ghostly flames here; Moonbathe away!
Take a brisk swim under the moon's light at the Moon Revelry festival.

The Guardian Tree has long stood in this location, drawing power and maybe even his sentience from the waters of the Baleful Bog. Locals celebrate his cryptic wisdom and thank him for being a place of respite by offering gifts!
No need to be wary of these wares...the merchant at the Thinned Festiveil has killer deals!
What's in the cards for this Sim? Only time will tell! And also maybe the local Tarot Reader.
Lending a helping hand from beyond? How delightful!
Time to put Ghost Mastery into action!
The allure of a spectral romance is simply irresistible!
{1.SimFirstName} wants to get in touch with the living and the dead in a celebration of life.
Make a friend for life—and the afterlife.
{1.SimFirstName} wants to complete {1.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} collection of all 26 cards!
{1.SimFirstName} is in need of a grave adventure!
I wish I may, I wish I might not.
Time's a ticking. Don't squander it.
Collecting Souls are a key aspect of the Reaper Career and building toward that Soul Quota!
After earning such powers it is wise to use them!
Get on Grim's good side by taking an interest in his work.
Meeting new Sims makes life a little bit spicier.
Dig deep! You never know what you'll find.
It's a seller's market! Time to let go of some art.
Admiration is the second most sincere form of flattery.
Discussing the mysteries of the great beyond can be a fun past time.
Flex your Thanatology knowledge by conversing in the forgotten prose of the past.
A delightful dish to fulfill one's soul...with another.
Knock out some life goals before dying, which hopefully won't be soon!

There's something otherworldly about Mourningvale. Maybe it’s the way the wind howls through the moss-draped trees, the eerie clang from the Bell Tower at odd hours, or the sentient plants. No matter the reason, many Ghosts choose to call this place home. The Grim Reaper has even been known to wander through now and then! Sims can find the Baleful Bog here, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine by the Bell Tower, or listen to the whispers of the Guardian Tree and Alice. Mourningvale hosts a variety of Festivals: • Afterlife Anonymous • Thinned Festiveil Be sure to check out the Town Hall for more information.

Nestled in the rolling hills of Ravenwood's countryside, Whispering Glen offers a quiet, rural locale for those hoping to take a step away from all the local hauntings and into a slow-paced lifestyle. Steeped in ruins and rumors, it's paradise for collectors and historians alike. Explore the local Crypt, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine at the base of the ruins, garden in the shared community plots, or just round out a Collection. Whispering Glen also hosts a nightly festival beside the Ancestor face cliff: • The Moon Revelry (Clothing Optional during the Full Moon)
Ever wonder where the Grim Reaper operates from? It's here! He's since branched out into a more corporate affair to deal with the rising influx of Sims in need of some reaping.

Crow's Crossing is a village founded by Moppy the Goat and rumored to be frequented by Ghosts and regular hauntings. Visit the Mysterious Merchant in the old Specter graveyard, investigate the Tarot Tome Shrine on the edge of town, explore an abandoned house, or grant a wish at the Well of Longing and Regret. Just watch out for Edith! Crow's Crossing hosts a variety of Festivals: • Try Before You Die Casket Sale • Crow's Crossing Celebration of Life • Ravenwood Family Day Be sure to check out the Town Hall for more information.
